Title: Data Analyst - Fintech
Description:
At Leadtech, we've been redefining digital businesses since 2009, creating innovative online solutions that reach millions of users every month. With a diverse team of over 700 members from 23+ nationalities, we're united by a passion for creativity and collaboration.

We specialize in delivering user-centric experiences across web and mobile platforms, where people can connect with our products like never before.

We're proud of our global reach and committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where every individual contributes to our shared vision of bringing cutting-edge projects to life. Learn more about our journey and mission on our About Us page!

About The Role

Due to continuous growth, we are seeking an ambitious and detail-oriented Data Analyst - Payments Specialist to drive data-led insights and support our payments strategy during a critical expansion phase. As a fast-growing B2C company with a strong presence in the US and European markets, we are focused on scaling our brand, optimising payment performance, and enhancing fraud prevention. This role requires a strong analytical mindset and a deep understanding of digital payment ecosystems, transactional data, and customer behaviour. You will play a key role in analysing payment trends, identifying inefficiencies, preventing fraud, and enabling data-driven decision-making across our payments and risk operations.

Key Responsibilities:

You're our perfect candidate if you:


Investigate, prioritise, and document anomalies in payments data and fraud patterns to support rapid issue resolution and risk mitigation
Use advanced Excel skills (e.g., VLOOKUPs, pivot tables, IF conditions) to analyse payment transactions, identify unusual behaviour, and support reconciliation efforts
Ensure data accuracy across payment systems by validating transaction records and flagging inconsistencies or suspicious activity
Identify trends in payment failures, chargebacks, and fraud attempts to drive process improvements and reduce financial risk
Implement consumer data acquisition strategies and e-commerce analytics with a focus on optimising payment funnel performance and detecting fraud signals
Build and apply consumer segmentation and profiling models to detect high-risk behaviours and improve fraud prevention tactics
Respond to data analysis requests from fraud teams, compliance, finance, and operations with a focus on payment performance and fraud detection insights
Retrieve, clean, and prepare transactional data for deep analysis of payment patterns, fraud triggers, and refund behaviours
Contribute to daily, weekly, monthly, and annual reporting on payments KPIs, fraud rates, authorization success rates, and risk events
Perform in-depth analysis on large volumes of payments and fraud-related data using advanced techniques to extract actionable insights
Define and enforce data quality standards specific to payments and fraud monitoring systems, ensuring high confidence in real-time decisions
Maintain expertise in analytics tools and practices relevant to payments processing, fraud detection, and compliance reporting
Collaborate with engineering, product, risk, and business intelligence teams to embed data quality controls across payments and fraud pipelines
Create and optimise metrics and dashboards to monitor payment success, fraud incidents, transaction declines, and risk thresholds
Communicate key insights on payment performance and fraud trends to stakeholders, driving cross-functional initiatives for improvement
Research discrepancies in payment data and correct records to ensure accurate transaction histories and trustworthy reporting
Monitor real-time analytics dashboards for drops in payment success rates or spikes in fraud indicators, enabling swift investigation and escalation
Review and act on data control alerts related to payment processing, chargebacks, fraud scoring models, and transaction integrity
Continuously analyse payment flows to detect fraud attempts, reduce false positives, and improve approval rates through data-driven strategies


Requirements

Your expertise in a nutshell:


3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, in payments, fraud, or transactional data
Strong SQL skills and experience with large datasets and relational databases
Proficient in BI/reporting tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker) and Excel.
Solid understanding of digital payment systems, chargebacks, fraud indicators, and PSPs
Experience with data modelling, ETL processes, and data quality best practices
Familiarity with Python, R, or statistical tools (SPSS, SAS) is a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail
Ability to communicate findings clearly to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Proactive, well-organized, and adaptable in a fast-paced environment
Fluent in English, both written and spoken
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Computer Science)


YOUR TEAM:


We're team-first. If you believe in the power of collaboration and thatthe team's success is your success,then you're one of us!
Fun is fundamental. We believe in forming strong bonds in and outside the oce. That's why we have a team-building budget and organize activities to enjoy ourselves.
Positivity wins the day. Bring a positive attitude and communicate openly. Self-awareness and an openness to learn are always a plus


Benefits

WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US?

Growth and career development


At Leadtech, we prioritize your growth. Enjoy a flexible career path with personalized internal training and an annual budget for external learning opportunities


Work-Life balance


Benefit from a flexible schedule with flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. start, 3:30 - 6 p.m. end) and the option of working full remote or from our Barcelona office. Enjoy free Friday afternoons with a 7-hour workday, plus a 35-hour workweek in July and August so you can savor summer!


Comprehensive benefits


Competitive salary, full-time permanent contract, and top-tier private health insurance (including dental and psychological services)
25 days of vacation plus your birthday off, with flexible vacation options‚Äîno blackout days!


Unique Perks


If you wish to come, in our office in Barcelona you'll find it complete with free coffee, fresh fruit, snacks, a game room, and a rooftop terrace with stunning Mediterranean views
Additional benefits include ticket restaurant and nursery vouchers, paid directly from your gross salary


Join us in an environment where you're free to innovate, learn, and grow alongside passionate professionals. At Leadtech, you'll tackle exciting challenges and be part of a vibrant team dedicated to delivering exceptional user experiences

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be used to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005, or emailing us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including a document that validates your identity.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Pozuelo de Alarc√≥n, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Verisure is seeking a talented, innovative, passionate¬†Data Analyst to join our growing and successful Group Marketing Team, reporting to the Group Head of Web development & Analytics.

Verisure is building a talented and passionate Digital Marketing Team, and the Data Analyst position is key to its success! This is your chance to visibly impact on Verisure‚Äôs growth and the development of a best-in-class organization.

The role‚Äôs relevance in data collection and analysis is a great opportunity for a strong talent to develop our organization‚Äôs growth. Our success depends on our people, and we invest in them every day. Working with Verisure is being part of an industry leading, world-class company that thrives on a strong entrepreneurial spirit.

Key Responsibilities

As a core member of the Group Digital Marketing team, the Data Analyst will play a crucial role in driving data-informed decision-making by performing the following responsibilities:

Improving the quality and consistency of digital marketing tracking, collaborating with technical teams to maintain a robust data infrastructure and ensure the integrity of analytics data.
Designing, building, and maintaining marketing performance dashboards and reports using Tableau, Looker Studio or similar data visualization tools, ensuring clarity, accuracy, and usability for diverse stakeholders.
Engaging with cross-functional stakeholders to understand business needs, translate them into data requirements, and deliver actionable insights through compelling analysis and visual storytelling.
Partnering with teams across the organization, including Product, CRM, and Web, to identify data opportunities, support campaign measurement, and foster a data-driven culture.
Extracting and manipulating data using SQL to support advanced analytics and reporting needs.
Contributing to the development and lifecycle of Adtech products, including participation in requirement definition, data architecture design, and ongoing maintenance.

Location

The position will be based in Madrid (Spain).

Candidate profile

Qualifications, Experiences, and Competencies

Required Qualifications

Education & Experience

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Marketing, or a related field.
Minimum of 2‚Äì3 years of experience in data analysis within a digital marketing or Adtech environment.
Experience working in multinational or cross-market teams is a plus.

Technical Skills

Good understanding of digital tracking technologies, including GA4, Google Tag Manager, and custom event tracking.
Solid experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker Studio.
Familiarity with digital marketing platforms (e.g. Google Ads, Meta Ads, DV360, etc.).
Knowledge of marketing KPIs, attribution models, customer journey analysis, and performance measurement.
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, cleaning, and manipulation across large datasets.
Ability to handle large datasets and navigate data warehouse environments (experience with BigQuery is a plus).
Basic understanding of Python or R for automation and exploratory data analysis is an advantage.

Analytical & Business Acumen

Strong ability to translate business problems into analytical questions and deliver actionable insights.
Working knowledge of conversion funnel analysis, CRO strategies, and campaign optimization.
Experience with A/B testing design, analysis, and interpretation is a plus.

Communication & Collaboration

Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex insights clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product, CRM, Design, and Content.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and comfortable working autonomously in a fast-paced environment.

Languages

Fluent English is required (written and spoken).
Other languages (e.g. Spanish, French, German, or Nordic languages) are a plus.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience working with Google BigQuery or similar cloud-based data platforms.
Exposure to Adtech environments, CDPs (Customer Data Platforms), or server-side tracking.
Experience with automated reporting solutions or building data pipelines.
Familiarity with marketing mix modeling, predictive analytics, or machine learning use cases.
Certifications such as:
Google Analytics Certification
Tableau/Power BI certifications
Meta or Google Ads certifications

Strong fit with our Company DNA

Passionate in Everything We Do: Our people have a sense of energy that is unmistakable, one that drives us to delight our customers and focus on creating impact quickly.¬†

Committed to Making a Difference: When we say we will do something; we deliver with excellence. We are accountable, focused and operate with discipline.¬†

Always Innovating: We believe that Innovation can be big or small; it‚Äôs a continuous state of mind that inspires us to think differently and always make things better. We are risk takers and we learn continuously.¬†

Winning as a Team: Our people know that by leveraging one another‚Äôs strengths, investing in and developing our team‚Äôs capability and by collaborating well, we will win.

With Trust & Responsibility: Operating with integrity is core to our success. We are humble, honest and value deep mastery and expertise. We do the right thing, always.

The Company

Verisure is the leading European provider of professionally monitored security systems with 24/7 response services. We protect more than 5 million families and small businesses across 17 countries in Europe and Latin America. And our mission is to provide our customers peace of mind by protecting what matters most to them.

With over 35 years of insight, experience, and innovation, Verisure is known for category-creating marketing, sales excellence, innovative products and services, and customer-centricity. Thanks to a strong focus on high quality, our customers are amongst the most satisfied and loyal in our industry. We have some of the strongest double-digit growth and retention rates globally in consumer-facing services which demonstrates our exceptional service levels and strong value proposition to our customers.

Diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging at Verisure

At Verisure, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace, recognising that diversity of thought and background only makes our teams stronger and more innovative. We reject all forms of discrimination and bias, and we believe in access to opportunities for everyone, regardless of gender, age, disability status, race, sexual orientation, or any other status. Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging values are embedded in our company‚Äôs DNA. And we continue to prioritise our DEIB efforts every day to create a more inclusive organisation, enable diverse representation of our community, and ensure equity and meritocracy every step of the way.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Kapsch is one of Austria's most successful global technology companies. With its comprehensive ITS (Intelligent Transportation Systems) portfolio, Kapsch is actively addressing the challenges of the present and the future with intelligent mobility solutions in a wide range of application areas. As a family-owned company founded in 1892 and headquartered in Vienna, Kapsch can look back on 130 years of experience with the future.




We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst and Data Visualization Engineer to support the development of our Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) portfolio. Our products include data and video analytics platforms for traffic management and tolling, an OCR (Optical Character Recognition) engine, and stereo vision cameras for vehicle classification. In this role, you will work with large and complex datasets to extract insights that drive innovation, optimize system performance, and inform product decisions. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams - including software engineering, AI/ML, and product management - and build dashboards to visualize key performance indicators for real-time monitoring and decision support.




Your responsibilities:

Generate actionable insights from large datasets to improve traffic and tolling solutions.
Design and build dashboards (e.g., in Qlik, Power BI) to visualize complex data and support real-time operational decisions.
Work with engineering and product teams to develop user-centric analytics features (e.g., alert systems, operator dashboards).
Analyze traffic sensor data to optimize tolling accuracy and reduce misclassification and revenue loss.
Identify patterns and trends from traffic data to support new use cases, such as congestion prediction or adaptive signaling.
Monitor AI model performance and support ongoing model retraining and customization across varying environments.
Use predictive analytics to anticipate traffic bottlenecks, optimize toll operations, and improve safety.
Support regulatory compliance by automating reporting processes and ensuring data integrity.




Required Skills & Qualifications:

Strong SQL skills and experience with relational and columnar databases.
Solid understanding of dimensional data models (star/snowflake schemas).
Experience with Python and SQL for data manipulation and extraction
Hands-on experience with Linux, Bash, Gitlab/Github, Cloud Computing
Proficiency in QLIK Sense
Experience working with large datasets (‚Äúbig data‚Äù) in operational environments.
Analytical mindset and solution driven personality.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
You practice and live the agile mindset
Good oral and written English
Experience in treating with customers
Presentations skills




Nice to have:

Experience in tolling or traffic management is a plus.
Experience with traffic related models like DATEX2, SIRI, GTFS, MDS, etc.
Experience with traffic simulators like SUMO, Aimsun, PTV Vissim/Vissum




Our offer:

Pernanent role
Flexible working hours
Hybrid working model (2 days at the office/week)
30 business days of annual leave
Flexible remuneration plan
Challenging the limits of mobility for a healthy world without congestion
Adiverse and dynamic international working environment of Kapsch TrafficCom and opportunities for personal growth
Possibility to work in an international company that operates in a dynamic industry where the working environment favors the professional growth

Title: BI Analyst - Data Visualization
Description:
Hey there!

We‚Äôre Fever, the world‚Äôs leading tech platform for culture and live entertainment,

Our mission? To democratize access to culture and entertainment. With our proprietary cutting-edge technology and data-driven approach, we‚Äôre revolutionizing the way people engage with live entertainment.

Every month, our platform inspires over 300 million people in +40 countries (and counting) to discover unforgettable experiences while also empowering event creators with our data and technology, helping them scale, innovate, and enhance their events to reach new audiences.

Our results? We‚Äôve teamed up with major industry leaders like Netflix, F.C. Barcelona, and Primavera Sound, presented international award-winning experiences, and are backed by several leading global investors! Impressive, right?

To achieve our mission, we are looking for bar-raisers with a hands-on mindset who are eager to help shape the future of entertainment!

Ready to be part of the experience?

Now, let‚Äôs discuss this role and what you will do to help achieve Fever‚Äôs mission.

Business Intelligence & Data Visualization Analyst

About The Role

Fever is looking for an Analyst that will play a vital role in taking our products to the next level, deepening/ widening our current understanding of our users and identifying improvement opportunities for our product. We're looking for someone with great analysis skills, the ability to get things done and a genuine interest in our customers.

This is the perfect position for someone who knows a variety of techniques and tools related to data analysis (examples of techniques: SQL, clustering, predictive models, pattern recognition, examples of tools: R, Google Analytics, Mixpanel, etc), enjoys working in a team and loves digging into data to uncover product/business problems and opportunities. You will work closely with different areas of the business. We also value the ability to understand how to prioritize, think on how things will scale, make tradeoffs and balance the business needs with technical constraints.

Key Responsibilities


Create new visualizations according to all Fever teams needs and new requests
Optimize and maintain all those visualizations
Fully understand Fever's data model to be on top on new visualization requests and study their viability
Auditing of current reporting & analytics
Auditing any changes to ensure data accuracy and normalization of data
Working to develop meaningful segmentation models, behavioral analysis of key user segments to analyze churn including elements like origin source, onboarding, plan types and feature retention
Completing critical analysis that will drive growth and provide insights


Basic Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree with Engineering/Technical background required.
0-2 Years of relevant experience
Strong analytical and quantitative skills; strong bias towards data-based decision.
To love everything data - designing models, reporting, driving results/growth
Excellent written and spoken English
Good time management skills.
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with developers, business owners, and senior business leaders.
High sense of ownership, urgency, and drive.


Preferred Qualifications


Top-tier grades
An excellent understanding of SQL or other query languages preferred
Experience in a cross-functional team.
Experience working in Strategy (MicroStrategy) is a plus


Benefits


Attractive compensation package
Opportunity to have a real impact in a high-growth global category leader
40% discount on all Fever events and experiences
Work in a location in the heart of the city, with possible travel across our markets
Home-office friendly
Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth
Great work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with!
Health insurance and other benefits such as Flexible remuneration with a 100% tax exemption through Cobee
English Lessons and Gympass
Possibility to receive in advance part of your salary by Payflow
We have free snacks, drinks and fruit at the office!


Fever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age, or caring responsibilities. We encourage everyone to apply!

Thank you for considering joining Fever. We cannot wait to learn more about you!

If you want to learn more about us: Fever's Blog | Tech.Eu |TechCrunch

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Embat was born to design the best way for medium and large sized enterprises to plan their finances and monitor their cash flow in real time.




We are building a financial management platform that allows them to understand what has happened in the past, track what is happening today and forecast the future of their businesses.




Our mission is to build a product that leverages technology and excellent client experience to empower our clients to make the best business decisions by accessing the best financial information, 100x more efficiently than using Excel files.




Our solution translates into savings of up to 75% of the time that financial teams spend on manual tasks. This allows them to focus on what matters most: making a greater impact within their organization and achieving a better balance between personal and professional life.




Our platform is already the trusted treasury management software of a large number of medium and large-sized corporates in Europe.




Composed of a fantastic team of people of 80+ members with different backgrounds and nationalities.




Backed by reputable international investors with the ambition to make Embat global and a great place to work! We are backed by top-tier international VCs.




In February 2024, we closed our third round of investment worth 15 million euros! This has been led by the renowned international investment fund Creandum, with the invaluable support of our partners Samaipata, 4Founders Capital, VentureFriends, Hugo Ar√©valo and Martin Blessing.




As a Data Analyst, you will join our Data team and also work closely with Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success to help scale Embat‚Äôs commercial engine through data.




We‚Äôre looking for someone with 0‚Äì2 years of experience, curious by nature, and excited about turning raw data into insights. You‚Äôll help the team track performance, identify bottlenecks, uncover opportunities, and ultimately make better, faster decisions.




We pride ourselves on working in an agile, collaborative environment, with daily interaction across teams. You‚Äôll have ownership from day one and the space to grow your skills with guidance from experienced peers.




What will you do?





Support the collection, cleaning, and transformation of data from different tools (CRM, marketing platforms, customer success platforms).


Build and maintain dashboards and performance reports related to revenue, pipeline, marketing and retention.


Execute ad-hoc analyses to solve real business problems and communicate findings clearly to stakeholders.


Contribute to improving data accuracy by identifying inconsistencies and working cross-functionally to solve them.


Help document key metrics, sources and logic used in reporting processes.


Identify and help implement process automation and self-serve reporting opportunities.


Learn how to work with business teams and translate their questions into data-driven insights.
What are we looking for?


0‚Äì2 years of experience in data-related roles


Technical background (engineering, math, physics, statistics, economics or similar). Other degrees welcome if paired with a data bootcamp or master‚Äôs.


Basic SQL and Python knowledge


You are comfortable with numbers, and have high attention to detail


You are proactive, eager to learn, and a problem-solver by nature


You enjoy working cross-functionally with teams from different backgrounds


Strong communication and structured thinking


You speak Spanish fluently and have a working level of English
What comes with working at Embat?


We offer a platform that allows you to reach your professional and personal goals.


A competitive salary according to the project and responsibility.


English Classes.


Hybrid working setup & flexible schedule.


Latest technology of your choice to do your impactful work with.


Access to private health insurance with Sanitas.


Access to salary on demand, restaurante card, transport card, and kindergarten checks through Payflow.


Career progression - Twice-yearly performance reviews.


An opportunity to work hand in hand with our founders who built their careers in Investment Banking at J.P. Morgan for more than a decade


Team Buildings plans

Title: Reporting Analyst
Description:
Tradition is the interdealer broking arm of Compagnie Financi√®re Tradition and one of the world's largest interdealer brokers in over-the-counter financial and commodity related products. CFT is represented in over 28 countries, employing over 2,500 people.




Tradition‚Äôs goal is to provide superior client services. It believes its business success is a direct reflection of its employees and recruits. As such, teamwork, creativity, reliability and integrity are components of a work ethic taken very seriously since the company was founded in 1959.




Tradition is currently seeking to appoint a Reporting Analyst to be based within the Madrid office.




Main responsibilities within the Reporting Analyst position include:




Administer and support Salesforce CRM processes, including user management and reporting.
Develop and maintain Excel models for sales/revenue analysis, reporting, and performance tracking.
Assist in building and maintaining dashboards, models and reports using Power BI.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders form various departments to identify & qualify reporting needs.
Document processes and create user guides as needed to support internal users.
Ensure customer data quality and consistency across systems and processes.




Key skills, experience and competencies required to be successful in this role:

Experience with Salesforce CRM administration or similar CRM platforms.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel (e.g., pivot tables, advanced formulas, Power Query).
Familiarity with Power BI / Fabric or similar BI platforms.
Understanding of Microsoft 365 services such as Power Automate, Microsoft Fabric, OneDrive.
Strong analytical thinking, attention to detail, and problem-solving skills.
Good verbal and written communication skills in English.
Good commercial & business acumen in a B2B sales environment.
Comfortable engaging with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Prior experience in the financial services industry is advantageous.
Familiarity with market data licensing is advantageous.




Tradition do not accept agency CV‚Äôs. Please do not forward CV‚Äôs to our employees or Talent team. Tradition are not accountable for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. The Talent team will reach out to trusted agents when required.




Please note, due to the large volume of applications for this position, only suitable candidates will be contacted. If you have not heard from us within 14 days, unfortunately, your application has been unsuccessful.




Tradition welcome all suitable applications and are an equal opportunity employer who value diversity. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications and merit.




By applying for this role, you agree that we may retain your details on our system for a period of 6 months and may contact you for any future vacancies that may arise within the Tradition Group.

Title: Business intelligence/Data analyst Intern
Description:
Kapsch is one of Austria's most successful global technology companies. With its comprehensive ITS (Intelligent Transportation Systems) portfolio, Kapsch is actively addressing the challenges of the present and the future with intelligent mobility solutions in a wide range of application areas. As a family-owned company founded in 1892 and headquartered in Vienna, Kapsch can look back on 130 years of experience with the future.




In the role of Business Intelligence / Data Analyst Intern, candidate will work with real business data, help build dashboards, and contribute to decision-making processes by delivering actionable insights and will support EMEA OPS team with further automations of repeated activities.




Successful candidate will do:

Assist with data collection, cleaning, and analysis
Support the development of reports and dashboards using tools like Excel, Power BI, or Tableau
Conduct basic data exploration to uncover trends and insights
Collaborate with different departments to understand data needs
Help ensure data accuracy and consistency
Support repeated task automations (e.g. using PowerAutomate)




Kapsch TrafficCom is looking for:

Currently pursuing a degree in Business, Data Science, Computer Science, or related field
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Knowledge of SQL/JSQL and PowerBI
Proficiency in Excel
Fluent in English
Good communication skills and attention to detail
Knowledge of Microsoft Fabrics advantage but not necessary




What do we offer you?

Financial support to help with your education.
A hybrid work model so you can enjoy flexibility.
Flexible schedule
A dynamic and enriching environment where you'll learn from experienced professionals and participate in high-impact projects.

With its comprehensive ITS (Intelligent Transportation Systems) portfolio, Kapsch is actively addressing the challenges of the present and the future with intelligent mobility solutions in a wide range of application areas. As a family-owned company founded in 1892 and headquartered in Vienna, Kapsch can look back on 130 years of experience with the future.


In the role of Business Intelligence / Data Analyst Intern, candidate will work with real business data, help build dashboards, and contribute to decision-making processes by delivering actionable insights and will support EMEA OPS team with further automations of repeated activities.


Successful candidate will do:

  • Assist with data collection, cleaning, and analysis
  • Support the development of reports and dashboards using tools like Excel, Power BI, or Tableau
  • Conduct basic data exploration to uncover trends and insights
  • Collaborate with different departments to understand data needs
  • Help ensure data accuracy and consistency
  • Support repeated task automations (e.g. using PowerAutomate)


Kapsch TrafficCom is looking for:

  • Currently pursuing a degree in Business, Data Science, Computer Science, or related field
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Knowledge of SQL/JSQL and PowerBI
  • Proficiency in Excel
  • Fluent in English
  • Good communication skills and attention to detail
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Fabrics advantage but not necessary


What do we offer you?

  • Financial support to help with your education.
  • A hybrid work model so you can enjoy flexibility.
  • Flexible schedule
  • A dynamic and enriching environment where you'll learn from experienced professionals and participate in high-impact projects.

Title: Business Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Job Description




We‚Äôre looking for a Business Data Analyst Trainee to join our team in Madrid and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.

Who We AreAt Seedtag, we lead the way in contextual advertising with our machine learning-powered platform. Our technology provides superior brand safety, human-like content understanding, and advanced cookieless targeting, making ads more engaging and respectful. Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, we‚Äôve grown to over 600 Seedtaggers across 18 countries, raising ‚Ç¨250M to revolutionise digital advertising.

Your Challenge

Support the Data & Insights team in transforming data into meaningful business insights.
Assist in analysing the performance of Seedtag‚Äôs Contextual products and internal processes.
Help build tools and dashboards that support data-driven decision-making across teams.
Learn how to automate internal processes to increase team efficiency.
Gain exposure to the adTech ecosystem and develop business acumen.
Collaborate with experienced analysts and actively participate in team discussions.
Take ownership of learning opportunities and technical development.

What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed

Currently completing or recently completed a Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related fields.
Strong interest in data analysis, business intelligence, and technology.
Basic knowledge of SQL and a willingness to develop your technical skills.
Some academic or personal experience with programming languages (e.g., Python, R) or Excel/Google Sheets.
Curiosity about data visualisation tools such as Looker, Power BI, or similar platforms.
Detail-oriented mindset and eagerness to learn in a fast-paced environment.
Strong communication skills and a collaborative attitude.
Motivation to understand how data impacts business decisions.
A good level of English, both written and spoken.

It would be a big plus if:

Have worked on academic or personal projects involving data analysis or reporting.
Have taken online courses or earned certifications related to SQL, data analytics, or visualisation.
Understand basic business KPIs or performance metrics.

Why Join Seedtag?Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to work from home, the office, or even the beach in our hybrid mode.Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!

Additional Perks

Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.

Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV and let‚Äôs grow together!

At Seedtag, we‚Äôre committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we‚Äôll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Title: Data Analyst (Treasury)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 60+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in product teams and deliver rock star solutions.

We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst to join our Treasury Department. Someone who thrives on solving complex data challenges and believes no task is too tough to tackle. You‚Äôll play a critical role in shaping our financial strategy by diving deep into our data, identifying root causes, and designing your own scalable solutions.

Up for the challenge? Let's get in touch.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Developing and owning quantitative models for ALM, capital, and liquidity management
Enabling domain owners to make strategic, data-informed decisions that directly impact the company's direction
Setting up and maintaining treasury and regulatory monitoring and reporting frameworks
Designing and developing key business metrics and dashboards to visualise performance and risk
Building and maintaining robust ETL pipelines using SQL and Python
Performing in-depth, ad-hoc analyses and creating reports that support long-term planning and regulatory compliance
Supporting company-wide data initiatives that impact the department, such as data warehouse migrations and the development of standardised executive dashboards
Promoting data literacy by contributing to best practices, documentation, and knowledge sharing across teams


What You'll Need


3+ years experience in treasury analytics
Great skills with SQL and Python
Evidence of solid mathematical and statistics knowledge
Experience working within a bank's treasury function, with specific exposure to liquidity management and asset and liability management


Nice to have


An advanced degree in a core STEM subject


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.


Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don‚Äôt use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.


We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it‚Äôs a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
EXCLUSIVE NETWORKS | Introduction

Exclusive Networks (EXN) is a global cybersecurity specialist that provides partners and end-customers with a wide range of services and product portfolios via proven routes to market. With offices in over 45 countries and the ability to serve customers in over 170 countries, we combine a local perspective with the scale and delivery of a single global organization.

Our best-in-class vendor portfolio is carefully curated with all leading industry players. Our services range from managed security solutions to specialist technical accreditation and training capitalizing on rapidly evolving technologies and changing business models. For more information visit www.exclusive-networks.com.

At Exclusive Networks, we are passionate about making a difference. That means delivering the best to our clients, doing our part to create a prosperous and trusted digital world, and helping our people to realize their potential.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES | About the role

We are in search of a talented Data Analyst to join our Global IT team. In this role, you will interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and develop and implement data analyses and data collection systems. Your core mission will be to optimize statistical efficiency and quality. You will champion data-driven decision-making and collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to identify process improvement opportunities. This position is created in the context of an IT transformation, including a move to agile practices.

Responsibilities

Technical Lead (40%):


Participate in strategic planning discussions to align Data & Analytics initiatives with the organization's business goals.
Ensure alignment between technical and non-technical aspects of the business.
Bridge communication between business & IT Organization


Data Analysis and Insights (30%):


Analyzes large amounts of data using analytical, statistical, and programming skills.
Translate complex data into actionable information that informs business strategies and decisions.
End-to-end design and implementation of advance analytics tools (from Business requirements to move the tool into production)


Dashboard and Report Development (30%):


Design and develop interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI.
Ensure accuracy and reliability of data presented in these visualizations.


QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE | About you

Educational Background


University degree in Economics, Computer science or related is a must
Master's degree is a plus


Experience


At least 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst or related


Technical Skills


Advance skills in PowerBI are a must
Advance programming skills in SQL
Intermediate knowledge in Python or R
Experience in automatization libraries (such us Selenium) is a plus
Intermediate knowledge in Azure cloud ecosystem is a plus
Knowledge in Databricks
Agile Methodologies: Proficiency in agile methodologies and tools such as Scrum and Kanban.


Soft Skills


Communication: Excellent communication skills to effectively convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and vice versa.
Collaboration: Strong collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
Problem-Solving: Ability to identify and resolve issues promptly and efficiently.
Multi-tasking: Ability to manage different request in parallel


ADDITIONAL INFORMATION | What you need to know


Role based either in Spain (Madrid / Barcelona) or Poland (Krakow / Warsaw).
Able to work remotely several days per week with occasional travel as needed.
English is a must-have, and an additional (European) language is a plus.
Work permit allowing work in Spain or Poland.


WHO IS EXCLUSIVE NETWORKS? | Why work for us

We are people focused and strongly believe that talent empowers us to continue our dynasty of disruption and growth in the future. Our Mission is to drive the transition to a totally trusted digital world for all people and organizations. Visit our website www.exclusive-networks.com.

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to the recruitment and hiring of individuals from diverse backgrounds and experiences, as we believe this strengthens our ability to develop superior solutions, make informed decisions, and better serve our valued customers. We do not discriminate against individuals based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, disability status, or any similar characteristic. Employment decisions are made solely based on qualifications, merit, and business need. Please click here to review our Diversity and Inclusion Policy for further information.

We care about your data: please click here to read our Recruitment Data Protection Policy prior to applying, and therefore sharing your data with us.

Title: Data & Analytics Specialist
Description:
Hi! üëãüèº

At Shakers, we're on the lookout for a Data & Analytics Specialist to take our Product team to the next level üöÄ


Team and Role


If you have experience in working autonomously on technical data projects, thrive in a dynamic startup environment, and are ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you.

This role offers the opportunity to enhance Shakers' analytics, with the chance to shape the next generation way of working. If you‚Äôre excited by the prospect of working in a fast-paced, innovative environment, collaborating with a talented team, and making a direct impact, this is the opportunity for you! ü§©


What you¬¥ll be doing


Your day-to-day as a Data & Analytics Specialist:


Writing efficient SQL queries for large-scale data warehouses.
Defining, building, and maintaining ETL models in our data warehouse (BigQuery) using dbt and Airflow.
Building data integrations and ensuring data quality across pipeline layers.
Documenting and maintaining code and queries in GitLab.
Creating dashboards and reports in Looker/Looker Studio/Metabase to communicate results and track KPIs.
Conducting exploratory analysis to shape projects and provide actionable recommendations.
Presenting insights to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
Collaborating with PMs, designers, and engineers to define data needs, request app events, integrate third-party tools, and develop data models.
Supporting feature design with product managers and engineers through performance measurement and impact testing.
Developing organization-wide data sources to empower business teams in data exploration.
Working across teams to improve data practices and promote a data-driven culture.
What we¬¥re looking for


You¬¥re a great fit if you...


Strong alignment with our principles‚Äîwe take this very seriously.
At least 2 years of experience as a Data analyst/engineer.
Proficiency in writing and understanding complex SQL queries and handling large datasets.
Experience using Python for data science tasks (data cleaning, API calls, SQL calls, modeling)
Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, or Looker.
A graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields.
Fluency in English and Spanish.


Bonus points:


A Master's degree or Bootcamp in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related sciences.
Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar.
Experience working with vector DDBB and building data resources for AI consumption
What's in it for you?


Compensation üí∞

The salary range for this position is between 40.250‚Ç¨ and 51.750‚Ç¨ OTE (on target earnings) gross annual salary.

The salary consists of:


Between 35.000‚Ç¨ & 45.000‚Ç¨ fixed salary
Up to 6.750‚Ç¨ quarterly bonus based on performance & potential (15%)


Why you¬¥ll love working at Shakers üíö


Be part of a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup. üåç
Have an ambitious professional development plan to help you reach your full potential.
Enjoy an unbeatable team culture‚Äîask anyone on our team!
Take advantage of our hybrid ful flex methodology: a mix of remote and in-office work, with our office located in the heart of Madrid, Calle Vel√°zquez.
Perks include wellness programs, gym access, English classes, medical insurance, and more.


At the office... üìç


Wellness programs, English classes, private medical insurance, and more
Organic fruit, great coffee and vibrant energy!
In our Madrid office, catered lunch included
Our recruitment process


As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process.

Our goal is to have you onboard this July, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one!

The Road to Joining Our Team


Round 1, Cultural Fit: Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don‚Äôt worry‚Äîwe just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
Round 2, Case Study & Technical Skills with Product Team: Join two members of our Product team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your client management skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.
Round 3, Meet the Team: Have a conversation with additional team members to further explore your skillset and ensure there's a great cultural fit. This is also your chance to ask questions and see how we collaborate.
Final check, CEO Chat: Meet H√©ctor, our CEO! He‚Äôs excited to connect with you, talk about Shakers‚Äô future, and discuss your vision and expectations.


More about Shakers

At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working.

Our vision is to be the leading community and platform in the world that helps companies work with freelance teams through our technology.

We are a 70-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!

Our DNA

At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!

WINNING TEAM üèÜ

We all feel like part of a winning team‚Äîone that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.

F1C10 üí™üèº

We‚Äôre building an environment where fear doesn‚Äôt hold us back. Experimentation and learning from failure are part of our DNA. Fail fast, grow faster. Fail 1X, chase 10X. We value risk-takers who aren‚Äôt afraid to go big!

STAY HUMBLE ü§≤üèº

We embrace a beginner‚Äôs mindset‚Äîalways evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary!

A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see you soon.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are Is What We Do.

Deel is the all-in-one payroll and HR platform for global teams. Our vision is to unlock global opportunity for every person, team, and business. Built for the way the world works today, Deel combines HRIS, payroll, compliance, benefits, performance, and equipment management into one seamless platform. With AI-powered tools and a fully owned payroll infrastructure, Deel supports every worker type in 150+ countries‚Äîhelping businesses scale smarter, faster, and more compliantly.

Among the largest globally distributed companies in the world, our team of 6,000 spans more than 100 countries, speaks 74 languages, and brings a connected and dynamic culture that drives continuous learning and innovation for our customers.

Why should you be part of our success story?

As the fastest-growing Software as a Service (SaaS) company in history, Deel is transforming how global talent connects with world-class companies ‚Äì breaking down borders that have traditionally limited both hiring and career opportunities. We're not just building software; we're creating the infrastructure for the future of work, enabling a more diverse and inclusive global economy. In 2024 alone, we paid $11.2 billion to workers in nearly 100 currencies and provided healthcare and benefits to workers in 109 countries‚Äîensuring people get paid and protected, no matter where they are.

Our momentum is reflected in our achievements and customer satisfaction: CNBC Disruptor 50, Forbes Cloud 100, Deloitte Fast 500, and repeated recognition on Y Combinator‚Äôs top companies list ‚Äì all while maintaining a 4.83 average rating from 15,000 reviews across G2, Trustpilot, Captera, Apple and Google.

Your experience at Deel will be a career accelerator. At the forefront of the global work revolution, you'll tackle complex challenges that impact millions of people's working lives. With our momentum‚Äîbacked by a $12 billion valuation and $1 B in Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) in just over five years‚Äîyou'll drive meaningful impact while building expertise that makes you a sought-after leader in the transformation of global work.

Responsibilities


Collaborate closely with Product Managers, Product Operations and Dev teams on different problems to create actionable insights
Monitor product and feature release performance, define baselines, success metrics and provide recommendations for optimisation
Develop/apply extensive domain knowledge in your dedicated product areas in order to proactively derive meaningful recommendations and insights that drive and inform product strategy
Analyze market data, identify customer behavior and trends
Help design and evaluate A/B tests to improve customer journeys
Create and promote effective self-service analytics infrastructure for your product areas
Develop user friendly dashboards and high quality data visualizations that drive actions and support decision making
Explore large and complex datasets to create actionable insights
Build data models in dbt with the support of Analytics Engineers to create the cleanest data structures and KPIs for your product areas
Make intelligent choices for the adoption of new technologies based on your extensive experience
Contribute to the development and growth of fellow product analysts by proactively sharing knowledge, providing mentoring, etc.


Qualifications


Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Economics or equivalent degree
5+ years‚Äô experience in product analytics team
Hands on experience in at least one modern BI tools (preferably Looker)
Proficiency in SQL and product analytics tools (mixpanel / heap / amplitude)
Solid experience with Data Modelling (DBT)
Excellent multitasking and problem-solving abilities

Who We Are Is What We Do.

Deel is the all-in-one payroll and HR platform for global teams. Our vision is to unlock global opportunity for every person, team, and business. Built for the way the world works today, Deel combines HRIS, payroll, compliance, benefits, performance, and equipment management into one seamless platform. With AI-powered tools and a fully owned payroll infrastructure, Deel supports every worker type in 150+ countries‚Äîhelping businesses scale smarter, faster, and more compliantly.

Among the largest globally distributed companies in the world, our team of 6,000 spans more than 100 countries, speaks 74 languages, and brings a connected and dynamic culture that drives continuous learning and innovation for our customers.

Why should you be part of our success story?

As the fastest-growing Software as a Service (SaaS) company in history, Deel is transforming how global talent connects with world-class companies ‚Äì breaking down borders that have traditionally limited both hiring and career opportunities. We're not just building software; we're creating the infrastructure for the future of work, enabling a more diverse and inclusive global economy. In 2024 alone, we paid $11.2 billion to workers in nearly 100 currencies and provided healthcare and benefits to workers in 109 countries‚Äîensuring people get paid and protected, no matter where they are.

Our momentum is reflected in our achievements and customer satisfaction: CNBC Disruptor 50, Forbes Cloud 100, Deloitte Fast 500, and repeated recognition on Y Combinator‚Äôs top companies list ‚Äì all while maintaining a 4.83 average rating from 15,000 reviews across G2, Trustpilot, Captera, Apple and Google.

Your experience at Deel will be a career accelerator. At the forefront of the global work revolution, you'll tackle complex challenges that impact millions of people's working lives. With our momentum‚Äîbacked by a $12 billion valuation and $1 B in Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) in just over five years‚Äîyou'll drive meaningful impact while building expertise that makes you a sought-after leader in the transformation of global work.

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate closely with Product Managers, Product Operations and Dev teams on different problems to create actionable insights
  • Monitor product and feature release performance, define baselines, success metrics and provide recommendations for optimisation
  • Develop/apply extensive domain knowledge in your dedicated product areas in order to proactively derive meaningful recommendations and insights that drive and inform product strategy
  • Analyze market data, identify customer behavior and trends
  • Help design and evaluate A/B tests to improve customer journeys
  • Create and promote effective self-service analytics infrastructure for your product areas
  • Develop user friendly dashboards and high quality data visualizations that drive actions and support decision making
  • Explore large and complex datasets to create actionable insights
  • Build data models in dbt with the support of Analytics Engineers to create the cleanest data structures and KPIs for your product areas
  • Make intelligent choices for the adoption of new technologies based on your extensive experience
  • Contribute to the development and growth of fellow product analysts by proactively sharing knowledge, providing mentoring, etc.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Economics or equivalent degree
  • 5+ years‚Äô experience in product analytics team
  • Hands on experience in at least one modern BI tools (preferably Looker)
  • Proficiency in SQL and product analytics tools (mixpanel / heap / amplitude)
  • Solid experience with Data Modelling (DBT)
  • Excellent multitasking and problem-solving abilities
  • Effective communication skills and experience dealing with stakeholders of varying seniority
  • Experience with Snowflake and LookML is a plus

Total Rewards

Our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all.

Title: Data Analyst Internship
Description:
Stratx is a consulting partner for businesses that want to grow faster and operate smarter. We help companies make better decisions, improve processes, and unlock new opportunities through clear strategies and hands-on guidance.




Role Summary

We are offering a 3-month Data Analyst Internship for motivated individuals based in Madrid. This remote internship is designed to provide practical experience in data analytics, giving interns the opportunity to work with real datasets, develop technical skills, and support client-facing consulting projects.




Key Responsibilities

Assist with data wrangling, cleaning, and preparation for analysis.
Support the use of Excel, SQL, and Python for data extraction and transformation.
Contribute to the creation of reports and dashboards to present insights clearly.
Apply statistical methods to uncover patterns, correlations, and business opportunities.
Collaborate with consultants to turn data insights into actionable recommendations.
Conduct competitor and market research to enrich data-driven insights.
Document analytical processes and maintain organised data records for future use.




Required Qualifications

Currently studying or recently graduated in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related discipline.
Strong proficiency with Excel and familiarity with SQL or Python.
Analytical mindset with strong attention to detail.
Ability to manage tasks independently while working remotely.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.




Preferred Qualifications

Familiarity with BI tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Exposure to predictive analytics, data modelling, or statistics.
Previous academic, internship, or project experience in data analysis.




Benefits & Perks

Paid internship with competitive hourly rate.
35 hours per week with flexible schedule.
Fully remote role, allowing you to work from Madrid or elsewhere.
Mentorship and training from experienced consultants.
Hands-on project experience to strengthen your data career.




Job Details

Location: Remote (Madrid, Spain).
Job Type: Internship.
Hours: 35 hours per week.
Compensation: Competitive.
Duration: 3 months.
Schedule: Monday to Friday, flexible within business hours.




Equal Opportunity Statement

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at all levels of the organisation. We do not discriminate based on race, gender, religion, age, disability, or any other legally protected status.

Description:
Centro de Servicios a Tienda y Desarrollo de Negocio, nuestras oficinas centrales:

¬øTe unes a nosotros?

Principales Funciones y Responsabilidades

Requisitos

Formaci√≥n universitaria en Ingenier√≠a, Matem√°ticas, Estad√≠stica, Econom√≠a o similar; valorable M√°ster en Data Analytics/Big Data y certificaciones en herramientas de BI o cloud.

Experiencia trabajando directamente con usuarios de negocio para construir reportes, dashboards y resolviendo preguntas de negocio con datos. Importante conocimientos s√≥lidos en el desarrollo de dashboards.

¬øQu√© ofrecemos?

Nuestro Prop√≥sito

En Leroy Merlin tenemos un prop√≥sito que da sentido a lo que somos y a todo lo que hacemos, una gu√≠a que es nuestro compromiso contigo y con el planeta. Y es que todo lo que te ofrecemos busca despertar en ti la motivaci√≥n de crear entornos donde vivir mejor.

Porque estamos seguros de una cosa, si nos lo proponemos, cambiar el mundo est√° en nuestras manos y en las tuyas.

La Acci√≥n Social es uno de los pilares fundamentales de Leroy Merlin Espa√±a, siendo un valor a√±adido para toda la empresa, pero tambi√©n para la comunidad. A trav√©s de diversas acciones: proyectos de reforma y acondicionamiento, donaciones, productos solidarios, voluntariado corporativo y nuestra Convocatoria de Ayudas "Hogares Dignos", contribuimos a la construcci√≥n de un mundo y de una sociedad mejor.

¬°Benef√≠ciate! Por ser Leroy Merlin

Como colaborador/a de Leroy Merlin Espa√±a tienes a tu disposici√≥n m√°s de 70 beneficios y/o ventajas clasificados en 6 categor√≠as, pensados para brindarte la mejor experiencia por ser parte de este gran equipo.

La Gesti√≥n de la Diversidad es un eje fundamental en nuestra filosof√≠a de empresa. Es por esto que est√° incluida en el Ch√°rter de Diversidad, un c√≥digo de compromiso promovido por la Fundaci√≥n para la Diversidad y apoyado por el Ministerio de Sanidad, Pol√≠tica Social e Igualdad. Con esto, nos reafirmamos en nuestro compromiso con el respeto al derecho de la inclusi√≥n de todas las personas y reconocemos los beneficios que nos brindan la diversidad cultural, demogr√°fica y social.

Title: Business Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Job Description




We‚Äôre looking for a Business Data Analyst Trainee to join our team in Madrid and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.

Who We AreAt Seedtag, we lead the way in contextual advertising with our machine learning-powered platform. Our technology provides superior brand safety, human-like content understanding, and advanced cookieless targeting, making ads more engaging and respectful. Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, we‚Äôve grown to over 600 Seedtaggers across 18 countries, raising ‚Ç¨250M to revolutionise digital advertising.

Your Challenge

Support the Data & Insights team in transforming data into meaningful business insights.
Assist in analysing the performance of Seedtag‚Äôs Contextual products and internal processes.
Help build tools and dashboards that support data-driven decision-making across teams.
Learn how to automate internal processes to increase team efficiency.
Gain exposure to the adTech ecosystem and develop business acumen.
Collaborate with experienced analysts and actively participate in team discussions.
Take ownership of learning opportunities and technical development.

What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed

Currently completing or recently completed a Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related fields.
Strong interest in data analysis, business intelligence, and technology.
Basic knowledge of SQL and a willingness to develop your technical skills.
Some academic or personal experience with programming languages (e.g., Python, R) or Excel/Google Sheets.
Curiosity about data visualisation tools such as Looker, Power BI, or similar platforms.
Detail-oriented mindset and eagerness to learn in a fast-paced environment.
Strong communication skills and a collaborative attitude.
Motivation to understand how data impacts business decisions.
A good level of English, both written and spoken.

It would be a big plus if:

Have worked on academic or personal projects involving data analysis or reporting.
Have taken online courses or earned certifications related to SQL, data analytics, or visualisation.
Understand basic business KPIs or performance metrics.

Additional Perks

Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.

Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV and let‚Äôs grow together!

At Seedtag, we‚Äôre committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we‚Äôll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Business Data Analyst to join our team in Madrid and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.

Who We Are

At Seedtag, we lead the way in contextual advertising with our machine learning-powered platform. Our technology provides superior brand safety, human-like content understanding, and advanced cookieless targeting, making ads more engaging and respectful. Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, we‚Äôve grown to over 600 Seedtaggers across 18 countries, raising ‚Ç¨250M to revolutionise digital advertising.




Your Challenge




You will get full ownership of our business data and will be expected to propose and conduct analyses that transform Seedtag‚Äôs data into significant business opportunities and KPI improvements.
You will analyse the performance of our current Contextual products and processes and proactively propose initiatives that seek to improve Seedtag‚Äôs commercial and operational results.
You will develop tools that automate internal processes, increasing the efficiency and efficacy of Seedtag teams.
You will help build tools that enable the democratisation of data inside the company and allow Seedtag teams to make informed, data-driven decisions.
Finally, you will build a solid knowledge of the adTech ecosystem and develop strong business acumen.




What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed




You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Engineering. Specific certifications/education in Data/ Business Intelligence are a plus.
You have 3-5 years of experience in a fast-paced environment, either start-up, corporate or consulting.
You have advanced skills in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
You have experience with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools.
You have knowledge of database management systems (e.g., BigQuery, MySQL).
You have experience working with programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and manipulation.
You have experience in data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or similar, and you have knowledge of Excel/ Sheets.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights that drive business value.
You have the ability to collaborate with business stakeholders to identify information needs and define business requirements.
You have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

It would be a big plus if you

Have experience in forecasting, trend analysis, and predictive modelling.
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders.
Have experience working with Tableau.




Why Join Seedtag?




Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to work from home, the office, or even the beach in our hybrid mode.

Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!




Additional Perks




Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.




Ready to join the Seedtag adventure?




Send us your CV and let‚Äôs grow together!

At Seedtag, we‚Äôre committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we‚Äôll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Do you want to change the world? At Cabify, that's what we're doing. We aim to make cities better places to live by improving mobility for the people living in them, connecting riders to drivers at the touch of a button. Maybe one day cities will be places where nobody needs a private car. But we've still got a long way to go...fancy joining us?

About The Position

As a Senior Data Analyst, you'll be part of an exceptional team of over 30 SQL and data visualization specialists. Our Data Analytics department is organized around 11 problem spaces that mirror the structure of the entire company, ensuring that every decision we make at Cabify is data-driven.

In your day-to-day role, you'll work in a multidisciplinary squad with other disciplines such as Product, Engineering, Growth, and Operations. We also follow agile methodologies within each analytics group and foster an environment of knowledge and resource sharing among the department.

If you're passionate about managing large volumes of data, you'll be delighted to know we leverage two different data warehouses, Google BigQuery and Amazon Redshift, to perform intensive analysis thus maximizing operational efficiency.

We take pride in working with one of the largest Tableau Server platforms in Europe, where we share not only powerful analysis and visualizations but also Self Service Data Sources, making data accessible to the entire company.

You will:

Lead technical data projects autonomously to enhance the company's analytics capabilities through functions such as:


Exploit large-scale data warehouses performing efficient SQL.
Define ETL and abstract data models in our data warehouse with Airflow.
Document and maintain your code and queries in Gitlab.
Define the squad analytics and reports using Tableau / PowerBI to communicate results and monitor KPIs regularly.
Generate and execute ideas for exploratory analysis to shape future projects and provide action recommendations.
Define KPIs and present findings to squad members and senior management to guide business and product decisions.
Lead discussions with the engineering team to define and design everything required to satisfy our data needs.
Help design new features alongside product managers and engineers, giving data insights, measuring their performance and testing their business impact.
Develop Data Sources to use across the organization, thus empowering business by exploring data in a trusted environment.


Our ideal candidate has:


Great alignment with our principles, we take this very seriously.
+3 years of working experience as a Data Analyst
Proficient in writing and understanding complex SQL and working with large data sets
Working expertise of Tableau or PowerBI
Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar
Graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields
Fluency in English and Spanish


Bonus points:


A Master's degree in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related


What's it like to work at Cabify?

We're a company full of happy, motivated people and we never want that to change. Here are some more reasons why it rocks to be part of our high-performance team:

‚åö Hybrid Model (2 work-from-home days per week plus 6 weeks per year)

üí∂ Excellent Salary conditions: 38.000‚Ç¨ - 53.000‚Ç¨

üèùÔ∏è Recharge days

üåç Our office is located in Madrid.

‚åö Flexible work environment & hours.

üôå Regular team events.

üöó Cabify staff free rides.

üöÄ Personal development programs based on our career paths.

üßò‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è iFeel: Free access to the iFeel platform, so you can take care of your emotional well-being through therapy sessions.

üìê Coursera: your own license in Coursera to take as many courses as you wish and continue developing your skills.

üí≥ Flexible compensation plan: Restaurant tickets, transport tickets, healthcare and childcare

üíª All the equipment you need (you only have to bring your talent).

üê± A pet room, so you don't have to leave your furry friend at home

‚òïÔ∏è And last but not least...free coffee and fruit!

Cabify is proud of being an equal-opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees regardless of background, gender, religion, orientation, age, or ability.

Join us!
