Title: Data & Analytics Specialist
Description:
Hi! üëãüèº

At Shakers, we're on the lookout for a Data & Analytics Specialist to take our Product team to the next level üöÄ


Team and Role


If you have experience in working autonomously on technical data projects, thrive in a dynamic startup environment, and are ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you.

This role offers the opportunity to enhance Shakers' analytics, with the chance to shape the next generation way of working. If you‚Äôre excited by the prospect of working in a fast-paced, innovative environment, collaborating with a talented team, and making a direct impact, this is the opportunity for you! ü§©


What you¬¥ll be doing


Your day-to-day as a Data & Analytics Specialist:


Writing efficient SQL queries for large-scale data warehouses.
Defining, building, and maintaining ETL models in our data warehouse (BigQuery) using dbt and Airflow.
Building data integrations and ensuring data quality across pipeline layers.
Documenting and maintaining code and queries in GitLab.
Creating dashboards and reports in Looker/Looker Studio/Metabase to communicate results and track KPIs.
Conducting exploratory analysis to shape projects and provide actionable recommendations.
Presenting insights to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
Collaborating with PMs, designers, and engineers to define data needs, request app events, integrate third-party tools, and develop data models.
Supporting feature design with product managers and engineers through performance measurement and impact testing.
Developing organization-wide data sources to empower business teams in data exploration.
Working across teams to improve data practices and promote a data-driven culture.
What we¬¥re looking for


You¬¥re a great fit if you...


Strong alignment with our principles‚Äîwe take this very seriously.
At least 2 years of experience as a Data analyst/engineer.
Proficiency in writing and understanding complex SQL queries and handling large datasets.
Experience using Python for data science tasks (data cleaning, API calls, SQL calls, modeling)
Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, or Looker.
A graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields.
Fluency in English and Spanish.


Bonus points:


A Master's degree or Bootcamp in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related sciences.
Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar.
Experience working with vector DDBB and building data resources for AI consumption
What's in it for you?


Compensation üí∞

The salary range for this position is between 40.250‚Ç¨ and 51.750‚Ç¨ OTE (on target earnings) gross annual salary.

The salary consists of:


Between 35.000‚Ç¨ & 45.000‚Ç¨ fixed salary
Up to 6.750‚Ç¨ quarterly bonus based on performance & potential (15%)


Why you¬¥ll love working at Shakers üíö


Be part of a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup. üåç
Have an ambitious professional development plan to help you reach your full potential.
Enjoy an unbeatable team culture‚Äîask anyone on our team!
Take advantage of our hybrid ful flex methodology: a mix of remote and in-office work, with our office located in the heart of Madrid, Calle Vel√°zquez.
Perks include wellness programs, gym access, English classes, medical insurance, and more.


At the office... üìç


Wellness programs, English classes, private medical insurance, and more
Organic fruit, great coffee and vibrant energy!
In our Madrid office, catered lunch included
Our recruitment process


As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process.

Our goal is to have you onboard this July, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one!

The Road to Joining Our Team


Round 1, Cultural Fit: Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don‚Äôt worry‚Äîwe just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
Round 2, Case Study & Technical Skills with Product Team: Join two members of our Product team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your client management skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.
Round 3, Meet the Team: Have a conversation with additional team members to further explore your skillset and ensure there's a great cultural fit. This is also your chance to ask questions and see how we collaborate.
Final check, CEO Chat: Meet H√©ctor, our CEO! He‚Äôs excited to connect with you, talk about Shakers‚Äô future, and discuss your vision and expectations.


More about Shakers

At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working.

Our vision is to be the leading community and platform in the world that helps companies work with freelance teams through our technology.

We are a 70-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!

Our DNA

At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!

WINNING TEAM üèÜ

We all feel like part of a winning team‚Äîone that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.

F1C10 üí™üèº

We‚Äôre building an environment where fear doesn‚Äôt hold us back. Experimentation and learning from failure are part of our DNA. Fail fast, grow faster. Fail 1X, chase 10X. We value risk-takers who aren‚Äôt afraid to go big!

STAY HUMBLE ü§≤üèº

We embrace a beginner‚Äôs mindset‚Äîalways evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary!

A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see you soon.
Show more
HTML:
Hi! üëãüèº

At Shakers, we're on the lookout for a Data & Analytics Specialist to take our Product team to the next level üöÄ

  • Team and Role

If you have experience in working autonomously on technical data projects, thrive in a dynamic startup environment, and are ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you.

This role offers the opportunity to enhance Shakers' analytics, with the chance to shape the next generation way of working. If you‚Äôre excited by the prospect of working in a fast-paced, innovative environment, collaborating with a talented team, and making a direct impact, this is the opportunity for you! ü§©

  • What you¬¥ll be doing

Your day-to-day as a Data & Analytics Specialist:

  • Writing efficient SQL queries for large-scale data warehouses.
  • Defining, building, and maintaining ETL models in our data warehouse (BigQuery) using dbt and Airflow.
  • Building data integrations and ensuring data quality across pipeline layers.
  • Documenting and maintaining code and queries in GitLab.
  • Creating dashboards and reports in Looker/Looker Studio/Metabase to communicate results and track KPIs.
  • Conducting exploratory analysis to shape projects and provide actionable recommendations.
  • Presenting insights to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
  • Collaborating with PMs, designers, and engineers to define data needs, request app events, integrate third-party tools, and develop data models.
  • Supporting feature design with product managers and engineers through performance measurement and impact testing.
  • Developing organization-wide data sources to empower business teams in data exploration.
  • Working across teams to improve data practices and promote a data-driven culture.
  • What we¬¥re looking for

You¬¥re a great fit if you...

  • Strong alignment with our principles‚Äîwe take this very seriously.
  • At least 2 years of experience as a Data analyst/engineer.
  • Proficiency in writing and understanding complex SQL queries and handling large datasets.
  • Experience using Python for data science tasks (data cleaning, API calls, SQL calls, modeling)
  • Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, or Looker.
  • A graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields.
  • Fluency in English and Spanish.

Bonus points:

  • A Master's degree or Bootcamp in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related sciences.
  • Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar.
  • Experience working with vector DDBB and building data resources for AI consumption
  • What's in it for you?

Compensation üí∞

The salary range for this position is between 40.250‚Ç¨ and 51.750‚Ç¨ OTE (on target earnings) gross annual salary.

The salary consists of:

  • Between 35.000‚Ç¨ & 45.000‚Ç¨ fixed salary
  • Up to 6.750‚Ç¨ quarterly bonus based on performance & potential (15%)

Why you¬¥ll love working at Shakers üíö

  • Be part of a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup. üåç
  • Have an ambitious professional development plan to help you reach your full potential.
  • Enjoy an unbeatable team culture‚Äîask anyone on our team!
  • Take advantage of our hybrid ful flex methodology: a mix of remote and in-office work, with our office located in the heart of Madrid, Calle Vel√°zquez.
  • Perks include wellness programs, gym access, English classes, medical insurance, and more.

At the office... üìç

  • Wellness programs, English classes, private medical insurance, and more
  • Organic fruit, great coffee and vibrant energy!
  • In our Madrid office, catered lunch included
  • Our recruitment process

As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process.

Our goal is to have you onboard this July, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one!

The Road to Joining Our Team

  • Round 1, Cultural Fit: Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don‚Äôt worry‚Äîwe just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
  • Round 2, Case Study & Technical Skills with Product Team: Join two members of our Product team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your client management skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.
  • Round 3, Meet the Team: Have a conversation with additional team members to further explore your skillset and ensure there's a great cultural fit. This is also your chance to ask questions and see how we collaborate.
  • Final check, CEO Chat: Meet H√©ctor, our CEO! He‚Äôs excited to connect with you, talk about Shakers‚Äô future, and discuss your vision and expectations.

More about Shakers

At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working.

Our vision is to be the leading community and platform in the world that helps companies work with freelance teams through our technology.

We are a 70-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!

Our DNA

At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!

WINNING TEAM üèÜ

We all feel like part of a winning team‚Äîone that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.

F1C10 üí™üèº

We‚Äôre building an environment where fear doesn‚Äôt hold us back. Experimentation and learning from failure are part of our DNA. Fail fast, grow faster. Fail 1X, chase 10X. We value risk-takers who aren‚Äôt afraid to go big!

STAY HUMBLE ü§≤üèº

We embrace a beginner‚Äôs mindset‚Äîalways evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary!

A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see you soon.

Title: Data Analyst with Tableau and SQL (Hybrid - Madrid)
Description:
üöÄ We are still looking for the very Top Talent‚Ä¶and we would be delighted if you were to join our team!

More in details, UST is a multinational company based in North America, certified as a Top Employer and Great Place to Work company with over 35.000 employees all over the world and presence in more than 35 countries. We are leaders on digital technology services, and we provide large-scale technologic solutions to big companies.




üîé What we look for?

We are looking for a Data Business Analyst with at least 3 years of experience to join the Data Visualization Competence Center with Tableau and SQL skills to support the transition to a new data platform of our client from the banking sector.




High english level is required.




Availability to go to the client's offices in the centre of Madrid 3 days a week.




‚öô Key Responsibilities:

Analyse the current BI landscape, understand business needs, and identify gaps between the legacy and future data environments.

Building dashboards.




üí° Mandatory requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field such as Data Analytics, Computer Science, Business Intelligence, or related discipline 3+ years in a data/BI/business analyst or similar role
Solid hands-on experience with Tableau and SQL
Ability to conduct gap analysis and map current vs future state in data/reporting environments
Skilled in creating clear, structured documentation
Ability to understand and communicate data/reporting-related changes and its business impact
Ability to translate technical findings into clear, business-friendly insights Data analysis and problem solving skills
Exceptional communication skills to interact with both technical teams and business stakeholders.
Detail-oriented mindset with the ability to manage multiples tasks and prioritize effectively
Proactive, collaborative, and customer-focused approach to solving problems
English at least B2+/C1




üí∞ ¬øWhat can we offer?

-‚úàÔ∏è 23 days of Annual Leave plus the 24th and 31st of December as discretionary days!

-‚ù§Ô∏è Numerous benefits (Heath Care Plan, Internet Connectivity, Life and Accident Insurances).

-üç¥ `Retribuci√≥n Flexible¬¥ Program: (Meals, Kinder Garden, Transport, online English lessons, Heath Care Plan‚Ä¶)

-üöÄ Professional stability and career plans

Title: AI & Data Intelligence Specialist
Description:
Overview

At The Roadmap, we‚Äôve helped hundreds of businesses grow fast ‚Äî and now we‚Äôre building the next phase of our company with AI, automation, and smarter systems at the core of how we work.

We‚Äôre looking for an AI & Data Intelligence Specialist to help us connect the dots ‚Äî across leads, trends, client behaviour, and internal systems. This is a hybrid role, based in Madrid (2 days in-office, 3 days remote), and will play a key part in helping our sales, marketing, and leadership teams work faster, smarter, and more strategically.

This role is perfect for someone who loves research, pattern recognition, AI tools, and deep work. You don‚Äôt need to be a communicator or strategist ‚Äî but you do need to be obsessed with structure, curious about tech, and excited to make systems better for everyone around you.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

You‚Äôll work with the leadership, sales, and marketing teams to:


Research business data across industries, platforms, and lead sources
Structure and organise data so it‚Äôs actionable and easy to use
Use AI tools to assist with research, analysis, and automation
Spot patterns in company behaviour and share insights with sales/marketing
Help build internal systems to qualify leads, prioritise outreach, and support campaign targeting
Continuously experiment with new tools and methods to improve speed, accuracy, and output


This Role Is For Someone Who...


Loves deep research, structuring data, and figuring out how things work
Is excited by AI and curious about how to use it for automation, analysis, and workflow design
Enjoys working independently, focusing on detailed work without distraction
Is naturally organised and methodical ‚Äî and likes turning chaos into clean, structured output
Is based in Madrid or willing to relocate for a hybrid HQ role
Wants to work with a team that values clarity, trust, and the freedom to experiment


What Makes This Role Different


You‚Äôll help build something new ‚Äî not follow old processes
You‚Äôll work across departments but stay focused on structure, insights, and execution
You‚Äôll be encouraged to explore tools, test ideas, and find smarter ways of working
You‚Äôll have the freedom to go deep into research, build systems, and let your work speak for itself
You won‚Äôt be expected to pitch, present, or lead calls ‚Äî just to build the brainpower behind the work


Perks and Benefits


Hybrid setup ‚Äì 2 days in the Madrid office, 3 days remote
Flexibility to travel while working
4.2-day work week rolling out soon
Access to advanced tools and AI platforms ‚Äî with freedom to explore new ones
Multiple business areas to work across ‚Äî from sales and strategy to marketing and onboarding
Competitive base salary based on experience
Bonuses tied to the impact of your work and company growth
Pay reviews and role evolution as systems mature and the team expands
Supportive, focused team that values smart thinking and efficient systems


About The Roadmap

Established in 2019, our marketing agency offers personalized digital services to lay solid foundations and improve your online presence with a custom marketing roadmap for your business.

Our Team

We‚Äôre a team of international young professionals aiming to make marketing refreshingly simple for businesses and brands.

Our Values

We go above and beyond to exceed your expectations, constantly innovating with our marketing roadmap to stay ahead of the curve.

More about us

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Dow Jones Barcelona Job ID About Our Organization

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world's largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America's largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron's, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor's Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

About The Team

Our Technology team drives the evolution of our Technology, Engineering, Data, Product and User Experience functions. With a keen focus on delivering cutting-edge solutions, we shape the digital landscape for our customers, readers, and users. From revolutionizing visuals to optimizing tools and harnessing the power of data, mobile, video, and social platforms, our team is committed to providing a seamless and immersive experience across all touchpoints. Collaborating closely with our newsrooms and strategic partners, we spearhead the development of groundbreaking products and technologies.

About The Role

The B2C Analytics team focuses on developing analytics solutions to help the organization make better data driven decisions. Our team is passionate about enabling others to use data and analysis to measure and monitor performance, identify risks and opportunities and find ways to continually add value.

This role will primarily support the Consumer side of the business, which includes WSJ, Barron's, MarketWatch and more; but may also include exposure to other areas of the business, such as advertising and the professional information business. The ideal candidate will have previous experience in developing datasets, dashboards and data solutions that drive core insights. This position will report to the Senior Manager, B2C Analytics.

You Will


Develop partnerships with Product, Marketing, Newsroom, Finance, Data Collection, Data Engineering and other B2C Stakeholder Business teams and work across all levels and areas of the organization.
Build data project roadmaps based on Business teams' priorities.
Build a thorough understanding of all the B2C data sources that we use in our Analysis projects
Partner with data engineers and data collection colleagues to collect, cleanse and consistently organize data.
Analyze large datasets to surface trends and deliver recommendations with tangible business outcomes.
Create intuitive reports, dashboards and data solutions using visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker Studio)
Continuously identify ways to improve and refine processes around data and reporting
Ensure the quality of data and reporting, and partner with teams to improve accuracy and consistency
Communicate technical information clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences


You Have


Up to 2 years of experience in similar roles.
The ability to own your projects proactively and coordinate with multiple stakeholders.
Undergraduate degree or equivalent in combination of training and experience in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related disciplines.
Experience with SQL and knowledge of Excel/Sheets. Familiarity with Github, Python/R.
Experience with data visualizations tools and techniques, and using data to tell a story (e.g. Tableau, Looker, etc.)
Experience with web analytics tools (particularly Google Analytics 4 and Adobe Analytics).


Our Benefits


Comprehensive Healthcare Plans for you and your family (paid by Dow Jones)
Extra paid Time Off (30 days of holidays/year)
Possibility to work remotely for 3 months/year (desplazamiento program) or one week of remote work per quarter
Meal benefit with Pluxee (171‚Ç¨/month on top of your salary)
Retirement Plans (Dow Jones will pay 2% of a members Pensionable Salary and match employee contribution up to a maximum of 3 %).
Comprehensive Insurance Plans
Well-being Resources (200 USD allowance per quarter, Classpass, etc.)
Family Care Benefits & Caregiving Support
Subscription Discounts
Employee Referral Program


\

This is a hybrid remote/in-office role, based in Barcelona.

Reasonable accommodation: Dow Jones, Making Careers Newsworthy - We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. EEO/Disabled/Vets. We strongly encourage applications from all qualified individuals, including women, people with disabilities, and those from underrepresented groups. Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, email us at talentresourceteam@dowjones.com. Please put "Reasonable Accommodation" in the subject line and provide a brief description of the type of assistance you need. This inbox will not be monitored for application status updates.

Business Area: Dow Jones - Technology

Job Category: Data Analytics/Warehousing & Business Intelligence

Union Status

Non-Union role

Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world‚Äôs top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron‚Äôs, MarketWatch and Financial News.

This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Barcelona - Spain

Flexible working: 60% home office / week‚ÄØ

Job type: Permanent, Full time‚ÄØ - Hybrid

About The Job

At Sanofi, we're committed to providing next-gen healthcare through the power of data insights and AI. As a Data Engineer in our Manufacturing & Supply Digital Data Foundations team, you'll play a crucial role in transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive innovation and business value. You'll be part of an exciting journey to revolutionize our manufacturing processes through data-driven decision making.

We are an innovative global healthcare company with one purpose: to chase the miracles of science to improve people's lives. Our Digital Data & Technology organization is transforming Sanofi into an AI-driven powerhouse, creating trusted, high-quality data platforms that enable better decision-making across our global operations.

Main Responsibilities


Design and implement robust data engineering pipelines for Manufacturing & Supply systems, including SAP S4/HANA, QMS, LIMS, and MES
Create and maintain data integration solutions with comprehensive lifecycle management
Develop data visualization solutions using design-thinking approaches to deliver high-value products
Collaborate with cross-functional teams in agile pods to understand and translate business requirements
Ensure data quality and compliance with regulatory requirements (Data Privacy, GxP, SOX)
Build and optimize data models to support Manufacturing & Supply analytics needs


About You


Experience in data engineering and ETL/ELT development, particularly with Informatica/IICS and DBT/Airflow
Strong SQL skills and proficiency in Python for data transformation
Knowledge of data governance principles and quality assessment methodologies
Experience with cloud technologies, preferably AWS
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related field
Agile mindset with excellent communication and collaboration skills


Why choose us?


Drive innovation at the intersection of healthcare and technology
Develop your expertise with cutting-edge data and AI platforms
Enjoy a thoughtful rewards package that recognizes your contribution
Take advantage of flexible working arrangements and comprehensive health benefits
Work with global teams on transformative digital initiatives
Access continuous learning opportunities and career growth paths


nullPursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Join Sanofi and step into a new era of science - where your growth can be just as transformative as the work we do. We invest in you to reach further, think faster, and do what‚Äôs never-been-done-before. You‚Äôll help push boundaries, challenge convention, and build smarter solutions that reach the communities we serve. Ready to chase the miracles of science and improve people‚Äôs lives? Let‚Äôs Pursue Progress and Discover Extraordinary ‚Äì together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Barcelona, Spain


At Sanofi, we chase the miracles of science to improve people‚Äôs lives. We believe our cutting-edge science and manufacturing, fueled by data and digital technologies, have the potential to transform the practice of medicine, turning the impossible into possible for millions of people.

As one of Canada‚Äôs leading investors in life sciences, manufacturing and research and development, we focus on delivering new and better ways to address unmet medical needs. Our life-changing and lifesaving products are grounded in science that Canadians can trust. They empower self-care, prevent and treat diseases, and help people live better.

Our vision for digital, data analytics and AI

Sanofi has embarked into a vast and ambitious digital transformation program. A cornerstone of this roadmap is the acceleration of its data transformation and of the adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) solutions. This has enabled us, to accelerate R&D, improve manufacturing and commercial performance, and bring novel drugs and vaccines to patients faster, all in order to improve health and save lives.

The Digital Team at Sanofi is a unique data-driven team. We pride ourselves on being data obsessed and highly focused on using state of the art processes along with global technologies to drive impact to our solutions. We measure our insights and products based on how they perform across the globe and hold ourselves to the highest regard as our solutions can impact millions of lives. When tackling a problem, we do not just ask how we will create a solution, but how we will create a solution that reaches across the world with the best possible societal outcome.

If you are passionate about improving the health and wellness of people across the globe using Data as your means, then you should look no farther than the Digital Team here at Sanofi. Join us on our journey in enabling Sanofi‚Äôs Digital Transformation through becoming an AI first organization.

AI Factory - Versatile Teams Operating in Cross Functional Pods: Utilizing digital and data resources to develop AI products, bringing data management, AI and product development skills to products, programs and projects to create an agile, fulfilling and meaningful work environment.

Leading Edge Tech Stack: Experience build products that will be deployed globally on a leading-edge tech stack.

World Class Mentorship and Training: Working with renowned, published leaders and academics in machine learning to further develop your skillsets.

About You

Reporting directly to the Diamond Product, the Data Analyst for Diamond will manage both data and business needs. Having an advanced analytics mindset, able to coach others of technical functions in this area.

Managing data analysis and usage requirements, focusing on data and integration-intensive initiatives. Primary responsibilities include working with and understanding data analysis, as well as integration requirements, guiding solution design and architecture to meet these needs. Additionally, tasked with business analyst responsibilities.

Using a deep understanding of business processes and technology to help business stakeholders achieve their desired outcomes.

Key Responsibilities


Data Analyst, will be directly accountable and responsible to: Data Modeling, Process Modeling, data management through the warehouse - processes, data quality auditing and logging to benchmark. This also requires the ability to report out the state of data quality, help with preparation of data verification and testing methods, and process automation.
Identify and analyze business needs and coordinate between stakeholder groups to address them and deliver prompt, efficient, quality service.
Work with business stakeholders to understand requirements for data use, analysis, and quality, Leverage data and facts to identify patterns, using judgment to form conclusions that may challenge conventional wisdom, and focusing on the issues to identify high leverage intervention points and strategies.
Manage requirements elicitation, analysis and documentation processes to capture business and end user needs.
Support business case creation, Communicate solution tradeoffs to business stakeholders to frame and influence project decisions.
Promote usability standards and design solutions with a high-quality, effortless UX.
Identify and aggregate data from internal and external sources, Proactively monitor industry, functional, and technology trends, Identify new opportunities to leverage data and to integrate data or applications to enhance business value.
Deliver in compliance with quality, regulatory (Data Privacy, GxP, SOX, etc.) and cybersecurity requirements.


Key Requirements


3 years of experience as Analyst (performed data manipulation, data analysis, data management), Experience in a healthcare company is a strong plus.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer sciences or Equivalent professional experience.
Preferred Certifications: Six Sigma, Professional Scrum Certification.
Expert in Data manipulation techniques, Data quality and audit techniques , Good understanding of cloud computing and data solution design
Preferred Knowledge of ETL/ELT, Snowflake, SQL, Informatica, AWS
Accountable, Proactive, Collaborative and Agile, Pragmatic and capable of solving complex issues.
Continuous improvement mindset, Must be a team player and possess excellent communication, collaboration and interpersonal skills.
Action orientated with ability to work quickly and efficiently in a fast-moving environment, Ability to multi-task and prioritize effectively.


Pursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Progress doesn‚Äôt happen without people ‚Äì people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. You can be one of those people. Chasing change, embracing new ideas and exploring all the opportunities we have to offer. Let‚Äôs pursue progress. And let‚Äôs discover extraordinary together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.

Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!

Discover our Code of Conduct, that serves as the moral compass that guides us when chasing the miracles of science to improve people‚Äôs lives. Please ensure to have read this document, before applying.

Join Sanofi and step into a new era of science - where your growth can be just as transformative as the work we do. We invest in you to reach further, think faster, and do what‚Äôs never-been-done-before. You‚Äôll help push boundaries, challenge convention, and build smarter solutions that reach the communities we serve. Ready to chase the miracles of science and improve people‚Äôs lives? Let‚Äôs Pursue Progress and Discover Extraordinary ‚Äì together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Craft:

Data, Analytics & Strategy

Job Description:

We're looking for a talented and proactive Data Analyst to help shape the future of Player Support at King. In this role, you'll play a critical part in understanding how millions of players engage with our games and services, while providing insights that drive meaningful improvements across our support and game operations.

You‚Äôll work closely with the Player Support Operations, Community, Automation, and Studio Support teams to drive analytical excellence. If you‚Äôre passionate about transforming data into clear actions, collaborating with diverse stakeholders, and having a real impact on the player experience, this is your opportunity.

Your Role Within Our Kingdom

As our Data Analyst in Player Support, you‚Äôll be embedded in a fun, dynamic and fast-paced environment. You‚Äôll serve as a trusted analytical partner to Player Support leadership and studio teams, helping us better understand, model, and optimize how we support our players.

Your key responsibilities:


Monitor, analyze, and report on daily player message inflow across channels (including Zendesk and Sprinklr), identifying volume spikes, sentiment changes, trending issues, and emerging opportunities.
Design and manage recurring and ad-hoc reporting for Player Support and Game teams, supporting visibility into KPIs such as ticket deflection, automation success rate, contact reasons, or satisfaction scores.
Define and evaluate AB tests across player-facing features or support optimizations, ensuring rigorous experiment design and insightful results interpretation.
Translate business questions into data-driven analyses and dashboards that guide decision-making.
Partner with teams across Community, Automation, Studio Support, and external partners to drive improvement initiatives with measurable outcomes.
Contribute to OKRs, business reviews, and strategic planning through a data lens.
Be a go-to person for data interpretation and help foster a culture of curiosity and continuous learning.


Skills To Create Thrills

You don't need to know everything on day one, but here's what will help you thrive in this role:

Technical Skills


Proficiency in SQL (you write complex queries comfortably and efficiently).
Experience with Python or R for statistical analysis and data modeling.
Ability to design clean and intuitive dashboards using tools like Looker or equivalent BI platforms.
Familiarity with Sprinklr for social data analysis is a plus.
Experience with BigQuery, Google Cloud Platform, and working with large datasets is preferred.
Bonus if you‚Äôve worked with Zendesk or customer service tools.


Business Insight


You‚Äôre curious, structured, and understand how data connects to player behavior and business impact.
You can identify key metrics, segment player behaviors, and assess operational performance.


Communication & Collaboration


You translate data into compelling stories and clear recommendations for both technical and non-technical audiences.
You are proactive, organized, and comfortable presenting your findings to leadership and partner teams.


Why Join Us?

You‚Äôll be part of a global community of 100+ analytics experts at King, and you‚Äôll work on challenges that directly affect millions of players worldwide. In Player Support, we‚Äôre not just solving operational puzzles ‚Äî we‚Äôre improving how people experience and enjoy our games.

About King

With a mission of Making the World Playful, King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world‚Äôs most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as Farm Heroes Saga. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malm√∂, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king_games on X.

King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malm√∂, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king_games on X.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We Are Waiting for You

Hi there!

I am Laura the recruiter for this position (and hopefully, your future colleague!).

First, a little bit about what I like the most about working at ServiZurich: The environment here is incredibly collaborative and innovative. Our tech-driven mindset fosters continuous learning and growth, creating an atmosphere where everyone can thrive. Now, I can't wait to share this exciting journey with you at the Zurich!

Let me take a wild guess: you‚Äôve probably sifted through countless job offers today, and they all seem to blur together. Sound familiar? Well, here‚Äôs the scoop: At Zurich, we might not have all the answers (and we‚Äôre not striving for perfection!), but we‚Äôve got something special. Curious? Keep reading!

First off, THANK YOU for considering our company. We understand that finding the right opportunity can be tough, but I‚Äôll try to make it easier.

Who Are We?

Let me introduce us. You‚Äôre reading about Zurich Insurance Group, a global leader in insurance, but this role specifically pertains to ServiZurich. Established in Barcelona in 2006, ServiZurich operates as an integral part of Zurich Insurance Group, providing cutting-edge technological solutions and support to Zurich's local and global business units.

In addition to our technological solutions, we excel in investment, administration, and accounting, ensuring comprehensive support for Zurich's diverse operations.

What Can You Expect?

Zurich Global Employee Benefits Solutions (ZGEBS) is a business unit within Zurich Insurance Group whose objective is to support multinational customers in structuring global employee benefits solutions that cover local and/or international employees in multiple countries. ZGEBS manages and operates captive, pooling and International Program (ZIPE) solutions that combine local insurance policies ‚Äì provided by local Zurich units or selected external partners ‚Äì into a reinsurance arrangement for multinational customers. These offerings cover employee benefits insurance risks such as death, disability, accident and medical coverages.

We are excited to invite applications to implement our ambitious objective to grow and expand our business around the world.

The Data Analyst works cross functionally with Sales, Underwriting and Finance to deliver key services to out global customers, including portfolio analysis and performance reporting.

You have experience in working in a fast paced international business environment, analytic thinker who likes to solve problems and deliver service excellence in collaboration with different stakeholders. You like to work in a dynamic team where activities are based on capabilities, skills and willingness to help each other.

And you might be thinking: This is great, what will my day-to-day be like, at Zurich? I‚Äôm glad you asked ‚Äì I asked myself the same question at the time.

As a Data Analyst you will have the opportunity to:


Manage relationship and activities related to our Network Partners and Customers
Producing professional Customer and Network Partners data analytics / reports
Streamlinining processes and data analysis to ensure excellent delivery standard
Monitoring portfolio data and performance
Proactively ensuring customer satisfaction through the monitoring and implementation of related metrics.
Establishing best practice to optimize end service delivery
Ensuring financial and accounting closing are performed according to deadlines
Actively collaborating with other teams and Subject Matter Experts to identify relevant data sources, help develop and improve operational and customer reports
Work alongside experts in various technological domains.
Enhance your skills with real-world experience
Contribute to a team that values your input and creativity.


What Makes You a Great Fit?

While we‚Äôre not seeking perfection or expecting you to save the world, we believe that if you meet some of these requirements, you‚Äôll be a fantastic fit for our team. We are waiting for you!


A university degree, preferably in an analytical numerical field (Finance / Accounting, Data Science, Math, or Statistics)
Relevant work experience of 3-5 years related to the above mentioned responsibilities
Basic knowledge in the insurance business is preferred.
Excellent understanding of data administration and management functions (collection, analysis, distribution etc.)
Ability to work with large data sets across different business segments and extrapolate findings to support decision-making
Communication, presentation, project management and relationship skills
Proven experience in financial reporting and/or accounting; strong understanding of financial data processes is essential.
Solid analytical and problem-solving skills, with advanced Excel knowledge; experience in Power BI or similar data visualization tools preferred.
English at business fluency level (written and spoken), as the role is customer-facing and requires communication with international stakeholders.
Strong organizational skills and ability to manage deadlines under pressure.
Team player with proactive attitude and attention to detail.


And‚Ä¶ What Makes Us Special?

As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus, we offer:


To support your work-life balance, we have adopted a flexible working model.
Over 300 euros to set up your home office and additional monthly home office allowance.
Wide range of internal and external trainings, including English and Spanish classes depending on the needs.
Ticket restaurant and Health Insurance with the flexibility to exchange it for other benefits.
Life and accident insurance.
Collective Life retirement Plan
2000 referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you to the company.
Special banking and insurance conditions plus Exclusive Employees discounts
Functional diversity benefits
Different social clubs such as hiking, investment, beach volley and many more


Where Are We Located?

Bac de Roda, Barcelona.

We Are Waiting for You.

It‚Äôs a match? Don‚Äôt wait any longer! Apply by sending your CV in English.

If not, no worries! We‚Äôll meet again in the future. Feel free to share my contact details with anyone you think would be a great fit.

At Zurich, we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best-qualified individuals available, regardless of race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, or disability.

ServiZurich‚Äì Your Talent, Our Strength

Why Zurich

At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?

We are an equal opportunity employer who knows that each employee is unique - that‚Äôs what makes our team so great!

Join us as we constantly explore new ways to protect our customers and the planet.


Location(s): ES - Barcelona
Remote working: Hybrid
Schedule: Full Time
Recruiter name: Laura Santamar√≠a Rodr√≠guez

Title: Data Analyst - Business Performance Analytics
Description:
What You'll Do:

As part of the Business Performance Analytics (BPAX) team within Sales Strategy, your primary mission will be to deliver robust, intuitive, and actionable business insights that empower Criteo‚Äôs CRO and Commercial leaders to shape and drive the company‚Äôs commercial strategy.

You will apply a data-driven approach to uncover insights and explain business performance. This role involves working with large and complex datasets, requiring strong analytical curiosity, creativity in data exploration, and the ability to synthesize findings into a compelling narrative that supports strategic decision-making.

Your Mission


Build advanced analytical views to decode and communicate global performance patterns
Perform in-depth competitive analyses, measuring the business impact of competitors‚Äô activities across key markets
Leverage external and internal data to understand client behavior, identify high-value client clusters (e.g., through CLTV studies), and qualify the potential of clients and prospects across new and existing business areas
Size business growth opportunities and risks, and translating findings into actionable recommendations for multiple levels of stakeholders



Who You Are:


2‚Äì3 years of experience in a similar analytics role (experience in AdTech is a plus)
A Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (e.g., Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or Business)
Strong analytical skills and intellectual curiosity, with the ability to structure and solve complex problems
Solid understanding of statistical modeling and data interpretation
Hands-on experience with SQL for data manipulation and extraction
Proficiency in Python for data analysis
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI and/or Tableau
Strong presentation skills (including PowerPoint), with the ability to translate complex data into clear business insights and actionable recommendations
Business acumen and the ability to act as a trusted advisor to commercial stakeholders
Excellent communication skills and fluency in English
A proactive, autonomous mindset, with the ability to manage multiple projects, set milestones, coordinate with cross-functional teams, and drive initiatives forward



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is a leader in commerce media, helping brands, agencies, and publishers create meaningful consumer connections through AI-powered advertising solutions. We‚Äôre shaping a more open and sustainable digital future for advertising.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices across the globe or from the comfort of home, our 3,600 Criteos collaborate together to build an open, impactful, and forward-thinking environment.

We foster a workplace where everyone is valued, and employment decisions are based solely on skills, qualifications, and business needs‚Äînever on non-job-related factors or legally protected characteristics.

What We Offer:

üè† Own your work style ‚Äì Build your work around your life and not the other way around.

üìà Grow with us ‚Äì Learning, mentorship & career development programs.

üí™ Your wellbeing matters ‚Äì Health benefits, wellness perks & mental health support.

ü§ù A team that cares ‚Äì Diverse, inclusive, and globally connected.

üí∏ Fair pay & perks ‚Äì Competitive salary, equity, performance-based rewards and family-friendly policies.

Additional benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¬°Hola Data Lover! üíô




¬øEst√°s en √∫ltimo curso o acabas de finalizar tus estudios en Ingenier√≠a Inform√°tica, Telecomunicaciones, Industriales, Ciencia de datos, Matem√°ticas u otra salida acad√©mica similar?

Somos l√≠deres globales, trabajamos con la mitad del IBEX-35 y no paramos de crecer desde 1994.

¬øCu√°l ser√° tu misi√≥n?

Title: Master Data Analyst
Description:
CUSTOMER SERVICE MASTER DATA ANALYST Location: Barcelona, Spain

The Customer Service Master Data Analyst is responsible for ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and timeliness of master data processes within the market. This role plays a key part in maintaining high-quality master data execution and overseeing data execution from the Shared Service Center. The role is critical for driving efficiency in master data management and ensuring seamless customer service operations.

Your main focus:


Ensure Master Data Readiness & Quality: Deliver accurate and timely data setup KPIs for product activation, PIPO management, customer setup, logistics, and pricing conditions. Guarantee data readiness for new product launches and promotional activities. Train Sales and Marketing teams to follow global standards and ensure accurate input using standard templates.
Governance and Execution of Master Data Processes: Own and enforce master data execution processes, ensuring compliance with business standards. Develop protocols and workflows to maintain master data quality and implement continuous improvement practices.
Oversee Shared Service Center Operations: Monitor and validate the quality of master data execution by the Shared Service Center, ensuring SLA adherence.
Conduct quality control checks and provide feedback to improve processes and performance.
Data Insights and Analytics: Consolidate master data insights and share them with the Master Data Leader to support informed decision-making.


Working for Coty means constant opportunities and change. You will be managing a lot of things at the same time, but this is also what makes it exciting!

Key success measures for the Customer Services Master Data Analyst include the following:


Timeliness and Accuracy: Ensure master data updates are completed within SLA timeframes and accurately on the first attempt.
Process and Compliance: Adhere to SLAs, protocols, governance standards, and achieve high audit compliance rates.
Quality and Efficiency: Maintain high QC pass rates, resolve data issues quickly, and ensure data completeness in all entries.
Stakeholder Satisfaction and Reporting: Deliver timely analytics and reports while achieving strong feedback from internal stakeholders.


The Customer Services Master Data Analyst will liaise with various cross-functional and remote teams, such as:


Customer Service Operations
Shared Service Center
Master Data Global Teams
IT CoE


YOU ARE A COTY FIT

You have excellent problem solving skills and have the ability to think quickly & work under tight deadlines. As a CS Master Data Analyst, you get energy from working in a fast-paced, diverse, and challenging environment. You have strong attention to detail and organisation skills, and can communicate effectively and collaborate with various stakeholders.

Other than that, we are looking for candidates who:


Have a Bachelor‚Äôs degree, higher vocational training or vocational training in Data Management, or a related field.
2 to 4 years of experience in master data management, customer service, or related fields.
Proficiency in SAP and data governance tools.
Basic fluency/proficiency in English and proficient or native in any of the following languages: Spanish, French, Italian, Dutch, German
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools will be a plus (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Tableau).
Familiarity with customer and product master data processes in SAP (customer set up, activation, PIPO, pricing conditions).


Our Benefits

As our Customer Service Master Data Analyst, some of the benefits you will receive are:


Competitive remuneration and perks will be matched with your experience and knowledge.
Ticket restaurant (daily diet for meals)
Company products / Access to the company shop
Life and accident insurance


RECRUITMENT PROCESS


A screening call with the recruiters
A first online/in-person interview with hiring managers
A second interview (optionally)
Feedback, verbal offer
Hiring


About Coty

Coty is one of the world‚Äôs largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skincare, and body care. At Coty, we celebrate the entire human kaleidoscope and cultivate a culture of fearless kindness. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against any candidate or employee and strive to be an open, inclusive and diverse workplace where all employees can be their authentic self. Join us in making over the world of beauty!

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.

What You‚Äôll Do & Who You Are

We are looking for an exceptional Data Analyst to join the Coches.Net, Motos.Net and Milanuncios.com team.

You will work as a member of multidisciplinary team, collaborating closely with Product owners, cluster teams, data engineers and management team stake-holders (Marketing, Sales, Product, BizDev and other Operations teams).Your main mission is to define and execute analyses of several business context to identify trends, opportunities and problems to improve the offering and services we offer.

These Will Be Your Functions


Identify, analyse and interpret KPIs and Health Metrics related to our users and customers, creating dashboard and visualisation to monitor them.
Identifying trends, risks and opportunities to provide insights that can make recommendations on how to improve the different initiatives of the vertical.
Create powerful Insights using Advanced analytics to improve the knowledge of our users and customers.
Actively participate in the discovery, and development of advanced analytical models (such as clustering, and predictive models), into their implementation in business use cases, such as customer segmentation, and propensity models for upselling, downselling, and churn prediction.


Qualifications


3+ years of experience in eCommerce, an online company.
Advanced knowledge of SQL and relational databases
Advanced knowledge of Python and/or R for data analysis (e.g. pandas, numpy, matplotlib), and advanced analytics (e.g. scikit-learn)
Advanced user of at least one visualisation tool such as Tableau and/or QlikSense.
Analytical skills: know how to interpret data, to extract relevant insights and be able to translate business questions into analytical needs Nice-to-have
Experience working with sales, operations, and strategy teams.
Good knowledge of basic machine learning algorithms (e.g. clustering, classification, regressions)
Some experience with big data technology (e.g. databricks, datalakes)
Some knowledge of data engineering tools (e.g. Airflow, DBT)Nice-to-have
Experience working with sales, operations, and strategy teams.
Good knowledge of basic machine learning algorithms (e.g. clustering, classification, regressions)
Some experience with big data technology (e.g. databricks, datalakes)
Some knowledge of data engineering tools (e.g. Airflow, DBT)


Benefits

Life at Adevinta comes with its perks! Our Adevintans enjoy the following benefits:


An attractive Base Salary üí∏
Participation in our Short Term Incentive plan (annual bonus) üèÜ
Work From Anywhere: Enjoy up to 20 days a year of working from anywhere! Maybe not from the moonüåõwell why not! just make sure you have internet connection! üåç
A 24/7 Employee Assistance Program for you and your family, because we care ‚ù§Ô∏è
Win together, lose together is one of our key behaviours. At Adevinta you will find a collaborative environment with an opportunity to explore your potential and grow üå±


On top of these, we also provide a range of locally relevant benefits. Wanna know more? Apply and ask our recruiters! ‚ú®

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

Title: Finance Data Analyst (100% remote-friendly within Europe)
Description:
About Us

At Docplanner Group, we‚Äôre on a mission to help people live longer, healthier lives. As the world‚Äôs largest healthcare platform, each month, we connect 24 million patients with 280k doctors across 13 countries (through brands like ZnanyLekarz, Doctoralia, MioDottore, DoktorTakvimi, and jameda). Our marketplaces, SaaS and AI tools simplify daily tasks and help doctors, clinics and hospitals work more efficiently, so they can focus on what really matters: caring for their patients.

Learn more about our products here: pro.doctoralia.es

Why Join Us?


üìä Real impact ‚Äì We help doctors help patients. Your work truly makes a difference.
üìà At scale, yet agile ‚Äì 3,000+ employees, but still fast, flexible, and hands-on.
üí∞ Pre-IPO & growing ‚Äì We‚Äôre backed by leading VC funds including One Peak Partners, Goldman Sachs Asset Management, and Point Nine Capital, raising a total of approx. ‚Ç¨400m to date. Now, we‚Äôre focused on profitability and IPO preparation. It‚Äôs an exciting time to join us.
‚ú® Shape the future, sustain growth ‚Äì Make a difference now *and* build for long-term success.


Job Description

The new team member, working within the Financial Reporting team, will play a key role in supporting the evolution of financial reporting in a challenging and stimulating environment. You will help bridge the gap between finance and BI. Our primary objective is to assist the business in making decisions based on data, with a particular emphasis on producing reports as the primary and most reliable source of information.

A team of 12 experts provides support to various departments, including marketing, sales, customer success, finance, and people experience, for both short-term and long-term projects. Collaborating closely with stakeholders, we strive to develop reports, analyses, models, and recommendations that enable us to gain a deep understanding of how we can enhance the satisfaction of both doctors and patients.

You will be an integral part of the Financial Reporting team, working closely with the Data Analytics team to support business decisions based on data.

How would you be impacting our mission


Financial Reporting and Analysis: Track key financial metrics and KPIs, ensuring they align with organizational goals; Develop and maintain comprehensive financial dashboards using advanced BI tools; Provide detailed insights into financial performance, trends, and variances; Provide insights for long-term strategic decisions;
Data Management and Integration: Ensure accurate and timely collection of financial data from systems like Oracle NetSuite; Integrate data from multiple sources for a unified financial view;
Performance Measurement: Analyze profitability and cost efficiency to identify improvement areas;
Regulatory and Compliance Reporting: Support audits and for regulatory documentation;
Automation and Process Improvement: Automate repetitive financial tasks to improve efficiency; Implement process improvements to reduce manual efforts and errors;
Enhanced Reporting and Visualization: Utilize BI tools like Tableau for dynamic, interactive reports and dashboards; Enhance report quality and accessibility beyond traditional spreadsheets.


Qualifications

What will help you thrive?


Bachelor's degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
Demonstrable experience in using SQL to derive actionable insights, either in commercial or academic setting (must have).
Knowledge of Python/R and desire to expand your knowledge.
Experience with statistical modeling and descriptive statistics.
Experience in partnership with internal stakeholders.
Experience in leading and executing end to end BI projects.
Strong written and oral communication skills in English; proficiency in other languages such as German, Spanish, and Italian is a plus.
Ability to gather, organize, analyze, and report large volumes of financial data with speed and accuracy.
Strong attention to detail with the ability to provide high-quality work efficiently.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to adapt and work in a quickly changing environment, managing competing demands.


Which skills are ‚Äòbonus points‚Äô?


Master's degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
Able to take a step back from the technicalities and examine them through a business lens.
Open to cooperating with a lot of people from many teams in different countries.
Like to see the instant effects of your work.
Knowledge of ERP finance applications (Oracle, Oracle - NetSuite, SAP).
Relevant experience in accounting and financial reporting.


Additional Information

What to Expect from Our Hiring Process

Role

We like to keep things transparent and efficient! Here‚Äôs what the process usually looks like (though it might vary slightly depending on the role):

1Ô∏è‚É£ Intro Chat ‚Äì A first call with our Talent Acquisition Partner to explore mutual fit around relevant skills, value alignment, and motivation.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Hiring Manager Interview ‚Äì A deeper dive into your experience and aspirations with your future manager, who you‚Äôll be reporting to in this role. Take this chance to ask anything on your mind‚Äîit‚Äôs just as much about making sure we‚Äôre the right fit for you, too.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Second Hiring Manager Interview

4Ô∏è‚É£ Business Case Presentation & Team Meeting

Why You‚Äôll Love It Here

üíô Global Benefits ‚Äì No matter where you are, you‚Äôll have access to:


Healthcare insurance ‚Äì so you can focus on what matters.
Wellness that works for you ‚Äì from gym memberships to mental health support, we‚Äôve got you covered.
Time off that counts ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a vacation, your birthday, or just a day to recharge, we believe in balance.
ESOP (Employee Share Ownership Plan) after 6 months with us‚Äîbecause we believe in sharing our success!


üìç Local Perks ‚Äì Depending on your location, you will be entitled to local benefits like meal vouchers (ticket restaurant), transport allowances, or extended parental leave.

üöÄ Career Growth ‚Äì We‚Äôre growing, and so can you! You‚Äôll find lots of chances to learn, develop, and explore new paths‚Äîwhether within your team or through cross-functional projects.

üåé A Truly Global Team ‚Äì Work with talented people from all over the world in a diverse and inclusive environment.

‚è≥ Flexibility That Works for You ‚Äì Remote work and flexible hours aren‚Äôt just buzzwords here. While the extent of flexibility depends on your role and team, we value results over rigid schedules. Prefer an office setting? You're welcome at any of our hubs in Barcelona, Warsaw, Curitiba, Rio de Janeiro, Mexico City, Bogot√°, Munich, Rome or Bologna.

HTML:
About Us

At Docplanner Group, we‚Äôre on a mission to help people live longer, healthier lives. As the world‚Äôs largest healthcare platform, each month, we connect 24 million patients with 280k doctors across 13 countries (through brands like ZnanyLekarz, Doctoralia, MioDottore, DoktorTakvimi, and jameda). Our marketplaces, SaaS and AI tools simplify daily tasks and help doctors, clinics and hospitals work more efficiently, so they can focus on what really matters: caring for their patients.

Learn more about our products here: pro.doctoralia.es

Why Join Us?

  • üìä Real impact ‚Äì We help doctors help patients. Your work truly makes a difference.
  • üìà At scale, yet agile ‚Äì 3,000+ employees, but still fast, flexible, and hands-on.
  • üí∞ Pre-IPO & growing ‚Äì We‚Äôre backed by leading VC funds including One Peak Partners, Goldman Sachs Asset Management, and Point Nine Capital, raising a total of approx. ‚Ç¨400m to date. Now, we‚Äôre focused on profitability and IPO preparation. It‚Äôs an exciting time to join us.
  • ‚ú® Shape the future, sustain growth ‚Äì Make a difference now *and* build for long-term success.

Job Description

The new team member, working within the Financial Reporting team, will play a key role in supporting the evolution of financial reporting in a challenging and stimulating environment. You will help bridge the gap between finance and BI. Our primary objective is to assist the business in making decisions based on data, with a particular emphasis on producing reports as the primary and most reliable source of information.

A team of 12 experts provides support to various departments, including marketing, sales, customer success, finance, and people experience, for both short-term and long-term projects. Collaborating closely with stakeholders, we strive to develop reports, analyses, models, and recommendations that enable us to gain a deep understanding of how we can enhance the satisfaction of both doctors and patients.

You will be an integral part of the Financial Reporting team, working closely with the Data Analytics team to support business decisions based on data.

How would you be impacting our mission

  • Financial Reporting and Analysis: Track key financial metrics and KPIs, ensuring they align with organizational goals; Develop and maintain comprehensive financial dashboards using advanced BI tools; Provide detailed insights into financial performance, trends, and variances; Provide insights for long-term strategic decisions;
  • Data Management and Integration: Ensure accurate and timely collection of financial data from systems like Oracle NetSuite; Integrate data from multiple sources for a unified financial view;
  • Performance Measurement: Analyze profitability and cost efficiency to identify improvement areas;
  • Regulatory and Compliance Reporting: Support audits and for regulatory documentation;
  • Automation and Process Improvement: Automate repetitive financial tasks to improve efficiency; Implement process improvements to reduce manual efforts and errors;
  • Enhanced Reporting and Visualization: Utilize BI tools like Tableau for dynamic, interactive reports and dashboards; Enhance report quality and accessibility beyond traditional spreadsheets.

Qualifications

What will help you thrive?

  • Bachelor's degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
  • Demonstrable experience in using SQL to derive actionable insights, either in commercial or academic setting (must have).
  • Knowledge of Python/R and desire to expand your knowledge.
  • Experience with statistical modeling and descriptive statistics.
  • Experience in partnership with internal stakeholders.
  • Experience in leading and executing end to end BI projects.
  • Strong written and oral communication skills in English; proficiency in other languages such as German, Spanish, and Italian is a plus.
  • Ability to gather, organize, analyze, and report large volumes of financial data with speed and accuracy.
  • Strong attention to detail with the ability to provide high-quality work efficiently.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to adapt and work in a quickly changing environment, managing competing demands.

Which skills are ‚Äòbonus points‚Äô?

  • Master's degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
  • Able to take a step back from the technicalities and examine them through a business lens.
  • Open to cooperating with a lot of people from many teams in different countries.
  • Like to see the instant effects of your work.
  • Knowledge of ERP finance applications (Oracle, Oracle - NetSuite, SAP).
  • Relevant experience in accounting and financial reporting.

Additional Information

Role

We like to keep things transparent and efficient! Here‚Äôs what the process usually looks like (though it might vary slightly depending on the role):

  • Wellness that works for you ‚Äì from gym memberships to mental health support, we‚Äôve got you covered.

  • ESOP (Employee Share Ownership Plan) after 6 months with us‚Äîbecause we believe in sharing our success!

Title: Data Analyst, Solutions & Innovation
Description:
What You'll Do:

As a member of our Analytics Solutions & Innovation (AXSI) team, you will act as a key analytical partner to our commercial organization, helping to steer innovation from the ground up. Your role will be crucial in developing new ways to measure and demonstrate value for our clients.


Solution Prototyping & Development: Translate complex business questions into scalable data analyses, prototyping new measurement methodologies for Criteo‚Äôs latest upper-funnel solutions using our rich shopper graph dataset.
Client & Internal Collaboration: Collaborate with internal teams and clients to deeply understand their business needs and how they measure the value of upper-funnel marketing activities.
Iterative Analysis & Validation: Design and execute analyses to validate new measurement approaches, iterating on prototypes with internal partners to refine them for production readiness.
Product Innovation & Scalability: Partner with Product and R&D teams to develop feature requests, transforming your successful analytical prototypes into scalable, fully-fledged Criteo products.
Data-Driven Innovation: Leverage cutting-edge tech like Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau, Git, Python, and SQL to build innovative analytical solutions from the ground up.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with commercial and product teams to deliver insights that drive the development of new, revenue-generating solutions.



Who You Are:


You have at least 1 year of hands-on data analysis experience, with proficiency in SQL and Python.
A natural problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
Business-minded with a talent for turning data insights into actionable product strategies.
Passionate about product development and turning analytical prototypes into real-world solutions.
Excellent ability to synthesize complex information and present clear, actionable recommendations.
A team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
Fluent in English and skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.
Eligible to work in Spain with no restrictions.



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform. üåü

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Data Analyst - Internship - Barcelona
Description:
This year marks 10 years since we launched our idea: to simplify our customers' lives by offering an innovative solution to easily subscribe to, manage, and change all types of contracts through a single, intuitive platform.

Since then, we have supported over 1.5 million customers in France, Spain, and Italy, while investing in new verticals. This has positioned us as a high-performing, innovative, and competitive scale-up in a fast-growing market.

With over 900 employees across 3 locations, we are consolidating our position as a leader in the European market. We are always looking for talented individuals ready to join a committed and motivated team driven by a purpose-driven mission. Working with us means embracing a culture of excellence, innovation, and real impact.


As a Data Analyst Intern based in our Barcelona office, you will actively work on diverse data challenges to help the team solve problems, become more efficient, and iterate faster by leveraging reliable data. We are looking for an intern for a 6-month period starting in September 2025.


Your Future Missions :

Create value through analytics:
- Perform ad hoc analyses to support decision-making, identify growth opportunities, and propose operational improvements.
- Automate team tasks by creating new, innovative tools.


Ensure data reliability and accessibility:
- Guarantee the reliability of data from various sources.
- Maintain and develop dashboards to make data accessible to the operations team.
Implement alert systems to identify potential issues and anticipate market changes.


Support our business teams:
- Automate the calculation of commissions for our sales team of over 400 people across France, Spain, and Italy.
- Calculate and automate compensation for our strategic partners.
- Build prioritization models for managing leads to maximize customer conversion rates.
- Monitor partner performance by building and visualizing key indicators.


Your Profile:

- You are a graduate of an engineering or business school.
- You are passionate about data and the digital world.
- You are meticulous, resourceful, and independent.
- You are proficient with SQL, data processing, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker).
- Experience with data science is a strong plus.
- You are proficient in English.
