Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Madrid, Spain (Relocation Package Included)




Job Summary:

We are seeking a results-driven Data Analyst with strong experience in Tableau, SQL, and data analytics to support data-driven decision-making across the organization. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets, building insightful dashboards, and delivering actionable business intelligence to key stakeholders.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop, maintain, and enhance interactive dashboards and reports using Tableau and other BI tools
Analyze large datasets using SQL to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that support strategic business decisions
Work with business stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into functional BI solutions
Perform gap analysis between legacy systems and new data platforms to ensure reporting continuity
Validate and reconcile data across different sources to ensure accuracy, completeness, and consistency
Communicate complex findings in a clear, concise, and business-friendly manner through reports, visualizations, and presentations
Assist in defining and documenting data definitions, business rules, and report specifications
Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and business units to support data initiatives




Required Skills and Qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Business Intelligence, or a related field
3+ years of professional experience as a Data Analyst, BI Analyst, or similar role
Strong expertise in SQL for data extraction, analysis, and validation
Proficient in using Tableau for building dashboards, data storytelling, and visualizations
Experience working with large datasets and relational databases
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail
Ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Proficiency with other BI tools (e.g., Power BI, QlikView, Looker) is a plus
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and data governance is desirable




Preferred Skills:

Experience working in cloud data environments (AWS, Azure, or GCP)
Familiarity with Python or R for data analysis (optional but beneficial)
Exposure to Agile development practices
Understanding of KPIs, metrics, and performance tracking in a business context

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Summary

Location: Barcelona (Hybrid) or Prague (Hybrid)

Day Rate: Negotiable

Duration: 6 Months

Availability: ASAP




About the Client

My client is the air transport industry's IT provider, delivering solutions for airlines, airports, aircraft, and governments. Their technology powers more seamless, safe, and sustainable air travel. They are looking to hire an experienced Data Analyst to join on a contract basis for a 4 month contract.




About the Role

We are seeking a detail-oriented and technically proficient Data Analyst to support the delivery and management of a centralized data archival system for financial and ERP platforms.

This is a techno-functional role that requires both hands-on technical skills and the ability to coordinate with cross-functional stakeholders to ensure successful implementation and ongoing management of the archival solution.

The successful candidate will play a key role in ensuring that legacy and historical financial data is securely archived, easily accessible when required, and fully compliant with data privacy standards and regulatory obligations.

Working closely with an external vendor, internal IT, and the Finance department, the candidate will help design, test, and optimize archival processes to ensure alignment with business needs.




Key Duties:

‚Ä¢ Lead and manage the testing, validation, and implementation of a centralized data archival system for finance and ERP data.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with external vendors and internal stakeholders (Finance, IT, Compliance) to ensure accurate delivery and integration of the archival solution.

‚Ä¢ Ensure all archived data meets internal compliance standards and external regulatory requirements for retention, security, and access.

‚Ä¢ Oversee and validate data mapping, extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) activities related to financial data archiving.

‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain documentation for archival processes, testing scripts, and compliance checks.

‚Ä¢ Monitor vendor performance and ensure deliverables are met according to project timelines and SLAs.

‚Ä¢ Identify and troubleshoot issues in data archival processes and recommend improvements where applicable.

‚Ä¢ Support audit and compliance reporting by providing timely access to archived data.




What we are looking for Knowledge & Skills:

‚Ä¢ Proven experience in data management, financial systems, or ERP platforms (such as SAP, Oracle, or Workday).

‚Ä¢ Strong SQL skills for querying, validating, and managing data sets.

‚Ä¢ Deep understanding of ERP data structures, particularly those related to finance and accounting modules.

‚Ä¢ Advanced Excel capabilities for data analysis, reconciliation, and reporting.

‚Ä¢ Experience with data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR) and financial data retention policies.

‚Ä¢ Demonstrated experience working with third-party vendors and cross-functional project teams.

‚Ä¢ Excellent analytical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills.

‚Ä¢ Strong attention to detail with a methodical and organized approach to data.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Pozuelo de Alarc√≥n, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Verisure is seeking a talented, innovative, passionate¬†Data Analyst to join our growing and successful Group Marketing Team, reporting to the Group Head of Web development & Analytics.

Verisure is building a talented and passionate Digital Marketing Team, and the Data Analyst position is key to its success! This is your chance to visibly impact on Verisure‚Äôs growth and the development of a best-in-class organization.

The role‚Äôs relevance in data collection and analysis is a great opportunity for a strong talent to develop our organization‚Äôs growth. Our success depends on our people, and we invest in them every day. Working with Verisure is being part of an industry leading, world-class company that thrives on a strong entrepreneurial spirit.

Key Responsibilities

As a core member of the Group Digital Marketing team, the Data Analyst will play a crucial role in driving data-informed decision-making by performing the following responsibilities:

Improving the quality and consistency of digital marketing tracking, collaborating with technical teams to maintain a robust data infrastructure and ensure the integrity of analytics data.
Designing, building, and maintaining marketing performance dashboards and reports using Tableau, Looker Studio or similar data visualization tools, ensuring clarity, accuracy, and usability for diverse stakeholders.
Engaging with cross-functional stakeholders to understand business needs, translate them into data requirements, and deliver actionable insights through compelling analysis and visual storytelling.
Partnering with teams across the organization, including Product, CRM, and Web, to identify data opportunities, support campaign measurement, and foster a data-driven culture.
Extracting and manipulating data using SQL to support advanced analytics and reporting needs.
Contributing to the development and lifecycle of Adtech products, including participation in requirement definition, data architecture design, and ongoing maintenance.

Location

The position will be based in Madrid (Spain).

Candidate profile

Qualifications, Experiences, and Competencies

Required Qualifications

Education & Experience

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Marketing, or a related field.
Minimum of 2‚Äì3 years of experience in data analysis within a digital marketing or Adtech environment.
Experience working in multinational or cross-market teams is a plus.

Technical Skills

Good understanding of digital tracking technologies, including GA4, Google Tag Manager, and custom event tracking.
Solid experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker Studio.
Familiarity with digital marketing platforms (e.g. Google Ads, Meta Ads, DV360, etc.).
Knowledge of marketing KPIs, attribution models, customer journey analysis, and performance measurement.
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, cleaning, and manipulation across large datasets.
Ability to handle large datasets and navigate data warehouse environments (experience with BigQuery is a plus).
Basic understanding of Python or R for automation and exploratory data analysis is an advantage.

Analytical & Business Acumen

Strong ability to translate business problems into analytical questions and deliver actionable insights.
Working knowledge of conversion funnel analysis, CRO strategies, and campaign optimization.
Experience with A/B testing design, analysis, and interpretation is a plus.

Communication & Collaboration

Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex insights clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product, CRM, Design, and Content.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and comfortable working autonomously in a fast-paced environment.

Languages

Fluent English is required (written and spoken).
Other languages (e.g. Spanish, French, German, or Nordic languages) are a plus.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience working with Google BigQuery or similar cloud-based data platforms.
Exposure to Adtech environments, CDPs (Customer Data Platforms), or server-side tracking.
Experience with automated reporting solutions or building data pipelines.
Familiarity with marketing mix modeling, predictive analytics, or machine learning use cases.
Certifications such as:
Google Analytics Certification
Tableau/Power BI certifications
Meta or Google Ads certifications

Strong fit with our Company DNA

Passionate in Everything We Do: Our people have a sense of energy that is unmistakable, one that drives us to delight our customers and focus on creating impact quickly.¬†

Committed to Making a Difference: When we say we will do something; we deliver with excellence. We are accountable, focused and operate with discipline.¬†

Always Innovating: We believe that Innovation can be big or small; it‚Äôs a continuous state of mind that inspires us to think differently and always make things better. We are risk takers and we learn continuously.¬†

Winning as a Team: Our people know that by leveraging one another‚Äôs strengths, investing in and developing our team‚Äôs capability and by collaborating well, we will win.

With Trust & Responsibility: Operating with integrity is core to our success. We are humble, honest and value deep mastery and expertise. We do the right thing, always.

The Company

Verisure is the leading European provider of professionally monitored security systems with 24/7 response services. We protect more than 5 million families and small businesses across 17 countries in Europe and Latin America. And our mission is to provide our customers peace of mind by protecting what matters most to them.

With over 35 years of insight, experience, and innovation, Verisure is known for category-creating marketing, sales excellence, innovative products and services, and customer-centricity. Thanks to a strong focus on high quality, our customers are amongst the most satisfied and loyal in our industry. We have some of the strongest double-digit growth and retention rates globally in consumer-facing services which demonstrates our exceptional service levels and strong value proposition to our customers.

Diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging at Verisure

At Verisure, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace, recognising that diversity of thought and background only makes our teams stronger and more innovative. We reject all forms of discrimination and bias, and we believe in access to opportunities for everyone, regardless of gender, age, disability status, race, sexual orientation, or any other status. Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging values are embedded in our company‚Äôs DNA. And we continue to prioritise our DEIB efforts every day to create a more inclusive organisation, enable diverse representation of our community, and ensure equity and meritocracy every step of the way.
¬†

HTML:
Verisure is seeking a talented, innovative, passionate Data Analyst to join our growing and successful Group Marketing Team, reporting to the Group Head of Web development & Analytics.

Verisure is building a talented and passionate Digital Marketing Team, and the Data Analyst position is key to its success! This is your chance to visibly impact on Verisure‚Äôs growth and the development of a best-in-class organization.

The role‚Äôs relevance in data collection and analysis is a great opportunity for a strong talent to develop our organization‚Äôs growth. Our success depends on our people, and we invest in them every day. Working with Verisure is being part of an industry leading, world-class company that thrives on a strong entrepreneurial spirit.

Key Responsibilities

As a core member of the Group Digital Marketing team, the Data Analyst will play a crucial role in driving data-informed decision-making by performing the following responsibilities:

  • Improving the quality and consistency of digital marketing tracking, collaborating with technical teams to maintain a robust data infrastructure and ensure the integrity of analytics data.
  • Designing, building, and maintaining marketing performance dashboards and reports using Tableau, Looker Studio or similar data visualization tools, ensuring clarity, accuracy, and usability for diverse stakeholders.
  • Engaging with cross-functional stakeholders to understand business needs, translate them into data requirements, and deliver actionable insights through compelling analysis and visual storytelling.
  • Partnering with teams across the organization, including Product, CRM, and Web, to identify data opportunities, support campaign measurement, and foster a data-driven culture.
  • Extracting and manipulating data using SQL to support advanced analytics and reporting needs.
  • Contributing to the development and lifecycle of Adtech products, including participation in requirement definition, data architecture design, and ongoing maintenance.

Location

The position will be based in Madrid (Spain).

Candidate profile

Qualifications, Experiences, and Competencies

Required Qualifications

Education & Experience

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Marketing, or a related field.
  • Minimum of 2‚Äì3 years of experience in data analysis within a digital marketing or Adtech environment.
  • Experience working in multinational or cross-market teams is a plus.

Technical Skills

  • Good understanding of digital tracking technologies, including GA4, Google Tag Manager, and custom event tracking.
  • Solid experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker Studio.
  • Familiarity with digital marketing platforms (e.g. Google Ads, Meta Ads, DV360, etc.).
  • Knowledge of marketing KPIs, attribution models, customer journey analysis, and performance measurement.
  • Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, cleaning, and manipulation across large datasets.
  • Ability to handle large datasets and navigate data warehouse environments (experience with BigQuery is a plus).
  • Basic understanding of Python or R for automation and exploratory data analysis is an advantage.

Analytical & Business Acumen

  • Strong ability to translate business problems into analytical questions and deliver actionable insights.
  • Working knowledge of conversion funnel analysis, CRO strategies, and campaign optimization.
  • Experience with A/B testing design, analysis, and interpretation is a plus.

Communication & Collaboration

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex insights clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product, CRM, Design, and Content.
  • Proactive, detail-oriented, and comfortable working autonomously in a fast-paced environment.

Languages

  • Fluent English is required (written and spoken).
  • Other languages (e.g. Spanish, French, German, or Nordic languages) are a plus.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience working with Google BigQuery or similar cloud-based data platforms.
  • Exposure to Adtech environments, CDPs (Customer Data Platforms), or server-side tracking.
  • Experience with automated reporting solutions or building data pipelines.
  • Familiarity with marketing mix modeling, predictive analytics, or machine learning use cases.
  • Certifications such as:
    • Google Analytics Certification
    • Tableau/Power BI certifications
    • Meta or Google Ads certifications

Strong fit with our Company DNA

  • Passionate in Everything We Do: Our people have a sense of energy that is unmistakable, one that drives us to delight our customers and focus on creating impact quickly. 

  • Committed to Making a Difference: When we say we will do something; we deliver with excellence. We are accountable, focused and operate with discipline. 

  • Always Innovating: We believe that Innovation can be big or small; it‚Äôs a continuous state of mind that inspires us to think differently and always make things better. We are risk takers and we learn continuously. 

  • Winning as a Team: Our people know that by leveraging one another‚Äôs strengths, investing in and developing our team‚Äôs capability and by collaborating well, we will win.

  • With Trust & Responsibility: Operating with integrity is core to our success. We are humble, honest and value deep mastery and expertise. We do the right thing, always.

The Company

Verisure is the leading European provider of professionally monitored security systems with 24/7 response services. We protect more than 5 million families and small businesses across 17 countries in Europe and Latin America. And our mission is to provide our customers peace of mind by protecting what matters most to them.

With over 35 years of insight, experience, and innovation, Verisure is known for category-creating marketing, sales excellence, innovative products and services, and customer-centricity. Thanks to a strong focus on high quality, our customers are amongst the most satisfied and loyal in our industry. We have some of the strongest double-digit growth and retention rates globally in consumer-facing services which demonstrates our exceptional service levels and strong value proposition to our customers.

Diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging at Verisure

At Verisure, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace, recognising that diversity of thought and background only makes our teams stronger and more innovative. We reject all forms of discrimination and bias, and we believe in access to opportunities for everyone, regardless of gender, age, disability status, race, sexual orientation, or any other status. Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging values are embedded in our company‚Äôs DNA. And we continue to prioritise our DEIB efforts every day to create a more inclusive organisation, enable diverse representation of our community, and ensure equity and meritocracy every step of the way.

Title: Business Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Job Description




We‚Äôre looking for a Business Data Analyst Trainee to join our team in Madrid and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.

Who We AreAt Seedtag, we lead the way in contextual advertising with our machine learning-powered platform. Our technology provides superior brand safety, human-like content understanding, and advanced cookieless targeting, making ads more engaging and respectful. Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, we‚Äôve grown to over 600 Seedtaggers across 18 countries, raising ‚Ç¨250M to revolutionise digital advertising.

Your Challenge

Support the Data & Insights team in transforming data into meaningful business insights.
Assist in analysing the performance of Seedtag‚Äôs Contextual products and internal processes.
Help build tools and dashboards that support data-driven decision-making across teams.
Learn how to automate internal processes to increase team efficiency.
Gain exposure to the adTech ecosystem and develop business acumen.
Collaborate with experienced analysts and actively participate in team discussions.
Take ownership of learning opportunities and technical development.

What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed

Currently completing or recently completed a Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related fields.
Strong interest in data analysis, business intelligence, and technology.
Basic knowledge of SQL and a willingness to develop your technical skills.
Some academic or personal experience with programming languages (e.g., Python, R) or Excel/Google Sheets.
Curiosity about data visualisation tools such as Looker, Power BI, or similar platforms.
Detail-oriented mindset and eagerness to learn in a fast-paced environment.
Strong communication skills and a collaborative attitude.
Motivation to understand how data impacts business decisions.
A good level of English, both written and spoken.

It would be a big plus if:

Have worked on academic or personal projects involving data analysis or reporting.
Have taken online courses or earned certifications related to SQL, data analytics, or visualisation.
Understand basic business KPIs or performance metrics.

Why Join Seedtag?Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to work from home, the office, or even the beach in our hybrid mode.Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!

Additional Perks

Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.

Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV and let‚Äôs grow together!

At Seedtag, we‚Äôre committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we‚Äôll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Title: Junior Analyst
HTML:
As part of our team, you will leverage your excel and SQL background to address diverse data-related tasks that demand creative approaches and proficiency in cloud-centric implementations.


You will implement full end-to-end projects and be an integral part of our Center of Excellence (CoE).


More specifically, you will be expected to:


Partner with business key-users and Global Anaplan Solution Architects to design, develop, test, and implement Anaplan solutions in the mining/smelting industry;

Lead regional Anaplan projects by collaborating with business teams to gather local business requirements and develop user stories;

Understand, convert and improve Excel based planning and budgeting into dynamic connected Anaplan models;

Train new users on the system and document processes;

Develop test cases and assist in UAT on the technical and functional acceptance;

Manage multiple stakeholders across various business functions;

Perform root cause analyses and propose solutions;

Articulate design and documentation for Anaplan models (process map, user guide, solution design document);

Effectively identify various dimensions, lists, hierarchies and line items, thereby creating a user-friendly and optimized solution;

Create Hub-Spoke & ALM structure along with user experience pages using the Anaplan New User Experience;

Closely follow Anaplan model building best practices;

Detailed understanding & working experience on Anaplan integration (Cloudworks, Anaplan Connect or other ETL tools) is a definite asset;

Understanding & working experience on PlanIQ, Optimizer, Reporting pages, Polaris, Workflow management, etc. is an asset.



Do you have what it takes?


Bachelor's or graduate's degree in Mathematics, Physics, Enginnerings or economics;

Excel Proficiency: Strong Excel skills are a solid foundation for data manipulation and analysis, which are essential in Anaplan modeling (Visual Basic / macros not required)

Demonstrated ability to optimize;

Good understanding of planning budgeting & forecasting;

Understanding of the mining / concentrating / smelting industry is an asset;

Ability to collaborate effectively and work as part of a global team;

Strong attention to detail and a positive attitude;

Critical thinking and analytical problem-solving skills.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you must be able to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German and/or Spanish is desirable.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Wondering what‚Äôs in it for you?

üì≤ Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement, leveraging tools such as automation, mobility and AI to drive performance benefits

üí∞ Very competitive compensation structure

üë® üë© üëß üë¶ Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents (employee + spouse/partner and children)

üè• Life Insurance

üìà Growth opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)


We are building a multi-cultural and multi-disciplinary dream team in which you will have the opportunity to collaborate with domain experts - enjoying all the perks of a big company but with the energy of a start-up.üòä

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Business Data Analyst to join our team in Madrid and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.

Who We Are

At Seedtag, we lead the way in contextual advertising with our machine learning-powered platform. Our technology provides superior brand safety, human-like content understanding, and advanced cookieless targeting, making ads more engaging and respectful. Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, we‚Äôve grown to over 600 Seedtaggers across 18 countries, raising ‚Ç¨250M to revolutionise digital advertising.




Your Challenge




You will get full ownership of our business data and will be expected to propose and conduct analyses that transform Seedtag‚Äôs data into significant business opportunities and KPI improvements.
You will analyse the performance of our current Contextual products and processes and proactively propose initiatives that seek to improve Seedtag‚Äôs commercial and operational results.
You will develop tools that automate internal processes, increasing the efficiency and efficacy of Seedtag teams.
You will help build tools that enable the democratisation of data inside the company and allow Seedtag teams to make informed, data-driven decisions.
Finally, you will build a solid knowledge of the adTech ecosystem and develop strong business acumen.




What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed




You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Engineering. Specific certifications/education in Data/ Business Intelligence are a plus.
You have 3-5 years of experience in a fast-paced environment, either start-up, corporate or consulting.
You have advanced skills in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
You have experience with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools.
You have knowledge of database management systems (e.g., BigQuery, MySQL).
You have experience working with programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and manipulation.
You have experience in data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or similar, and you have knowledge of Excel/ Sheets.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights that drive business value.
You have the ability to collaborate with business stakeholders to identify information needs and define business requirements.
You have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

It would be a big plus if you

Have experience in forecasting, trend analysis, and predictive modelling.
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders.
Have experience working with Tableau.




Why Join Seedtag?




Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to work from home, the office, or even the beach in our hybrid mode.

Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!




Additional Perks




Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.




Ready to join the Seedtag adventure?




Send us your CV and let‚Äôs grow together!

At Seedtag, we‚Äôre committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we‚Äôll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

üìç Madrid (modelo h√≠brido)

La posici√≥n es ideal para alguien que disfrute de los datos como herramienta para influir en decisiones reales de negocio y que se sienta c√≥modo/a comunicando con equipos t√©cnicos y no t√©cnicos por igual.

üõ† ¬øQu√© har√°s?

üîç Perfil ideal

+3 a√±os de experiencia como Data Analyst en entornos din√°micos, producto o tech.
Dominio alto de SQL complejo (consultas intensivas, m√∫ltiples joins, millones de registros).

‚úÖ Se valorar√°

Title: Business intelligence/Data analyst Intern
Description:
Kapsch is one of Austria's most successful global technology companies. With its comprehensive ITS (Intelligent Transportation Systems) portfolio, Kapsch is actively addressing the challenges of the present and the future with intelligent mobility solutions in a wide range of application areas. As a family-owned company founded in 1892 and headquartered in Vienna, Kapsch can look back on 130 years of experience with the future.




In the role of Business Intelligence / Data Analyst Intern, candidate will work with real business data, help build dashboards, and contribute to decision-making processes by delivering actionable insights and will support EMEA OPS team with further automations of repeated activities.




Successful candidate will do:

Assist with data collection, cleaning, and analysis
Support the development of reports and dashboards using tools like Excel, Power BI, or Tableau
Conduct basic data exploration to uncover trends and insights
Collaborate with different departments to understand data needs
Help ensure data accuracy and consistency
Support repeated task automations (e.g. using PowerAutomate)




Kapsch TrafficCom is looking for:

Currently pursuing a degree in Business, Data Science, Computer Science, or related field
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Knowledge of SQL/JSQL and PowerBI
Proficiency in Excel
Fluent in English
Good communication skills and attention to detail
Knowledge of Microsoft Fabrics advantage but not necessary




What do we offer you?

Financial support to help with your education.
A hybrid work model so you can enjoy flexibility.
Flexible schedule
A dynamic and enriching environment where you'll learn from experienced professionals and participate in high-impact projects.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Kapsch is one of Austria's most successful global technology companies. With its comprehensive ITS (Intelligent Transportation Systems) portfolio, Kapsch is actively addressing the challenges of the present and the future with intelligent mobility solutions in a wide range of application areas. As a family-owned company founded in 1892 and headquartered in Vienna, Kapsch can look back on 130 years of experience with the future.




We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst and Data Visualization Engineer to support the development of our Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) portfolio. Our products include data and video analytics platforms for traffic management and tolling, an OCR (Optical Character Recognition) engine, and stereo vision cameras for vehicle classification. In this role, you will work with large and complex datasets to extract insights that drive innovation, optimize system performance, and inform product decisions. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams - including software engineering, AI/ML, and product management - and build dashboards to visualize key performance indicators for real-time monitoring and decision support.




Your responsibilities:

Generate actionable insights from large datasets to improve traffic and tolling solutions.
Design and build dashboards (e.g., in Qlik, Power BI) to visualize complex data and support real-time operational decisions.
Work with engineering and product teams to develop user-centric analytics features (e.g., alert systems, operator dashboards).
Analyze traffic sensor data to optimize tolling accuracy and reduce misclassification and revenue loss.
Identify patterns and trends from traffic data to support new use cases, such as congestion prediction or adaptive signaling.
Monitor AI model performance and support ongoing model retraining and customization across varying environments.
Use predictive analytics to anticipate traffic bottlenecks, optimize toll operations, and improve safety.
Support regulatory compliance by automating reporting processes and ensuring data integrity.




Required Skills & Qualifications:

Strong SQL skills and experience with relational and columnar databases.
Solid understanding of dimensional data models (star/snowflake schemas).
Experience with Python and SQL for data manipulation and extraction
Hands-on experience with Linux, Bash, Gitlab/Github, Cloud Computing
Proficiency in QLIK Sense
Experience working with large datasets (‚Äúbig data‚Äù) in operational environments.
Analytical mindset and solution driven personality.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
You practice and live the agile mindset
Good oral and written English
Experience in treating with customers
Presentations skills




Nice to have:

Experience in tolling or traffic management is a plus.
Experience with traffic related models like DATEX2, SIRI, GTFS, MDS, etc.
Experience with traffic simulators like SUMO, Aimsun, PTV Vissim/Vissum




Our offer:

Pernanent role
Flexible working hours
Hybrid working model (2 days at the office/week)
30 business days of annual leave
Flexible remuneration plan
Challenging the limits of mobility for a healthy world without congestion
Adiverse and dynamic international working environment of Kapsch TrafficCom and opportunities for personal growth
Possibility to work in an international company that operates in a dynamic industry where the working environment favors the professional growth

Title: Junior BI Analyst
Description:
Are we the best-kept secret in M√°laga? We like to think so.

We are also one of the world‚Äôs largest, globally diversified natural resources companies and a major producer and marketer of over 60 commodities across several countries.

Title: E-commerce CRO Data Analyst
Description:
Estamos en b√∫squeda de un CRO DATA ANALYST en el equipo de Tr√°fico y Clientes en la D. Ecommerce de Carrefour Espa√±a.




La misi√≥n del puesto de trabajo ser√° realizar research y an√°lisis para definir nuestros perfiles de usuarios y entender su comportamiento y necesidades. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Kapsch is one of Austria's most successful global technology companies. With its comprehensive ITS (Intelligent Transportation Systems) portfolio, Kapsch is actively addressing the challenges of the present and the future with intelligent mobility solutions in a wide range of application areas. As a family-owned company founded in 1892 and headquartered in Vienna, Kapsch can look back on 130 years of experience with the future.




We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst and Data Visualization Engineer to support the development of our Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) portfolio. Our products include data and video analytics platforms for traffic management and tolling, an OCR (Optical Character Recognition) engine, and stereo vision cameras for vehicle classification. In this role, you will work with large and complex datasets to extract insights that drive innovation, optimize system performance, and inform product decisions. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams - including software engineering, AI/ML, and product management - and build dashboards to visualize key performance indicators for real-time monitoring and decision support.




Your responsibilities:

Generate actionable insights from large datasets to improve traffic and tolling solutions.
Design and build dashboards (e.g., in Qlik, Power BI) to visualize complex data and support real-time operational decisions.
Work with engineering and product teams to develop user-centric analytics features (e.g., alert systems, operator dashboards).
Analyze traffic sensor data to optimize tolling accuracy and reduce misclassification and revenue loss.
Identify patterns and trends from traffic data to support new use cases, such as congestion prediction or adaptive signaling.
Monitor AI model performance and support ongoing model retraining and customization across varying environments.
Use predictive analytics to anticipate traffic bottlenecks, optimize toll operations, and improve safety.
Support regulatory compliance by automating reporting processes and ensuring data integrity.




Required Skills & Qualifications:

Strong SQL skills and experience with relational and columnar databases.
Solid understanding of dimensional data models (star/snowflake schemas).
Experience with Python and SQL for data manipulation and extraction
Hands-on experience with Linux, Bash, Gitlab/Github, Cloud Computing
Proficiency in QLIK Sense
Experience working with large datasets (‚Äúbig data‚Äù) in operational environments.
Analytical mindset and solution driven personality.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
You practice and live the agile mindset
Good oral and written English
Experience in treating with customers
Presentations skills




Nice to have:

Experience in tolling or traffic management is a plus.
Experience with traffic related models like DATEX2, SIRI, GTFS, MDS, etc.
Experience with traffic simulators like SUMO, Aimsun, PTV Vissim/Vissum




Our offer:

Pernanent role
Flexible working hours
Hybrid working model (2 days at the office/week)
30 business days of annual leave
Flexible remuneration plan
Challenging the limits of mobility for a healthy world without congestion
Adiverse and dynamic international working environment of Kapsch TrafficCom and opportunities for personal growth
Possibility to work in an international company that operates in a dynamic industry where the working environment favors the professional growth
Show more

Title: Business intelligence/Data analyst Intern
Description:
Kapsch is one of Austria's most successful global technology companies. With its comprehensive ITS (Intelligent Transportation Systems) portfolio, Kapsch is actively addressing the challenges of the present and the future with intelligent mobility solutions in a wide range of application areas. As a family-owned company founded in 1892 and headquartered in Vienna, Kapsch can look back on 130 years of experience with the future.




In the role of Business Intelligence / Data Analyst Intern, candidate will work with real business data, help build dashboards, and contribute to decision-making processes by delivering actionable insights and will support EMEA OPS team with further automations of repeated activities.




Successful candidate will do:

Assist with data collection, cleaning, and analysis
Support the development of reports and dashboards using tools like Excel, Power BI, or Tableau
Conduct basic data exploration to uncover trends and insights
Collaborate with different departments to understand data needs
Help ensure data accuracy and consistency
Support repeated task automations (e.g. using PowerAutomate)




Kapsch TrafficCom is looking for:

Currently pursuing a degree in Business, Data Science, Computer Science, or related field
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Knowledge of SQL/JSQL and PowerBI
Proficiency in Excel
Fluent in English
Good communication skills and attention to detail
Knowledge of Microsoft Fabrics advantage but not necessary




What do we offer you?

Financial support to help with your education.
A hybrid work model so you can enjoy flexibility.
Flexible schedule
A dynamic and enriching environment where you'll learn from experienced professionals and participate in high-impact projects.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst Internship
Description:
Stratx is a consulting partner for businesses that want to grow faster and operate smarter. We help companies make better decisions, improve processes, and unlock new opportunities through clear strategies and hands-on guidance.




Role Summary

We are offering a 3-month Data Analyst Internship for motivated individuals based in Madrid. This remote internship is designed to provide practical experience in data analytics, giving interns the opportunity to work with real datasets, develop technical skills, and support client-facing consulting projects.




Key Responsibilities

Assist with data wrangling, cleaning, and preparation for analysis.
Support the use of Excel, SQL, and Python for data extraction and transformation.
Contribute to the creation of reports and dashboards to present insights clearly.
Apply statistical methods to uncover patterns, correlations, and business opportunities.
Collaborate with consultants to turn data insights into actionable recommendations.
Conduct competitor and market research to enrich data-driven insights.
Document analytical processes and maintain organised data records for future use.




Required Qualifications

Currently studying or recently graduated in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related discipline.
Strong proficiency with Excel and familiarity with SQL or Python.
Analytical mindset with strong attention to detail.
Ability to manage tasks independently while working remotely.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.




Preferred Qualifications

Familiarity with BI tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Exposure to predictive analytics, data modelling, or statistics.
Previous academic, internship, or project experience in data analysis.




Benefits & Perks

Paid internship with competitive hourly rate.
35 hours per week with flexible schedule.
Fully remote role, allowing you to work from Madrid or elsewhere.
Mentorship and training from experienced consultants.
Hands-on project experience to strengthen your data career.




Job Details

Location: Remote (Madrid, Spain).
Job Type: Internship.
Hours: 35 hours per week.
Compensation: Competitive.
Duration: 3 months.
Schedule: Monday to Friday, flexible within business hours.




Equal Opportunity Statement

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at all levels of the organisation. We do not discriminate based on race, gender, religion, age, disability, or any other legally protected status.

Title: Mid Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
About Happy Mammoth:

Happy Mammoth is a high-growth e-commerce company dedicated to empowering women‚Äôs health through natural, science-backed supplements focused on gut, digestive, and hormonal wellness. As a performance-driven company, we are passionate about making a meaningful, lasting impact on our customers' lives. You can learn more about us at https://happymammoth.com/.

Before you dive deeper, please note the following key points:


This is a fully remote contractor role, available full-time
The role requires availability during EU hours (GMT)


At Happy Mammoth, you can expect:


A strong salary package
A welcoming and nurturing work environment, with colleagues from around the world
A fast-paced, dynamic, and non-corporate atmosphere where adaptability is key
The chance to be part of our exciting global expansion journey
Flexible working hours
Free access to courses, books and Masterminds
Opportunities for professional growth and development


Job Summary:

As a Data Analyst at Happy Mammoth, you‚Äôll be at the heart of our data-driven efforts. Your insights will directly influence our strategies to optimize customer acquisition, retention, and lifetime value. In this role, you‚Äôll dive into customer behavior, analyze marketing performance, and provide actionable insights that drive our direct-response and B2C marketing initiatives.

Responsibilities:


Collect, analyze, and interpret data to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that inform our business strategies
Build, maintain, and automate dashboards and reports to track KPIs, including ROAS, CPA, conversion rates, CLTV, and customer retention metrics
Work closely with cross-functional teams, such as marketing, product, and finance, to provide data-driven insights that support campaign performance and strategic marketing decisions
Provide ad hoc analysis to address specific business questions
Ensure data quality and accuracy by regularly validating and cleansing datasets
Communicate findings effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through reports, presentations, and storytelling


Qualifications:


Proven experience in data analysis, preferably with a focus on e-commerce
Proficiency in SQL and Excel
Proven experience in data visualization tools (e.g. Looker Data Studio, Looker, Power BI or similar)
Hands-on experience with cloud-based data warehouses and architectures (familiarity with Google BigQuery is a strong asset)
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Effective communicator with the ability to convey complex data insights clearly


What will set you apart:


You have a genuine hunger for success in all parts of your life
You thrive taking action, taking responsibility and getting things done before deadlines
You‚Äôre able to self-manage based upon the overall scope and work required
You‚Äôre able to diagnose and solve technical problems quickly
You're able to work as part of a team and actively contribute to conversations
A willingness to learn and grow with the business


CVs should be in English

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Finsolutia intends to reinforce its Information Technology (IT) team with a Data Analyst (M/F).

We are looking for talented and self-motivated individuals for a broad and interesting role working as part of a team based in Lisbon.

Responsibilities


Design and develop Microsoft Power BI reports and Dashboards (Operational, Strategic & Analytical) including data set ingestion and transformation, Data Modeling, Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) using the appropriate report templates depicting status of key performance indicators (KPIs) and other important business metrics for an organization to make data driven decisions
Work with cross-functional teams to gather and document reporting requirements to meet business needs
Build data models, technical and functional documentation with business partners
Review and interpret ongoing business report requirements;
Writing optimized SQL queries for integration with other applications
Designing database tables and related objects;
Transition developed reports and dashboards to interactive/automated dashboards using Power BI
Use T-SQL to develop and implement procedures and functions;
Provide support as required to ensure the availability and optimal performance of developed reports and dashboards for both external and internal users
Design and implement technology best practices, guidelines and repeatable processes
Extract and analyze data using PowerQuery, PivotTables, MS Excel, Power BI and DAX.
Design, develop, update, and optimize Power BI dashboards, reports and scorecards to meet business requirements.


Hard Skills


Understanding of T-SQL programming (Microsoft SQL Server)
Knowledge of Databricks PySpark / SparkSQL
Knowledge of data modeling following the best practices
2+ years of experience in creating reports, dashboards using Power BI Desktop and Server and maintaining Power BI dashboards on servers.
Understanding of tuning of Power BI reports, data sets, and SQL to deliver maximum report performance.
Experience with ETL Processes Experience with Python and C# (nice to have)
Fluent in English


Soft Skills


Proactivity and constant technological evolution;
Team work and result oriented;
Good communication and interpersonal / facilitation skills.


We‚Äôd like to inform you that personal data collected here are exclusively destined to the management of the recruitment process in question and will be processed and storage by Finsolutia, SA, or another Group company, in accordance with Personal Data Protection Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of 27 April 2016 during a period of 5 years, after which they will be definitively eliminated.

We Further Inform You That The Holder Will Have Free Access To Its Personal Data, And May Request Its Updating, Rectification Or Removal By Simply Sending The Request In Writing To

Bernardo Cabral

Data Protection Officer

dpo@finsolutia.com
Show more
HTML:
Finsolutia intends to reinforce its Information Technology (IT) team with a Data Analyst (M/F).

We are looking for talented and self-motivated individuals for a broad and interesting role working as part of a team based in Lisbon.

Responsibilities

  • Design and develop Microsoft Power BI reports and Dashboards (Operational, Strategic & Analytical) including data set ingestion and transformation, Data Modeling, Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) using the appropriate report templates depicting status of key performance indicators (KPIs) and other important business metrics for an organization to make data driven decisions
  • Work with cross-functional teams to gather and document reporting requirements to meet business needs
  • Build data models, technical and functional documentation with business partners
  • Review and interpret ongoing business report requirements;
  • Writing optimized SQL queries for integration with other applications
  • Designing database tables and related objects;
  • Transition developed reports and dashboards to interactive/automated dashboards using Power BI
  • Use T-SQL to develop and implement procedures and functions;
  • Provide support as required to ensure the availability and optimal performance of developed reports and dashboards for both external and internal users
  • Design and implement technology best practices, guidelines and repeatable processes
  • Extract and analyze data using PowerQuery, PivotTables, MS Excel, Power BI and DAX.
  • Design, develop, update, and optimize Power BI dashboards, reports and scorecards to meet business requirements.

Hard Skills

  • Understanding of T-SQL programming (Microsoft SQL Server)
  • Knowledge of Databricks PySpark / SparkSQL
  • Knowledge of data modeling following the best practices
  • 2+ years of experience in creating reports, dashboards using Power BI Desktop and Server and maintaining Power BI dashboards on servers.
  • Understanding of tuning of Power BI reports, data sets, and SQL to deliver maximum report performance.
  • Experience with ETL Processes Experience with Python and C# (nice to have)
  • Fluent in English

Soft Skills

  • Proactivity and constant technological evolution;
  • Team work and result oriented;
  • Good communication and interpersonal / facilitation skills.

We‚Äôd like to inform you that personal data collected here are exclusively destined to the management of the recruitment process in question and will be processed and storage by Finsolutia, SA, or another Group company, in accordance with Personal Data Protection Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of 27 April 2016 during a period of 5 years, after which they will be definitively eliminated.

We Further Inform You That The Holder Will Have Free Access To Its Personal Data, And May Request Its Updating, Rectification Or Removal By Simply Sending The Request In Writing To

Bernardo Cabral

Data Protection Officer

dpo@finsolutia.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Air Apps

At Air Apps, we believe in thinking bigger‚Äîand moving faster. We‚Äôre a family-founded company on a mission to create the world‚Äôs first AI-powered Personal & Entrepreneurial Resource Planner (PRP), and we need your passion and ambition to help us change how people plan, work, and live. Born in Lisbon, Portugal in 2018‚Äîand now with offices in both Lisbon and San Francisco‚Äîwe‚Äôve remained self-funded while reaching over 100 million downloads worldwide.

Our long-term focus drives us to challenge the status quo every day, pushing the boundaries of AI-driven solutions that truly make a difference. Here, you‚Äôll be a creative force, shaping products that empower people across the globe.

Join us on this journey to redefine resource management‚Äîand change lives along the way.

The Role

As a Data Analyst at Air Apps, you will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to drive business insights and optimize product performance. You will create reports, dashboards, and performance metrics to help teams make informed decisions and improve user experience.

This role requires a data-driven mindset, strong analytical skills, and experience with visualization tools to turn complex data into actionable insights.

Responsibilities


Analyze user behavior, product performance, and key business metrics to identify trends and opportunities.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or Google Data Studio.
Collect, clean, and structure large datasets to ensure accuracy and usability.
Define and track KPIs for marketing, product, and business performance.
Work with SQL, Python, or R to extract, analyze, and manipulate data.
Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and marketing teams to provide data-driven insights.
Conduct A/B testing and experiment analysis to improve product features and user engagement.
Identify bottlenecks and opportunities in user journeys and customer funnels.
Present findings in a clear and compelling way to stakeholders and leadership teams.
Stay up to date with industry trends, analytics best practices, and emerging data tools.


Requirements


Around 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field.
Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Power BI, Google Data Studio).
Strong analytical skills with experience in Python or R for data analysis.
Knowledge of A/B testing methodologies and statistical analysis.
Experience with Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Amplitude, or similar user analytics tools.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to communicate insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience working with large datasets and cloud-based data warehouses (BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake).
Familiarity with ETL processes and data pipeline optimization is a plus.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, data-driven environment and manage multiple projects.


What benefits are we offering?


Apple hardware ecosystem for work.
Flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) to support work-life balance.
Annual Bonus.
Top-tier Health Insurance for peace of mind.
Public Transportation Pass to support your commute needs.
Coverflex benefits package for meal allowances, well-being, and more.
Air Conference - an opportunity to meet the team, collaborate, and grow together.


Diversity & Inclusion

At Air Apps, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. We enthusiastically welcome applicants from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and believe that varied voices and experiences make us stronger.

Application Disclaimer

At Air Apps, we value transparency and integrity in our hiring process. Applicants must submit their own work without any AI-generated assistance. Any use of AI in application materials, assessments, or interviews will result in disqualification.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are Is What We Do.

Deel is the all-in-one payroll and HR platform for global teams. Our vision is to unlock global opportunity for every person, team, and business. Built for the way the world works today, Deel combines HRIS, payroll, compliance, benefits, performance, and equipment management into one seamless platform. With AI-powered tools and a fully owned payroll infrastructure, Deel supports every worker type in 150+ countries‚Äîhelping businesses scale smarter, faster, and more compliantly.

Among the largest globally distributed companies in the world, our team of 6,000 spans more than 100 countries, speaks 74 languages, and brings a connected and dynamic culture that drives continuous learning and innovation for our customers.

Why should you be part of our success story?

As the fastest-growing Software as a Service (SaaS) company in history, Deel is transforming how global talent connects with world-class companies ‚Äì breaking down borders that have traditionally limited both hiring and career opportunities. We're not just building software; we're creating the infrastructure for the future of work, enabling a more diverse and inclusive global economy. In 2024 alone, we paid $11.2 billion to workers in nearly 100 currencies and provided healthcare and benefits to workers in 109 countries‚Äîensuring people get paid and protected, no matter where they are.

Our momentum is reflected in our achievements and customer satisfaction: CNBC Disruptor 50, Forbes Cloud 100, Deloitte Fast 500, and repeated recognition on Y Combinator‚Äôs top companies list ‚Äì all while maintaining a 4.83 average rating from 15,000 reviews across G2, Trustpilot, Captera, Apple and Google.

Your experience at Deel will be a career accelerator. At the forefront of the global work revolution, you'll tackle complex challenges that impact millions of people's working lives. With our momentum‚Äîbacked by a $12 billion valuation and $1 B in Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) in just over five years‚Äîyou'll drive meaningful impact while building expertise that makes you a sought-after leader in the transformation of global work.

Responsibilities


Collaborate closely with Product Managers, Product Operations and Dev teams on different problems to create actionable insights
Monitor product and feature release performance, define baselines, success metrics and provide recommendations for optimisation
Develop/apply extensive domain knowledge in your dedicated product areas in order to proactively derive meaningful recommendations and insights that drive and inform product strategy
Analyze market data, identify customer behavior and trends
Help design and evaluate A/B tests to improve customer journeys
Create and promote effective self-service analytics infrastructure for your product areas
Develop user friendly dashboards and high quality data visualizations that drive actions and support decision making
Explore large and complex datasets to create actionable insights
Build data models in dbt with the support of Analytics Engineers to create the cleanest data structures and KPIs for your product areas
Make intelligent choices for the adoption of new technologies based on your extensive experience
Contribute to the development and growth of fellow product analysts by proactively sharing knowledge, providing mentoring, etc.


Qualifications


Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Economics or equivalent degree
5+ years‚Äô experience in product analytics team
Hands on experience in at least one modern BI tools (preferably Looker)
Proficiency in SQL and product analytics tools (mixpanel / heap / amplitude)
Solid experience with Data Modelling (DBT)
Excellent multitasking and problem-solving abilities
Effective communication skills and experience dealing with stakeholders of varying seniority
Experience with Snowflake and LookML is a plus


Total Rewards

Our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all.

Some things you‚Äôll enjoy


Stock grant opportunities dependent on your role, employment status and location
Additional perks and benefits based on your employment status and country
The flexibility of remote work, including optional WeWork access


At Deel, we‚Äôre an equal-opportunity employer that values diversity and positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of race, religion, sex, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy or maternity or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Unless otherwise agreed, we will communicate with job applicants using Deel-specific emails, which include @deel.com and other acquired company emails like @payspace.com and @paygroup.com. You can view the most up-to-date job listings at Deel by visitingour careers page.

Deel is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects different abilities, backgrounds, beliefs, experiences, identities and perspectives.

Deel will provide accommodation on request throughout the recruitment, selection and assessment process for applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodation, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team at recruiting@deel.com of the nature of the accommodation that you may require, to ensure your equal participation.

We use Covey as part of our hiring and/or promotional processes. As part of the evaluation process, we provide Covey with job requirements and candidate-submitted applications. Certain features of the platform may qualify it as an Automated Employment Decision Tool (AEDT) under applicable regulations. For positions in New York City, our use of Covey complies with NYC Local Law 144.

We began using Covey Scout for Inbound on March 30, 2025.

For more information about our data protection practices, please visit our Privacy Policy. You can review the independent bias audit report covering our use of Covey here: https://getcovey.com/nyc-local-law-144

Title: Data Curator
Description:
Shape the future of innovation, startups & economies

Dealroom is the world‚Äôs startup and venture capital database, used by leading teams like Accel, Index, Atomico, Google, Microsoft, AWS, SAP, and 100+ governments, to discover the world‚Äôs next generation of transformative companies.

We‚Äôre on a mission to accelerate innovation by empowering decision-makers with the most comprehensive data on startups, scaleups, and ecosystems.

Joining Dealroom means working at the confluence of AI, big data, and venture capital and acting as a catalyst at the heart of startup ecosystems. We value relentless client focus, transparency, openness, and candour - the freedom to take risks, admit failures, and speak openly.

About The Data Curation Team

Join our team of data analysts and content curators to improve the quality and accuracy of our data, and to elevate the experience of our users. This role is ideal for team players and problem solvers with an investigative mind looking to enter the world of startups and venture capital. You will develop skills in data quality and classification while expanding your technical toolkit and co-creating scalable solutions. You'll often work directly with our clients.

As a Data Curator, you‚Äôll


Ensure data quality through curation, desk research, classification, content review, and moderation.
Support data operations workflows and assist engineering teams.
Monitor and improve data quality metrics.
Contribute to developing scalable data management solutions.


What You Bring


Academic Credentials: A completed Bachelor's degree in (Business) Information Technology, Finance, Economics, Content Management, or related fields.
Interests: Data and data management tools, from GenAI to Python and BigQuery.
Passion: A demonstrated enthusiasm for technology, startups, and venture capital markets.
Mindset: A proactive, accountable, and urgent approach to work.
Adaptability: Comfort in a fast-paced startup environment where continuous learning, OKRs, ongoing feedback, and curiosity drive success.
Eligibility: Eligibility to work in the EU, residency in the Lisbon area, and fluency in English. Additional language skills are welkom / wilkommen / bienvenido / kyaosopartaal.


What We Bring To The Deal


Ownership: A role where you truly own your work. Show us your capabilities, and we‚Äôll support your growth.
Comprehensive Benefits: Enjoy benefits like a laptop of your choice, flexible hours, a fully equipped home office setup, travel allowances, a development budget, weekly workout sessions, and more.
Global & Inclusive Culture: Join a diverse team spanning over 25 nationalities.
Vibrant Workplace: Work in a dynamic environment in the heart of Lisbon (Baixa-Chiado) with flexible hybrid options.
Meritocratic Environment: We value entrepreneurial thinking and are committed to turning innovative ideas into reality.


Ready to accelerate the future of innovation with us? Share your story, and let‚Äôs create something transformative together.
Show more

Title: Data Market Analyst ‚Äì Business Planning
Description:
Imagine a world with zero vehicle accidents, zero vehicle emissions, and wireless vehicle connectivity all around us. Every day, we move closer to making that world a reality. Aptiv‚Äôs passionate team of engineers and developers creates advanced safety systems, high-performance electrification solutions and data connectivity solutions so that automakers can bring advanced capabilities to more people around the globe. This is how we enable sustainable mobility and help to prevent accidents caused by human error.

Want to join us?

Your role:


Conduct internal planning data analysis, transform data into knowledge to provide input for decision, compare data with Market industry-level to support operational and strategic initiatives.
Monitor market share, competitive intelligence, product development trends and EDS portfolio to support market positioning reports.
Align data analysis with company‚Äôs strategic direction. Initiate and support market research and competitor analysis by developing automatization of different data sources.
Collaborate with external research and consulting firms to provide insights to internal functions and leadership.
Participate in customer studies and market environment analysis.
Maintain up-to-date understanding of the EMEA wiring harness market, including key drivers such as electrification, regulatory shifts, consumer behavior, and regional trends.
Contribute to general business planning tasks as needed and support Commercial Teams in regards current and future business.


Your Background


Graduate or Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field
Strong proficiency in SQL, Microsoft Excel, and Power BI.
Working knowledge of SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS).
Excellent command of office applications, including PowerPoint and Excel.
Familiarity with Automotive product portfolios and market forecasting.
Experience in market research, data analysis, or a related function.
Fluent in English, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
Able to perform under pressure, work collaboratively, and meet deadlines.


Nice To Have Skills


Experience with VBA, Power Query, Power Pivot, or Power Automate.
Automotive supplier background or direct exposure to manufacturing and business planning in the automotive sector.


Why join us?


You can grow at Aptiv. Aptiv provides an inclusive work environment where all individuals can grow and develop, regardless of gender, ethnicity or beliefs.
You can have an impact. Safety is a core Aptiv value; we want a safer world for us and our children, one with: Zero fatalities, Zero injuries, Zero accidents.
You have support. We ensure you have the resources and support you need to take care of your family and your physical and mental health with a competitive health insurance package.


Privacy Notice - Active Candidates: https://www.aptiv.com/privacy-notice-active-candidates

Aptiv is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

  • You can grow at Aptiv. Aptiv provides an inclusive work environment where all individuals can grow and develop, regardless of gender, ethnicity or beliefs.
  • You can have an impact. Safety is a core Aptiv value; we want a safer world for us and our children, one with: Zero fatalities, Zero injuries, Zero accidents.
  • You have support. We ensure you have the resources and support you need to take care of your family and your physical and mental health with a competitive health insurance package.

Privacy Notice - Active Candidates: https://www.aptiv.com/privacy-notice-active-candidates

Aptiv is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst - IT
Description:
Join our team at AMGEN Capability Center Portugal, number 1 company in Best Workplaces - https://www.greatplacetowork.pt/ - ranking in Portugal (category 201-500 employees) by the Great Place to Work Institute. We have a team of over 400 talented people and 40 different nationalities, diverse areas of expertise and professional experience that are shaping the future of healthcare. This is your chance to explore a world of opportunities in different areas such as Cybersecurity, Data & Analytics, Digital, Technology and Innovation, Finance, General & Admin, Human Resources, Regulatory Affairs and many more. In Lisbon's city center, our AMGEN office fosters innovation, excellence, and inspiration. Come thrive with us at AMGEN, supporting our mission To Serve Patients. What we do at AMGEN matters in

people‚Äôs lives.

Data Analyst - IT

LIVE

What You Will Do

Let‚Äôs do this. Let‚Äôs change the world.

In this vital role, you will support the delivery of emerging AI/ML capabilities within Amgen's Neural Nexus program. As part of the Commercial Technology Data & Analytics team, you will collaborate with product owners and cross-functional partners to help design, implement, and iterate on a layered ecosystem focused on DIAL (Data, Insights, Action, and Learning). This includes contributing to the development of an Agentic AI framework using agile methodologies. Are you a technology professional with a passion for commercial domains and a drive to innovate? Join a team that thrives on creativity and is dedicated to making life better through technology.


Collaborate with the Customer Data & Analytics (CD&A) team to help realize business value through the application of commercial data and emerging AI/ML technologies.
Support delivery activities within the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), partnering with Engineering and Product Management to shape roadmaps, prioritize releases, and maintain a refined product backlog.
Contribute to backlog management by helping break down Epics into Features and Sprint-ready User Stories, ensuring clear articulation of requirements and well-defined Acceptance Criteria and Definitions of Done.
Ensure non-functional requirements are represented and prioritized within the backlog to maintain performance, scalability, and compliance standards.
Collaborate with UX to align technical requirements, business processes, and scenarios with user-centered design.
Assist in the development and delivery of engaging product demonstrations for internal and external stakeholders.
Support documentation efforts to maintain accurate records of system configurations, processes, and enhancements.
Contribute to the launch and growth of Neural Nexus product teams focused on data connectivity, predictive modeling, and fast-cycle value delivery for commercial teams.
Provide input for governance discussions and help prepare materials to support executive alignment on technology strategy and investment.


WIN

What We Expect Of You

We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Specialist IS Business Analyst with a passion for innovation and a collaborative working style that partners effectively with business and technology leaders with these qualifications.

Basic Qualifications:


Master‚Äôs degree with 4 - 6 years of experience in Information Systems
Bachelor‚Äôs degree with 6 - 8 years of experience in Information Systems
Diploma with 10 - 12 years of experience in Information Systems
Experience with writing user requirements and acceptance criteria
Affinity to work in a DevOps environment and Agile mind set
Ability to work in a team environment, effectively interacting with others
Ability to meet deadlines and schedules and be accountable


Preferred Qualifications:

Must-Have Skills:


Excellent problem-solving skills and a passion for solving complex challenges in for AI-driven technologies
Experience with Agile software development methodologies (Scrum)
Superb communication skills and the ability to work with senior leadership with confidence and clarity
Has experience with writing user requirements and acceptance criteria in agile project management systems such as JIRA
Experience in managing product features for PI planning and developing product roadmaps and user journeys


Good-to-Have Skills:


Demonstrated expertise in data and analytics and related technology concepts
Understanding of data and analytics software systems strategy, governance, and infrastructure
Familiarity with low-code, no-code test automation software
Technical thought leadership
Able to communicate technical or complex subject matters in business terms
Jira Align experience
Experience of DevOps, Continuous Integration, and Continuous Delivery methodology


Soft Skills:


Able to work under minimal supervision
Excellent analytical and gap/fit assessment skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work effectively with global, virtual teams
High degree of initiative and self-motivation
Ability to manage multiple priorities successfully
Team-oriented, with a focus on achieving team goals
Strong presentation and public speaking skills


Technical Skills:


Experience with cloud-based data technologies (e.g., Databricks, Redshift, S3 buckets)
AWS (similar cloud-based platforms)
Experience with design patterns, data structures, test-driven development
Knowledge of NLP techniques for text analysis and sentiment analysis


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
A diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth, and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

Objects in your future are closer than they appear. Join us.

CAREERS.AMGEN.COM

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.
