Title: Real Assets Data Management
Description:
About The Job


Data quality, input and reporting is a strategic asset for BNP Paribas. It plays a fundamental role in the analysis of the team‚Äôs performance and evolution ultimately allowing to become more efficient and to contribute to the sustainability of the business model and the accurate selection of the bank‚Äôs assets. To be in control of data is crucial to enhance risk management, to reach the right credit decisions and bring added value to the business
We are recruiting a Credit Data Analyst to be part of the CPM Real Assets team focusing on Transportation, ERI and Real Estate


Your Main Activities Are


Based in Lisbon, you will join a team of professionals who are known for their sectorial knowledge and help the team with the following credit data administrative tasks:
Input missing data on credit files for presentation to the Credit Committee
Ensure accuracy and consistency of credit data between credit files
Communicate with the CPM Credit Analyst Teams aiming to get updates on the progress of credit files
Ensure proper understanding of credit files to identify structured data to be inputted
Create and maintain standard procedures for data input (user guides)
Cooperate and communicate with the teams in charge of the golden source systems to ensure correct data in the source system
Produce periodic reports based on data collected and captured, providing clear analysis and interpretations

Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Management, Economics or Business Administration
Up to 2 years of relevant professional experience
Advanced English level
Proeficient of Excel
Knowledge about Credit
Attention to detail


About The Team


The Real Assets team includes a Coverage Relationship & Origination team, a Transaction & Execution team and a Credit Portfolio Management Team (CPM) spread across several countries serving the sector client in EMEA. These teams are split across Shipping & Offshore, Aviation, Rail, Real Estate, Export, Leasing & Alternative Structuring. This transversality aims to provide a common training path, opportunities to explore other sectors, more efficiency and greater mobility


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.


Show more
HTML:
About The Job

  • Data quality, input and reporting is a strategic asset for BNP Paribas. It plays a fundamental role in the analysis of the team‚Äôs performance and evolution ultimately allowing to become more efficient and to contribute to the sustainability of the business model and the accurate selection of the bank‚Äôs assets. To be in control of data is crucial to enhance risk management, to reach the right credit decisions and bring added value to the business
  • We are recruiting a Credit Data Analyst to be part of the CPM Real Assets team focusing on Transportation, ERI and Real Estate

Your Main Activities Are

  • Based in Lisbon, you will join a team of professionals who are known for their sectorial knowledge and help the team with the following credit data administrative tasks:
    • Input missing data on credit files for presentation to the Credit Committee
    • Ensure accuracy and consistency of credit data between credit files
    • Communicate with the CPM Credit Analyst Teams aiming to get updates on the progress of credit files
    • Ensure proper understanding of credit files to identify structured data to be inputted
    • Create and maintain standard procedures for data input (user guides)
    • Cooperate and communicate with the teams in charge of the golden source systems to ensure correct data in the source system
    • Produce periodic reports based on data collected and captured, providing clear analysis and interpretations
Profile And Skills To Success

  • Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Management, Economics or Business Administration
  • Up to 2 years of relevant professional experience
  • Advanced English level
  • Proeficient of Excel
  • Knowledge about Credit
  • Attention to detail

About The Team

  • The Real Assets team includes a Coverage Relationship & Origination team, a Transaction & Execution team and a Credit Portfolio Management Team (CPM) spread across several countries serving the sector client in EMEA. These teams are split across Shipping & Offshore, Aviation, Rail, Real Estate, Export, Leasing & Alternative Structuring. This transversality aims to provide a common training path, opportunities to explore other sectors, more efficiency and greater mobility

Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

  • Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Process Analyst
HTML:
Main Tasks And Responsibilities

Noesis is looking for candidates with the following profile:

  • Plan, implement, and maintain small to large process management initiatives;
  • Provide advice on areas for improvement within business processes, including actionable plans to implement recommendations;
  • Analyze data and provide summaries to leadership to drive informed decision-making regarding process improvement efforts;
  • Coordinate with process stakeholders and owners to ensure processes are effectively rolled out, operating procedures are updated and communicated, and stakeholders are trained.

Requirements

  • Degree in Computer Science or similar;
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Process Analyst;
  • Proficiency with presenting information to audiences of various backgrounds;
  • Proficiency in process modeling tools;
  • Knowledge of ITIL Frameworks;
  • Experience working with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure or GCP);
  • Proactivity and dynamism;
  • Organizational and communication skills;
  • Knowledge of English.

If you meet these conditions and would like to join an innovative organization that continuously invests in training its talents, send us your application.

Join us. Let's innovate together!

All our recruitment and selection processes are based on equal opportunities, valuing the competence and potential of each person and ensuring that no candidate is discriminated on the grounds of gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, religion or physical condition.

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
At Bloq.it, we‚Äôve created the world‚Äôs leading smart locker solution. Solving online deliveries by enabling everyone to participate easily, reducing delivery costs and making them more sustainable.
We‚Äôre quickly expanding, and after growing at 1000% for three years in a row, we‚Äôre now the fastest-growing Smart Locker company in the world and one of the fastest growing scale-ups in Europe.
We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Data Engineer to join our innovative team as our new #bloqstar. In this role, you'll play a crucial role in implementing data solutions that underpin our business goals and facilitate data-informed decision-making processes.

What will be your responsibilities 

  • Design, develop, and deploy data pipelines and ETL processes to ingest, transform, and load structured and unstructured data from various sources into data lakes and data warehouses;
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions for data integration, storage, and analysis; 
  • Optimize data infrastructure and architecture for performance, scalability, and reliability, leveraging cloud-based technologies;
  • Implement data governance, data quality, and data security best practices to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and privacy compliance;
  • Work closely with data scientists and analysts to provide them with clean, reliable, and well-structured datasets for analysis and modeling purposes;
  • Monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines and systems to identify and resolve issues in a timely manner, ensuring high availability and uptime;
  • Stay updated with the latest technologies and trends in data engineering, and recommend new tools and techniques to improve our data infrastructure and processes;
  • Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for data engineering processes, data models, and systems.

Extra valued skills 

  • Kafka or other streaming technologies;
  • Orchestration tools like Apache Airflow;
  • NoSQL databases like MongoDB;
  • Knowledge of BI reporting tools;

What are the requirements to join us in this position 

  • Minimum of 4 years of professional experience in a data engineering role, with hands-on experience in designing and implementing data pipelines, ETL/ELT processes, and data warehouses;
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and SQL;
  • Experience with Cloud platforms, preferably AWS (Amazon Web Services);
  • Experience with IaaC (terraform, opentofu, terragrunt);
  • Experience with Apache Spark;
  • Experience with version control systems like Git;
  • Experience with CI/CD pipelines, from creation to deployment;
  • Strong understanding of data modeling, data warehousing concepts, and best practices;
  • Knowledge of data governance, data quality, and data security principles;
  • Knowledge of containerization and orchestration technologies like Docker and Kubernetes is a plus;
  • Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze complex data problems and develop innovative solutions;
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross functional teams and communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders;
  • Capable of thriving in a dynamic, collaborative environment alongside cross-functional teams

What will you get if you join us in this position 

  • The opportunity to join our Data team and play a pivotal role in designing, building, and maintaining scalable data pipelines and systems and contributing to innovative solutions that redefine Bloq.it's revolution in the smart locker industry;
  • A dynamic and fast-paced work environment with a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning;
  • Competitive salary and benefits package, tailored to your experience and skills, including performance based bonus and Portuguese health insurance; 
  • Flexible work conditions, including a remote-friendly policy and a flexible schedule that allows you to balance your work and personal life-Monthly meetings in-person at our HQ Office in Lisbon, PT, giving you the chance to connect with the team and immerse yourself in our company culture;
  • Make a tangible impact by contributing to the spearheading the development of data pipelines and infrastructure, actively supporting our mission to provide affordable and sustainable solution; 

If you're a passionate Data Engineer ready to shape the future of smart locker solutions, Bloq.it is the place for you.

Join our team of #bloqstars and help us redefine the last-mile delivery experience!

Title: Senior Analyst - HR Analytics
Description:
About Convatec

Pioneering trusted medical solutions to improve the lives we touch: Convatec is a global medical products and technologies company, focused on solutions for the management of chronic conditions, with leading positions in Advanced Wound Care, Ostomy Care, Continence Care, and Infusion Care. With more than 10,000 colleagues, we provide our products and services in around 90 countries, united by a promise to be forever caring. Our solutions provide a range of benefits, from infection prevention and protection of at-risk skin, to improved patient outcomes and reduced care costs. Convatec‚Äôs revenues in 2024 were over $2 billion. The company is a constituent of the FTSE 100 Index (LSE:CTEC). To learn more please visit http://www.convatecgroup.com

About Us

Pioneering trusted medical solutions to improve the lives we touch: Convatec is a global medical products and technologies company, focused on solutions for the management of chronic conditions, with leading positions in advanced wound care, ostomy care, continence care, and infusion care. With around 10,000 colleagues, we provide our products and services in almost 100 countries, united by a promise to be forever caring. Our solutions provide a range of benefits, from infection prevention and protection of at-risk skin, to improved patient outcomes and reduced care costs. Convatec‚Äôs revenues in 2023 were over $2 billion. The company is a constituent of the FTSE 100 Index (LSE:CTEC). To learn more about Convatec, please visit http://www.convatecgroup.com

We are guided by our five core values, that shape the way we work, every day: Improve Care, Deliver Results, Grow Together, Own It and Do What‚Äôs Right.

At Convatec, we‚Äôre transforming our business for the better. Better products. Better ways of working. And better ways of delivering for our customers and each other. We‚Äôre aiming for nothing short of excellence. Join us on our journey to #ForeverCaring as Senior Analyst - HR Analytics and you‚Äôll do the same.

About the role:

The Senior Analyst - HR Analytics looking after analytics is a crucial role in supporting the Sr Director, People Solutions Experience (PSX) by optimizing our HR technology footprint, looking at our multiple HR Data sources (Primarily Workday) and measuring our project KPIs, partnering with stakeholder groups to build dashboards and data sources, driving a consumer level experience.

This role collaborates closely with our People Experience, HR Global Business services, Finance and wider HR community to enable data as a conversation aide. This role will also support strategic initiatives and contribute to the long-term roadmap and governance of HR technology.

Your Key duties and Responsibilities:


Analyze HR data from various sources, including Workday, ServiceNow, and digital adoption platforms, to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive strategic decision-making
Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and visualizations to effectively communicate key findings to HR leadership and stakeholders
Utilize statistical analysis and data mining techniques to identify areas for improvement in HR processes, employee experience, and technology adoption
Collaborate with HRIS team, HR business partners, and IT to gather data requirements, ensure data integrity, and implement data-driven solutions.
Leverage ServiceNow (all systems) data to analyze HR service delivery performance, identify bottlenecks, and recommend process optimizations
Analyze data from digital adoption platforms to understand user behavior, measure the effectiveness of training and support resources, and identify opportunities to improve user experience and technology adoption
Stay current on industry trends and best practices in HR analytics, data visualization, and reporting



About you:

Skills & Experience


Strong communication skills with the ability to effectively convey technical and functional information to diverse audiences, including non-technical stakeholders.
Proven project management skills with handling large data sets and a diverse set of stakeholders and managing complex projects from initiation to completion
Ability to support strategic initiatives and contribute to long-term planning and governance of HR technology
Excellent time management and organizational skills, with a proven ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a proactive approach to identifying and addressing system issues



Qualifications/Education


Bachelor's degree in human resources, Information Systems, or a related field
Proven experience in managing HRIS implementation and maintenance, preferably in a global organization
Strong knowledge of HR processes and best practices, with the ability to align them with HRIS capabilities
Proficient in HRIS systems specifically Workday, especially Peakon with Service Now being preferred
Knowledge of Adoption and Automation tooling (UIPath, WalkMe, WhatFix etc)
Strong project management skills, with experience leading system implementations and managing complex projects from initiation to completion
Deep understanding of the Workday platform, including system design, complex configurations, dashboard development, business processes, and security
Experience implementing multiple Workday modules and managing inter-system data transfers and integrations
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, including Teams



Principal Contacts:

Collaborate with Internal COEs and GBS Teams to align HRIS functionalities with business needs

Travel Requirements

Minimal travel required.

Languages

English: Fluent in Writing/Reading and Speaking

Working Conditions: Hybrid working, driven by business requirements as Convatec has a flexible approach to office working.

Our transformation will change your career. For good. You‚Äôll be pushed to think bigger and aim for excellence. Your ideas will be heard, and you‚Äôll be supported to bring them to life. There‚Äôll be challenges. But stretch yourself and embrace the opportunities, and you could make your biggest impact yet. This is stepping outside of your comfort zone. This is work that‚Äôll move you.

Beware of scams online or from individuals claiming to represent Convatec

A formal recruitment process is required for all our opportunities prior to any offer of employment. This will include an interview confirmed by an official Convatec email address.

If you receive a suspicious approach over social media, text message, email or phone call about recruitment at Convatec, do not disclose any personal information or pay any fees whatsoever. If you‚Äôre unsure, please contact us at careers@Convatec.com.

Equal opportunities

Convatec provides equal employment opportunities for all current employees and applicants for employment. This policy means that no one will be discriminated against because of race, religion, creed, color, national origin, nationality, citizenship, ancestry, sex, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, genetic predisposing characteristics or any other basis prohibited by law.

Notice to Agency and Search Firm Representatives

Convatec is not accepting unsolicited resumes from agencies and/or search firms for this job posting. Resumes submitted to any Convatec employee by a third party agency and/or search firm without a valid written and signed search agreement, will become the sole property of Convatec. No fee will be paid if a candidate is hired for this position as a result of an unsolicited agency or search firm referral. Thank you.

Already a Convatec employee?

If you are an active employee at Convatec, please do not apply here. Go to the Career Worklet on your Workday home page and View "Convatec Internal Career Site - Find Jobs". Thank you!

Title: Database Engineer (m/f/d) - Remote
Description:
SoSafe has the ambition to become the leading human risk management provider in Europe. Our award-winning awareness platform triggers behavioural change by providing effective and engaging training and simulations on cybersecurity and data protection. Cybercrime is predicted to cost the world $10.5 trillion annually by 2025 - we invite you to be part of the solution!

Your Mission:

We are seeking a skilled and proactive PostgreSQL Database Engineer with hands-on experience in AWS RDS and Aurora, and a collaborative mindset for supporting development teams. In this role, you will manage PostgreSQL infrastructure, tune performance, and contribute to database design and code reviews to ensure scalable, efficient, and maintainable data solutions.

The ideal candidate combines hands-on operational database administration skills with the ability to understand application-level requirements, effective communication skills to facilitate dialogue with developers, and the capacity to actively assist them in optimizing SQL and database usage.

Here's how you'll make a difference:


Administer, monitor, and optimize PostgreSQL databases running on Amazon RDS and Aurora.
Perform regular database maintenance tasks, including backup validation, replication checks, patching, and upgrades.
Collaborated with developers to optimize SQL and database objects, maintain PL/pgSQL routines, and contribute to data modeling initiatives to enhance performance.
Set up and fine-tune database performance metrics, logs, and alerts using AWS CloudWatch, pg_stat_statements, and other tools.
Identify and improve slow-running queries.
Implement and manage access control, auditing, and security policies in line with organizational standards.
Create and maintain database documentation and deployment scripts.
Contribute to and follow best practices for schema changes, migrations, and version control of database objects (GitHub experience is a plus).
Contribute to DevOps processes, including database CI/CD and automation of schema deployment automation.


What makes you a great fit:


Hands-on experience with PostgreSQL in production environments.
Hands-on experience with Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL, including provisioning, parameter groups, backups, and failover.
Hands-on experience integrating PostgreSQL with other AWS services (e.g., Lambda, S3).
Hands-on experience in writing and debugging SQL queries, developing and optimizing PL/pgSQL routines, managing views and materialized views, implementing and maintaining partitions.
Hands-on experience with performance tuning, query planning, and index optimization.
Familiarity with PostgreSQL monitoring tools such as pg_stat_statements, auto_explain, and others.
Solid understanding of database design, normalization, and data integrity constraints.
Experience collaborating with developers to understand application logic and improve data-layer performance.
Knowledge of CI/CD practices for database development (e.g., Github Actions)
Strong collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to explain database concepts to both developers and non-technical stakeholders.
Proactive problem-solving mindset, with a strong sense of ownership and commitment to seeing issues through to resolution.
Comfortable participating in code reviews and providing constructive suggestions to improve database interactions.
Willingness to participate in on-call duty.


What we offer*


Work/Life balance: Flexible hours, 33 vacation days
Wellbeing and financial support: Access to Open Up, corporate discounts
Connection & community: Virtual events, collaborative team activities, and opportunities for local meet-ups
And the list goes on: Tech equipment, referral bonuses, dog-friendly HQ
Perks and benefits listed above are for full-time employees and may vary slightly by office location. These are just a sample ‚Äî you'll learn more during the interview process.


About Us

At SoSafe, we‚Äôre on a mission to make the digital world safer by addressing the human factor in cybersecurity. As one of the fastest-growing security awareness scale-ups worldwide, we leverage behavioural science and data-driven learning to empower people against cyber threats. Our Human Risk Management approach helps organisations turn their employees into their strongest line of defence.

Backed by leading VCs like Highland Europe and Global Founders Capital, we‚Äôre rapidly expanding across the globe. We‚Äôre looking for team players who want to drive meaningful change in cybersecurity, take ownership of their work, and grow with us.

If you thrive in a vibrant, purpose-driven environment that values innovation, diversity, and collaboration, then this is the place for you!

If you thrive in a vibrant, purpose-driven environment that values innovation, diversity, and collaboration, then this is the place for you!

Title: Lead Data Analyst - Power BI | French Speaker
Description:
Empowered by our motto, "Making Data Matter", Keyrus stands at the forefront of global consultancy in Data & Analytics, AI & Machine Learning, and Digital Transformation. With a presence in 27 countries across 4 continents, we're on a mission to elevate the impact of data.

We are data experts, guiding our clients through their data journey regardless of their level of maturity in analytics. As an end-to-end partner, we address varied challenges that our clients face, from Advanced Analytics, Cloud, Data Governance, Visualisation to Enterprise Performance Management, from advisory to delivery.

With more than 3200 employees in all corners of the world, Keyrus is dedicated to helping businesses taking advantage of the Data and Digital paradigm to enhance their performance, facilitating and accelerating their transformation, and generating new drivers of growth, competitiveness, and sustainability.

Job Summary

Keyrus is expanding its network of talented professionals to support a growing number of data-driven projects. We‚Äôre building a pipeline of experienced consultants who can collaborate with us on both short- and mid-term assignments across a variety of clients and industries.

We are currently seeking a Senior Power BI Consultant to support our growing portfolio of data and analytics projects.


Location: Portugal or Spain - remote.


Note: All applications/CV‚Äôs must be submitted in English.

Key Responsibilities


Architect, develop, and implement end-to-end Power BI solutions, including data modelling, ETL integration, report development, and dashboard design.
Lead and support migration projects, such as transitioning reporting solutions from Qlik, Tableau, or other BI platforms to Power BI‚Äîor vice versa.
Act as a client-facing advisor‚Äîgather business requirements, define scalable BI architectures, and support strategic decision-making.
Design and deliver clear, interactive, and user-friendly dashboards and reports tailored to business needs.
Collaborate with data engineers and analysts to ensure data quality, availability, and alignment with reporting objectives.
Implement secure, role-based access models in accordance with governance and compliance requirements.
Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimise Power BI performance to ensure a seamless and responsive user experience.


Requirements For The Role


6+ years of experience in Business Intelligence, with a strong track record in Power BI delivery and development
Expert in Power BI: DAX, Power Query, data modelling, and advanced visualisation techniques
Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, ETL/ELT processes
Hands-on experience with SQL
Strong communication and consulting skills‚Äîcomfortable translating business needs into technical solutions
Microsoft certifications (e.g., Data Analyst Associate, Data Engineer Associate) are a plus
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data/IT, or related fields
French Speaker
Fluent in English
Must be a Portuguese or European citizen or have a work permit for Portugal


What We Offer At Keyrus Portugal


Opportunities for continued collaboration and potential internalisation into Keyrus
Training Program through KLX (Keyrus Learning Experience) Platform


Why Keyrus?

Joining Keyrus means joining a market leader in the Data Intelligence field and an (inter)national player in Management Consultancy and Digital Experience.

Keyrus Portugal operates on five guiding pillars that shape our approach to work and collaboration ‚Äì Diversity; Trust; Flexibility; Ownership & Innovation - we're dedicated to cultivating a team as diverse as the challenges we take on.

We embrace and celebrate the rich variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and talents that each individual brings. We firmly believe that diversity fuels innovation, ignites creativity, and propels us towards greatness.

Regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other dimension of diversity, everyone is not only welcome but valued here.

Join us in shaping a future where everyone can thrive!

At Keyrus Portugal, we're more than just a company - we're a constellation of bright minds and innovative souls.

If you're seeking a place where your passion meets purpose, where every project is a canvas and every challenge an opportunity, then look no further.

Join us, and be a part of a community that's shaping the digital frontier. At Keyrus Portugal, your journey to greatness begins.

Title: Mid Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
About Happy Mammoth:

Happy Mammoth is a high-growth e-commerce company dedicated to empowering women‚Äôs health through natural, science-backed supplements focused on gut, digestive, and hormonal wellness. As a performance-driven company, we are passionate about making a meaningful, lasting impact on our customers' lives. You can learn more about us at https://happymammoth.com/.

Before you dive deeper, please note the following key points:


This is a fully remote contractor role, available full-time
The role requires availability during EU hours (GMT)


At Happy Mammoth, you can expect:


A strong salary package
A welcoming and nurturing work environment, with colleagues from around the world
A fast-paced, dynamic, and non-corporate atmosphere where adaptability is key
The chance to be part of our exciting global expansion journey
Flexible working hours
Free access to courses, books and Masterminds
Opportunities for professional growth and development


Job Summary:

As a Data Analyst at Happy Mammoth, you‚Äôll be at the heart of our data-driven efforts. Your insights will directly influence our strategies to optimize customer acquisition, retention, and lifetime value. In this role, you‚Äôll dive into customer behavior, analyze marketing performance, and provide actionable insights that drive our direct-response and B2C marketing initiatives.

Responsibilities:


Collect, analyze, and interpret data to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that inform our business strategies
Build, maintain, and automate dashboards and reports to track KPIs, including ROAS, CPA, conversion rates, CLTV, and customer retention metrics
Work closely with cross-functional teams, such as marketing, product, and finance, to provide data-driven insights that support campaign performance and strategic marketing decisions
Provide ad hoc analysis to address specific business questions
Ensure data quality and accuracy by regularly validating and cleansing datasets
Communicate findings effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through reports, presentations, and storytelling


Qualifications:


Proven experience in data analysis, preferably with a focus on e-commerce
Proficiency in SQL and Excel
Proven experience in data visualization tools (e.g. Looker Data Studio, Looker, Power BI or similar)
Hands-on experience with cloud-based data warehouses and architectures (familiarity with Google BigQuery is a strong asset)
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Effective communicator with the ability to convey complex data insights clearly


What will set you apart:


You have a genuine hunger for success in all parts of your life
You thrive taking action, taking responsibility and getting things done before deadlines
You‚Äôre able to self-manage based upon the overall scope and work required
You‚Äôre able to diagnose and solve technical problems quickly
You're able to work as part of a team and actively contribute to conversations
A willingness to learn and grow with the business


CVs should be in English

Title: BI Analyst (Power BI)
Description:
About Insparya

Insparya is the largest clinical group specialized in Diagnosis, Treatment, and Research in Hair Health, with an international presence in several countries, including Portugal, Spain, Italy, Oman, and Saudi Arabia. Operating in the market since 2009, the Insparya Group has a Technological and Biomedical Research Center, which covers everything from stem cell research to robotics. Insparya's mission is to transform lives by offering innovative and personalized hair health solutions, promoting confidence, self-esteem, and well-being.




What We‚Äôre Looking For

Insparya is seeking a talented BI Analyst (Power BI) to help transform data into actionable insights that support strategic decision-making across the organization.

In this role, you‚Äôll be responsible for developing and maintaining dashboards, reports, and data models using Power BI (Cloud and On-Prem). You'll work closely with business stakeholders and technical team to understand their needs, ensure data accuracy, and deliver scalable, user-friendly analytics solutions.




Key Responsibilities

Design and implement scalable data models (e.g., star, snowflake, constellation schemas) to support reporting and analysis.
Build and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI Desktop and Service.
Connect, clean, and transform data from various sources using Power Query to ensure data quality and consistency.
Create DAX measures to support key performance indicators (KPIs) and business logic.
Ensure data quality, consistency, and accuracy across all deliverables.
Apply Row-Level Security (RLS) to meet governance and access control requirements.
Collaborate with business teams to gather requirements and translate them into actionable data solutions.
Perform testing and validation of BI solutions to ensure reliability and accuracy.
Document data sources, logic, and usage of developed dashboards and reports.




Requirements

3+ years of hands-on experience with Power BI (Desktop & Service).
Proficiency in DAX and Power Query (M language) for data transformation and analysis.
Solid understanding of dimensional modeling and relational databases.
Experience with data integration from multiple sources.
Working knowledge of SQL.
Fluency in English (Spanish is a plus).




Personal Skills

Communication: Conveying information clearly and effectively, both verbally and in writing, facilitating mutual understanding and collaboration.
Teamwork: Ability to collaborate harmoniously and productively with others, contributing to common goals and supporting colleagues.
Integrity: Maintaining high ethical and moral standards, being honest and transparent in all actions and decisions.
Innovation: Ability to think creatively and introduce new ideas and solutions.




Why should you join Insparya

Integration into a rapidly growing international group with a multicultural team, offering professional development opportunities.
Continuous investment in your career with ongoing training and skill development in a high-demand and innovative area, providing access to best practices and the latest and most innovative trends.
Support the well-being and self-esteem of our patients, in a positive and dynamic work environment.




We look forward to discovering your talent!

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are Is What We Do.

Deel is the all-in-one payroll and HR platform for global teams. Our vision is to unlock global opportunity for every person, team, and business. Built for the way the world works today, Deel combines HRIS, payroll, compliance, benefits, performance, and equipment management into one seamless platform. With AI-powered tools and a fully owned payroll infrastructure, Deel supports every worker type in 150+ countries‚Äîhelping businesses scale smarter, faster, and more compliantly.

Among the largest globally distributed companies in the world, our team of 6,000 spans more than 100 countries, speaks 74 languages, and brings a connected and dynamic culture that drives continuous learning and innovation for our customers.

Why should you be part of our success story?

As the fastest-growing Software as a Service (SaaS) company in history, Deel is transforming how global talent connects with world-class companies ‚Äì breaking down borders that have traditionally limited both hiring and career opportunities. We're not just building software; we're creating the infrastructure for the future of work, enabling a more diverse and inclusive global economy. In 2024 alone, we paid $11.2 billion to workers in nearly 100 currencies and provided healthcare and benefits to workers in 109 countries‚Äîensuring people get paid and protected, no matter where they are.

Our momentum is reflected in our achievements and customer satisfaction: CNBC Disruptor 50, Forbes Cloud 100, Deloitte Fast 500, and repeated recognition on Y Combinator‚Äôs top companies list ‚Äì all while maintaining a 4.83 average rating from 15,000 reviews across G2, Trustpilot, Captera, Apple and Google.

Your experience at Deel will be a career accelerator. At the forefront of the global work revolution, you'll tackle complex challenges that impact millions of people's working lives. With our momentum‚Äîbacked by a $12 billion valuation and $1 B in Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) in just over five years‚Äîyou'll drive meaningful impact while building expertise that makes you a sought-after leader in the transformation of global work.

Responsibilities


Collaborate closely with Product Managers, Product Operations and Dev teams on different problems to create actionable insights
Monitor product and feature release performance, define baselines, success metrics and provide recommendations for optimisation
Develop/apply extensive domain knowledge in your dedicated product areas in order to proactively derive meaningful recommendations and insights that drive and inform product strategy
Analyze market data, identify customer behavior and trends
Help design and evaluate A/B tests to improve customer journeys
Create and promote effective self-service analytics infrastructure for your product areas
Develop user friendly dashboards and high quality data visualizations that drive actions and support decision making
Explore large and complex datasets to create actionable insights
Build data models in dbt with the support of Analytics Engineers to create the cleanest data structures and KPIs for your product areas
Make intelligent choices for the adoption of new technologies based on your extensive experience
Contribute to the development and growth of fellow product analysts by proactively sharing knowledge, providing mentoring, etc.


Qualifications


Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Economics or equivalent degree
5+ years‚Äô experience in product analytics team
Hands on experience in at least one modern BI tools (preferably Looker)
Proficiency in SQL and product analytics tools (mixpanel / heap / amplitude)
Solid experience with Data Modelling (DBT)
Excellent multitasking and problem-solving abilities
Effective communication skills and experience dealing with stakeholders of varying seniority
Experience with Snowflake and LookML is a plus


Total Rewards

Our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all.

Some things you‚Äôll enjoy


Stock grant opportunities dependent on your role, employment status and location
Additional perks and benefits based on your employment status and country
The flexibility of remote work, including optional WeWork access


At Deel, we‚Äôre an equal-opportunity employer that values diversity and positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of race, religion, sex, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy or maternity or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Unless otherwise agreed, we will communicate with job applicants using Deel-specific emails, which include @deel.com and other acquired company emails like @payspace.com and @paygroup.com. You can view the most up-to-date job listings at Deel by visitingour careers page.

Deel is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects different abilities, backgrounds, beliefs, experiences, identities and perspectives.

Deel will provide accommodation on request throughout the recruitment, selection and assessment process for applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodation, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team at recruiting@deel.com of the nature of the accommodation that you may require, to ensure your equal participation.

We use Covey as part of our hiring and/or promotional processes. As part of the evaluation process, we provide Covey with job requirements and candidate-submitted applications. Certain features of the platform may qualify it as an Automated Employment Decision Tool (AEDT) under applicable regulations. For positions in New York City, our use of Covey complies with NYC Local Law 144.

We began using Covey Scout for Inbound on March 30, 2025.

For more information about our data protection practices, please visit our Privacy Policy. You can review the independent bias audit report covering our use of Covey here: https://getcovey.com/nyc-local-law-144

  • Analyze market data, identify customer behavior and trends
  • Help design and evaluate A/B tests to improve customer journeys
  • Create and promote effective self-service analytics infrastructure for your product areas
  • Develop user friendly dashboards and high quality data visualizations that drive actions and support decision making
  • Explore large and complex datasets to create actionable insights
  • Build data models in dbt with the support of Analytics Engineers to create the cleanest data structures and KPIs for your product areas
  • Make intelligent choices for the adoption of new technologies based on your extensive experience
  • Contribute to the development and growth of fellow product analysts by proactively sharing knowledge, providing mentoring, etc.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Economics or equivalent degree
  • 5+ years‚Äô experience in product analytics team
  • Hands on experience in at least one modern BI tools (preferably Looker)
  • Proficiency in SQL and product analytics tools (mixpanel / heap / amplitude)
  • Solid experience with Data Modelling (DBT)
  • Excellent multitasking and problem-solving abilities
  • Effective communication skills and experience dealing with stakeholders of varying seniority
  • Experience with Snowflake and LookML is a plus

Total Rewards

Our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all.

Some things you‚Äôll enjoy

  • Stock grant opportunities dependent on your role, employment status and location
  • Additional perks and benefits based on your employment status and country
  • The flexibility of remote work, including optional WeWork access

At Deel, we‚Äôre an equal-opportunity employer that values diversity and positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of race, religion, sex, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy or maternity or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Unless otherwise agreed, we will communicate with job applicants using Deel-specific emails, which include @deel.com and other acquired company emails like @payspace.com and @paygroup.com. You can view the most up-to-date job listings at Deel by visitingour careers page.

Deel is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects different abilities, backgrounds, beliefs, experiences, identities and perspectives.

Deel will provide accommodation on request throughout the recruitment, selection and assessment process for applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodation, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team at recruiting@deel.com of the nature of the accommodation that you may require, to ensure your equal participation.

We use Covey as part of our hiring and/or promotional processes. As part of the evaluation process, we provide Covey with job requirements and candidate-submitted applications. Certain features of the platform may qualify it as an Automated Employment Decision Tool (AEDT) under applicable regulations. For positions in New York City, our use of Covey complies with NYC Local Law 144.

We began using Covey Scout for Inbound on March 30, 2025.

For more information about our data protection practices, please visit our Privacy Policy. You can review the independent bias audit report covering our use of Covey here: https://getcovey.com/nyc-local-law-144

Title: Data Specialist | PowerBI
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for an Data Specialist | PowerBI!




Profile: We are looking for a Data Specialist with proven experience in Microsoft tools

(Office, PowerBI, Power Automate), combined with knowledge and skills in methodologies

for data manipulation, processing, and presentation. Additionally, we are looking for a candidate with knowledge and experience in using the JIRA tool. Knowledge of project management methodologies and ticketing system methodologies will be valued.




Responsabilities:

Structuring, processing, and consolidating data from various sources.
Configuring and maintaining reporting resources based on PowerBI.
Parameterizing and maintaining support automation based on Power Automate.
Developing metrics for analyzing delivery processes and continuous improvement.
Support for operational teams in continuous evolutionary delivery and project management.
Preparation of detailed support documentation for all reports, data models, and automation implemented.




Requirements:

Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, or equivalent.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in data management and handling roles;
Proven skills in Microsoft PowerBI and Microsoft Power Auto-
mate tools;
Strong ability to analyze systems and processes, including the ability to identify problems and apply effective technological solutions;
Experience with different areas of the business and understanding of how IT supports business processes;
Professional with background and technical proficiency in IT processes.
Knowledge of project management methodologies. Plus
Experience using JIRA and Confluence tools. Plus
Knowledge of ticketing system methodologies and EasyVista. Plus
Knowledge of SQL will be valued. Plus
Certifications in relevant areas will be considered an asset.
Fluent Portuguese;
Fluent English.
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with technical and business teams;
Ability to ensure alignment with strategic objectives;
Ability to work under pressure and proactively manage change and challenges;
Sense of responsibility, organization, and autonomy;
Willingness to learn.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúCA/PowerBI".




Thank You! üòä




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Internship - Junior Database Research Consultant
HTML:
With nearly 170 years of existence, and over 40,000 employees in more than 70 countries around the world, Savills is a company of international reputation in the real estate market.


We are seeking newly graduate professionals for IEFP Internships ‚ÄúEst√°gio + Talento‚Äù, to join us as a Junior Database Research Consultants in our office in Lisbon. The successful candidates will play a pivotal role in analyzing market trends, forecasting future market conditions, and providing actionable insights to guide our clients' investment strategies.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Collect, organize, and analyze data from primary and secondary sources;
  • Build and maintain structured and up to date databases;
  • Produce presentations that summarize the collected information.


Requirements:

  • Eligibility for an IEFP professional internship (Est√°gios + Talento) ‚Äì please apply only if you are eligible for this internship;
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Real Estate, Statistics, Data Science or a related field;
  • Proactive and organized, with the ability to manage multiple tasks;
  • Quick learning ability;
  • Proficiency in data analysis tools;
  • Knowledge of visualization platforms (Power BI);
  • Basic knowledge of statistics;
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment;
  • Interest in the real estate sector will be considered a plus;
  • Driving License.


What we offer:

  • Top-notch office facilities in a premium location in Lisbon;
  • Organizational culture focused on the well-being, team spirit and excellence;
  • Opportunity to work with a dynamic and innovative team;
  • Opportunity for future integration into the company.


To apply for this position, please send your CV and cover letter to Joana Malheiro (career@savills.pt).


Please note that we will use your personal details to respond to your application. For more details, please see our Privacy Policy.

Title: Biostatistician/Data Analyst
HTML:
WIRE IT was born during the pandemic period and is proudly based in Portugal.

Our values are built around today's IT reality: flexibility, transparency, trust, freedom, digital mindset, and the creation of Focused Partnerships making a real difference through trusted relationships with our collaborators and clients.

We are an IT services company operating worldwide, driven by an experienced and senior team that helps clients make the right decisions in a fast-moving market.

If you're looking for more than just a job - if you're looking for a place where you can truly make a difference - you might be the next person to join WIRE IT.

Role: Biostatistician/Data Analyst

Location: Remote, Portugal

Required skills:

  • Masters degree in Statistics
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in clinical data analysis (mandatory)
  • Proficiency in SAS for clinical data analysis
  • Advanced skills in statistical and biostatistical analysis
  • Fluent in English
  • Advanced computer skills, including practical knowledge of MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and project management software


We offer:

  • No-term full-time contract;
  • Health Insurance;
  • 22 days of paid vacation;
  • 4 extra days annually (Carnival, Christmas Eve, New Year's Eve, Birthday);
  • Meal Allowance on card (Coverflex);
  • Referral Bonus;
  • Special discounts and flex options;
  • Training annual budget;
  • A great team-oriented culture;
  • Chance to become a part of a dynamically growing international company;
  • Challenging projects giving the unique opportunity to grow and learn.


Following the EU General Data Protection Regulation No. 2016/679, we inform you that by responding to this announcement, you consent to the use of your data by Wire IT, for as long as necessary. In case of doubt or request for elimination of your personal data, please send an email to info@wireit.pt

Title: Junior BI Analyst
Description:
Overview: The position of Junior BI Analyst is an entry-level role. The role will include managing ad-hoc reporting/visualization tasks for production, sales, client reporting and more functions in the company.




Description:

Design & implement reports, dashboards, and visualizations using data visualization business intelligence tools
Optimize reporting dashboards with a focus on user experience, performance, flexibility, testability, and standardization
Working closely with stakeholders to understand requirements and provide the best possible solution
Make complex concepts simple and easy to understand by those around you through effective communication, planning and strategic execution
Maintain documentation for design, development and reporting work
Work within our systems and with BI team members to achieve high standards of data integrity, ensuring supporting metrics are accurate and complete
Working within team processes, data governance and security frameworks




Required Skills:

At least 1 year of experience working in a BI environment
Experience using Business Intelligence tools, such as Tableau or PowerBI
Experience in creating interactive dashboards
Minimum Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent / in the process of completing those studies.
Ability to learn new skills quickly
Ability to maintain professionalism, focus and result-orientation under pressure and tight deadlines
Attention to detail
Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) in English
Exceptional problem-solving/critical thinking skills
Experience working in a corporate environment




Desired Skills:

Exposure to Knime, Request Tracker (RT), Snowflake
Prior translation industry experience
Understanding of relational databases
Fluency in a foreign language







By applying, I confirm I have read and accept TransPerfect's Privacy Policy: https://www.transperfect.com/about/data-privacy-recruiting

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Farfetch is a leading global marketplace for the luxury fashion industry. The Farfetch Marketplace connects customers in over 190 countries and territories with items from more than 50 countries and over 1,400 of the world‚Äôs best brands, boutiques, and department stores, delivering a truly unique shopping experience and access to the most extensive selection of luxury on a global marketplace.

TECHNOLOGY
We're on a mission to build end-to-end products and technology that powers the an incredible e-commerce experience for luxury customers everywhere, understanding the motivations and needs of our customers and partners, to designing and testing hypotheses, to creating industry-leading experiences for luxury customers.

PORTO
Our office is near Porto, in the north of Portugal, and is located in a vibrant business hub. It offers a dynamic and welcoming environment where our employees can connect and network with a large community of tech professionals.

THE ROLE (Porto or Lisbon based)

We are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to support a growing number of information requests across Technology areas, providing data analysis services to several F-Tech teams. To become part of this team you must be a data lover and design enthusiast to help our team deliver first-rate insights. You will put all your database abilities into action to help our internal teams better view, understand, and report their data to their internal clients. You will support and create the most amazing and revolutionary reports, turning data into information.

What You'll Do


Create business cases to support prioritisation and product roadmap of platform verticals, such as catalogue, logistics, finance, pricing, and others
Support the definition and implementation of relevant metrics to monitor product performance and answer business questions
Recommend and analyse A/B or multivariate tests , deep dive on the results to provide insights and valuable recommendations
Custom reporting with SQL and BI tool to provide valuable information to stakeholders and leadership, e.g. creating automated dashboards to measure KPIs and perform data validation to support hypothesis
Promote alignment across teams (product, engineering, business and operations and other analytics teams)
Create and support customer analytics models to understand customer online behaviour
Collecting, tracking and trending projection / forecast data to assist in developing first-in class ftech products





Who You Are


A professional with at least 1,5 year of experience with data analytics and/or business analysis (e-commerce or retail orientation is a plus)
Has been involved in at least one project that required the use of Excel, SQL, BI or Data Visualisation tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau) or similar
Experience with English, both written and spoken
Has done at least one project that required applying data and analytics to solve problems and create new solutions
You like to learn new business contexts and tools
You like to work as a team and help others
You can adapt comfortably to quickly changing circumstances
You can effectively communicate the output of your work





Rewards & Benefits


Health insurance for the whole family, flexible working environment and well-being support and tools
Extra days off, sabbatical program and days for you to give back for the community
Training opportunities and free access to Udemy
Flexible benefits program





EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES STATEMENT


Farfetch is an equal opportunities employer ensuring that all applicants are treated equally and fairly throughout our recruitment process. We are determined that no applicant experiences discrimination on the basis of sex, race, ethnicity, religion or belief, disability, age, gender identity, ancestry, sexual orientation, veteran status, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law.





SCAM DISCLAIMER


It has come to our attention that there may be fraudulent activities involving individuals or organizations falsely claiming to represent Farfetch in order to attract candidates to a SCAM. Please be aware that Farfetch does not conduct recruitment processes through messaging apps or any unofficial communication channels, other than our official careers website. Additionally, Farfetch will never ask candidates for any form of payment during the recruitment process





We are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to support a growing number of information requests across Technology areas, providing data analysis services to several F-Tech teams.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there‚Äôs a constant need to be innovative.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there‚Äôs always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

Data Analyst is responsible for examining and interpreting complex data sets to derive meaningful insights and support business decision-making. Focused on descriptive and diagnostic analytics to answer questions of where your company has been, where it is now, why things are the way they are now, and support the decision about what are the next steps.

Their mission involves organizing data, conducting statistical analysis, creating data models, and collecting data requirements from Businesses.

Data analysts collaborate with different teams to understand their analytical requirements, identify key metrics, and communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders effectively.

As a part of your job, you will:


Gathering and analyzing business requirements to determine the best solution for data reporting and analysis;
Designing data solutions such as data warehousing, data marts, dashboards, and reporting systems;
Developing and maintaining data models, reports, and visualizations;
Collaborating with IT teams to ensure proper data integration and management;
Assisting stakeholders in interpreting data insights and making informed business decisions.



What are we looking for?


Proficiency in SQL for data querying and analysis;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib);
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools (e.g., R, Python libraries like pandas);
Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets;
Familiarity with data cleansing and preparation techniques.



Personal traits:

Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams and Clients

Teamwork skills but also sense of autonomy

Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included

Willingness to collaborate with other players

Strong communication skills

At Celfocus, we are committed to cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace. As an equal-opportunity employer, we welcome applicants of all backgrounds, gender identities, and abilities. We are dedicated to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with specific needs. If you require any adjustments during the selection process, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team.

Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing leading edge professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions ‚Äì addressing Telecommunications, Financial Services, Retail, Energy & Utilities, Pharmaceutical, and other markets' strategic opportunities.

As a highly specialised engineering company, Celfocus helps clients undergo their innovation path, providing technological solutions to extract value from data and make it actionable.

Serving clients in +25 countries, Celfocus delivers solutions that boost customer experience and enhance operational efficiency, via our Cognitive Automation, Data & Analytics and Digital offers.

Title: Junior Healthcare Data Analyst
HTML:
Learn About Knok

At knok, we dare to lead and humanize the digital transformation of healthcare. We envision a world where everyone has timely access to quality healthcare through digital technology, creating a more equal society. We genuinely believe in it and you can recognize it in every person who embraces this mission.

Through a Digital Front Door strategy, knok connects patients, providers and healthcare professionals in one place. Our API-first white-label platform enables a continuous, engaging and personalised healthcare experience for all conditions through a cutting edge Patient Journey Engine.

With regular clinical practice as our main source of knowledge, we leverage ready-to-use data to improve care automation and increase financial savings. Since 2015, we have enabled more than 2.5 million clinical interactions in over 12 countries. Our platform is scalable and AI-ready, enhancing the power of data-driven care to deliver better outcomes during all stages of life.

Are you ready to join us in revolutionizing healthcare and making a tangible impact on people's lives?

About The Role

We are looking for a Junior Healthcare Data Analyst to support our teams in turning complex healthcare data into meaningful insights. You'll be working with datasets from different sources, such as clinical operations, insurance processing, and patient journeys - helping us improve care delivery and decision-making.

If you're passionate about using data to make healthcare more accessible and effective, don't stop here - dive deeper!

As an Junior Healthcare Data Analyst, you will:

  • Collect, clean, and analyse healthcare data from multiple sources (e.g. EHR, patient demographics, operational systems), to extract meaningful insights;
  • Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualisations to communicate key metrics and findings to stakeholders, including clinicians, operational teams and leadership team;
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with teams across the organisation, including data science, product management, and clinical operations, to support data-driven decision-making;
  • Perform statistical analysis to support population health management, risk stratification, and clinical outcome optimisation;
  • Contribute to improving data quality by identifying data quality issues and anomalies, and work with relevant stakeholders to address and resolve them

What Makes You a Great Fit For This Journey

  • Bachelor's degree in Biomedical Engineering, Medical Statistics, Biomedical Sciences, Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Health Informatics, or a related field. Master's degree preferred;
  • Experience (academic or professional) with data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Power BI or similar;
  • Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques;
  • Ability to turn complex data into clear insights that support better decision-making;
  • Knowledge of programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and statistical modeling;
  • Ability to explain a dashboard or an analysis to someone without a technical background, in a simple and practical way;
  • Care when working with data to ensure accuracy, consistency and reliability;
  • Ability to manage several analytical tasks at the same time, prioritising what has the greatest impact on the business and patients

Title: Junior Energy Data Analyst
Description:
We are EDP, a global energy company present in around 29 markets with a particular emphasis on renewable energies. With more than 45 years of experience, we have been consolidating a relevant presence on the world energy scene based on the commitment to be all-green by 2030, leading the energy transition. With more than 13,000 employees around the world, we are committed to using our energy and heart to drive a better tomorrow.




The Data Availability and Validation Team of EDP Networks Platform is looking to strengthen its team by hiring a Junior Energy Data Analyst.




What you will do:

Specify business requirements and perform acceptance testing associated with energy data management system developments.
Execute tasks associated with the validation and provisioning of energy data.
Monitor the validation and provisioning processes for energy data.
Analyze exceptions and anomalous patterns in energy data, as well as categorize identified scenarios.
Identify enhancements for existing processes and procedures.
Definition of improvements in procedures and monitoring of the quality of work carried out by operational teams.




Employment type: Full-Time

Work site: Hybrid Model

Work Place: Lisbon or Porto




What are we looking for:

Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems Management, Electrical Engineering, or Applied Mathematics;
Up to 2 years of professional experience in similar roles.
Mandatory knowledge of energy and/or the electrical sector.
Strong critical thinking skills in data analysis and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
Proficiency in Portuguese, English, and MS Office.
Attention to detail, process-oriented, results-driven, proactive, and the ability to perform under pressure are critical competencies for this role.
Experience in projects using agile methodology will be valued.




More than academic knowledge and technical skills, we are looking for ambitious people who are enthusiastic about the future and who bring human skills aligned with our purpose.




Equal opportunities for all

Our vision is that each person combines their unique characteristics and experiences to fulfill our mission of creating new energy for the planet. We are an inclusive employer, ensuring all candidates are treated fairly throughout the recruitment process. We welcome and value all people, and we are committed to fostering a sense of belonging for each person who is part of the EDP group.




Need more reasonsto apply?

As a top employer we:

Empower our employees through a positive and innovative work environment that promotes collaboration and agile decision-making;
Respect and value each person, providing a flexible, healthy, and inclusive workplace with a range of attractive benefits;
Provide a meaningful work experience and prepare our people for future challenges through different opportunities for development and internal mobility;




Our efforts have resulted in several distinctions over time, highlighting the EDP group's strong positioning and its dedication and commitment to attracting and retaining the best talent:

Top employer certification by Top Employers Institute
Part of the Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index
Global certification as a family-responsible company by Fundaci√≥n M√°sfam√≠lia
Top 100 Workplaces by Houston Chronicle




Discover our tips to enhance your performance during the recruitment process and apply until 16/09/2025 if you think you are the right fit for this opportunity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation and Professional Pride. Do you identify with these values?

Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity," Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

By developing projects in the most diverse industries ‚Äì Banking, Telecommunications, Health, Retail, Energy, Insurance or Aviation - we analyze data, transforming it into knowledge for our clients, allowing them to adopt the best decision-making for their respective organizations and businesses.




We seek a Data Analyst willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team.

Hybrid working mode with base in Porto.




Main Tasks:

‚Ä¢ Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.

‚Ä¢ Creative descriptive, predictive, and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholder‚Äôs decision making.

‚Ä¢ Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining.




Technical Skills:

‚Ä¢ Data knowledge / Data processing / Data quality / IT Development

‚Ä¢ Database Management (SQL)

‚Ä¢ Methodologies (Agile)

‚Ä¢ Office Pack (MS Excel)

‚Ä¢ Power BI / Tableau




Language Skills:

‚Ä¢ English - Expert

‚Ä¢ French - Expert




Soft Skills:

‚Ä¢ IT - Business/IT relationship

‚Ä¢ Analytical Ability

‚Ä¢ Data Intelligence, Research and Quant Analytics

‚Ä¢ Ability to understand, explain and support change

‚Ä¢ Ability to collaborate/Teamwork

‚Ä¢ Attention to detail/rigor




If you believe in this match as much as we do, send your CV to leonor.carvalho@closer.pt and reach the closest side of life.




Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics.
