Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description:
Why Choose TD SYNNEX:

TD SYNNEX is a Fortune 100 company with over $58 billion in revenue (NYSE: SNX), recognized as one of the world‚Äôs leading technology distributors and solutions aggregators. With a diverse team of 24,000 employees operating across more than 100 countries, we support over 150,000 customers in maximizing the value of their technology investments, driving business results, and unlocking growth opportunities. TD SYNNEX is a certified Great Place to Work, celebrated for our dynamic culture and comprehensive benefits. Our diverse workforce is our greatest strength, fostering success and inclusivity.

About the role:

We‚Äôre looking for a highly analytical and business-oriented Business Intelligence Analyst to join our Datech Division. You‚Äôll play a key role in identifying market opportunities and translating them into actionable insights that drive sales performance across Europe. This role works closely with Business Managers and Sales teams to develop campaigns, set targets, and measure impact.

Datech is a specialized business unit within TD SYNNEX, focused on delivering design software solutions for industries such as architecture, engineering, construction, manufacturing, and media. It acts as a global distributor and solution aggregator, partnering with leading vendors like Autodesk, Trimble or Unity to support digital transformation through value-added services, technical enablement, and strategic business development

Key Responsibilities:


Analyze market potential and penetration to support strategic decision-making.
Integrate internal and external data to assess customer lifecycle and value.
Identify opportunities to retain, develop, and acquire high-value customers.
Design intuitive reporting methodologies and perform ad-hoc market analysis.
Collaborate with Sales and Product Marketing to align efforts with revenue goals.
Support campaign execution through customer segmentation and targeting.
Measure and report on campaign effectiveness and sales impact.
Maintain and update customer profiling and contact data.
Work with vendor partners to validate campaign offerings and customer lists.
Ensure consistent use of data sources, methodologies, and modeling assumptions.


What we're kindly looking for:


3+ years of experience in data mining, BI analysis, or reporting.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree required; IT industry knowledge is a plus.
Strong analytical mindset with attention to detail and business acumen.
Experience with tools like Tableau or Power BI is desirable.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities.
Comfortable collaborating across departments and with external partners.
Results-driven and proactive in identifying growth opportunities.
Fluent in English; additional European languages are a plus.
Able to negotiate skillfully, promote/sell ideas persuasively, and close transactions with mutually beneficial results.


What We Offer you:


Comprehensive private health and life insurance to keep you covered.
Hybrid work model.
Tailored salary perks.
Access to a comprehensive learning platform to support your professional growth.
A multicultural and diverse environment with global career opportunities.
Certified Great Place to Work with a strong focus on work-life balance.


Please note that benefits may vary depending on the position and the country.

Key Skills

What‚Äôs In It For You?


Elective Benefits: Our programs are tailored to your country to best accommodate your lifestyle.
Grow Your Career: Accelerate your path to success (and keep up with the future) with formal programs on leadership and professional development, and many more on-demand courses.
Elevate Your Personal Well-Being: Boost your financial, physical, and mental well-being through seminars, events, and our global Life Empowerment Assistance Program.
Diversity, Equity & Inclusion: It‚Äôs not just a phrase to us; valuing every voice is how we succeed. Join us in celebrating our global diversity through inclusive education, meaningful peer-to-peer conversations, and equitable growth and development opportunities.
Make the Most of our Global Organization: Network with other new co-workers within your first 30 days through our onboarding program.
Connect with Your Community: Participate in internal, peer-led inclusive communities and activities, including business resource groups, local volunteering events, and more environmental and social initiatives.


Don‚Äôt meet every single requirement? Apply anyway.

At TD SYNNEX, we‚Äôre proud to be recognized as a great place to work and a leader in the promotion and practice of diversity, equity and inclusion. If you‚Äôre excited about working for our company and believe you‚Äôre a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply. You may be exactly the person we‚Äôre looking for!

Title: Data Analyst ‚Äì Alteryx
Description:
Welcome to Felps Lisboa




üëã A community of passionate experts who combine their skills to take your company to higher levels of excellence. üöÄ




üîí Our expertise: The Felps Group is an alliance of ‚ÄòPure Players‚Äô made up of four distinct squads: Telecoms, IT, Cybersecurity and Change Management. Each squad is led by a Captain who is a specialist in that particular area. The captains coach the consultants throughout their careers in the Felps Group, guiding them in their choice of missions and the stages of their training. Our aim is to facilitate the growth and development of our consultants, enabling them to take their careers to the next level.




üåê Our approach: In our model, consultants are the central focus, which is why we dedicate all our attention to them. The team, led by the Captain and Associate Director, provides expert support to ensure the consultants receive the highest level of guidance. Drawing on our extensive experience, we are able to deliver personalized, comprehensive, and impactful assistance tailored to their needs.




üëâüèº Felps Group believes in the power of diversity and inclusion. We are committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all employees feel respected, supported and encouraged to contribute to the company.

As a member of our team, you will be part of a culture that celebrates diversity in all its forms, be it age, gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, skills, socio-economic background or any other personal characteristic. We pride ourselves on our commitment to equal opportunities and justice.

We encourage applications from all qualified candidates, including people with disabilities who are accredited by DGERT/IEFP. We are committed to providing an inclusive work environment and accommodation to support the integration of all our employees. If you have any specific accessibility requirements during the recruitment process, please let us know and we will do our best to support you.




We are looking for a skilled Data Analyst specialized in Alteryx, experienced in handling date/time datasets (PDATEN), and capable of transforming complex data into actionable insights to support strategic decision-making.




Your Key Responsibilities:

Design, build, and optimize Alteryx workflows for analytics and reporting.
Integrate Alteryx solutions with BI platforms such as Tableau and Power BI.
Collaborate with international teams to gather and translate requirements.
Ensure compliance with data governance and security standards.
Prepare, transform, and analyze temporal datasets, ensuring consistency and quality in pipelines and BI reports.

Requirements:

Proven experience with Alteryx Designer and Server.
Strong SQL and ETL knowledge.
Experience in data modeling and analytics projects.
Fluency in English is mandatory; French is highly valued.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Technical Skills Required:

Alteryx workflow design and optimization.
SQL querying and data transformation.
ETL processes for structured and temporal datasets.
Integration with BI tools (Tableau, Power BI).
Data quality control, consistency checks, and reporting standards compliance.




Transform data into actionable insights and join our Felps Lisboa team today!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
A Company you will be happy to grow with!




At InnoTech, it¬¥s all about connecting people with business through technology.

We care about you, your happiness, and your well-being. We seek people who want to learn and further improve their skills with us ‚Äì growth is part of our DNA, and that‚Äôs why we‚Äôre proud to be certified as a Great Place to Work and to be among the Top 50 Best Workplaces in Portugal! For us, sustainability is not just a word. Integrity and social responsibility lead our behavior.




We dare to be different, ambitious, dream big, and deliver value like no other! You will have the opportunity to work with top-level partners in the banking area, insurance, retail, telecommunications, financial services, and so much more!




We are 180+ InnoTechers, and we want your talent as a Data Analyst.




Your Mission Will Be:

Collaborate with stakeholders across various sectors to identify and understand their analytical needs and challenges;
Map business requirements to existing analytics product functionality, identifying opportunities for enhancement and customization;
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using Power BI, ensuring they deliver actionable insights;
Ensure the quality and integrity of the data used for analysis.




You Will Need:

Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis;
Proven proficiency in the Power BI tool, including development of dashboards and reports;
Experience working with Snowflake and Azure Databricks;
Fluency in Portuguese and English;
CPLP nationality or an EU work permit is required to facilitate employment.




Would Be Awesome If You Have:

BSc or MSc in Computer Science/Engineering, Information Technology, or related fields;
Experience working with SQL Server.




With Us You Can Be a:

TechThinker ‚Äì people who want to re-imagine technology with us
TechSolver ‚Äì strategic, resilient, and a little bit of a puzzle lover
InnoMinder ‚Äì inhale innovation, exhale digital transformation
InnoTecher ‚Äì no words needed. Just happiness, talent, and all the above!




Are you convinced? Come see it for yourself.

Join our Top-Notch Team!

Title: Data Science Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer


A chance to grow your analytics skills in a supportive, international environment.
Direct exposure to real-world business challenges and data-driven strategy.
Mentorship from experienced data scientists and analysts.
Opportunities to evolve toward more advanced data science roles.
Dynamic and diverse team within one of the leading global fashion brands.
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.



What you will do


Support data-driven decision-making by preparing and analyzing data related to customer behavior, CRM performance, and sales across multiple channels.
Work closely with data scientists and business stakeholders to translate business questions into meaningful insights.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to support data science model development.
Use Python and SQL to clean, process, and visualize data in support of analytics and modeling projects.
Apply basic statistical methods (e.g. descriptive statistics, correlation analysis, hypothesis testing) to uncover insights.
Ensure data quality and consistency across sources by collaborating with data engineering and IT teams.
Communicate findings clearly through presentations and storytelling.
Actively participate in sprint planning, reviews, and agile ceremonies within the team.



What you‚Äôll bring


1‚Äì2 years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, or a related data role (internships included).
Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Economics, Business Analytics, or Engineering.
Experience working with data using SQL and Python (pandas, matplotlib/seaborn).
Experience with PySpark and Spark technologies is a strong plus, but not mandatory.
Basic understanding of statistics and its application in business analytics.
Strong attention to detail, curiosity, and eagerness to learn.
Good communication skills, including the ability to explain data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Team player with a proactive mindset and willingness to grow in a collaborative environment.
Fluency in English (written and spoken)



Nice to have:


Exposure to cloud platforms like AWS, Azure or Databricks.
Knowledge of Python packages used in machine learning (e.g. scikit-learn).
Participation in academic or personal analytics projects



In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.
Show more
HTML:
Who We Are

Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer

  • A chance to grow your analytics skills in a supportive, international environment.
  • Direct exposure to real-world business challenges and data-driven strategy.
  • Mentorship from experienced data scientists and analysts.
  • Opportunities to evolve toward more advanced data science roles.
  • Dynamic and diverse team within one of the leading global fashion brands.
  • Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.

Title: Data Analyst (French Speaker) - CRM (Porto/Lisboa)
Description:
Company Description

Natixis in Portugal is a Centre of Expertise whose mission is to transform traditional banking by developing innovative solutions for the business, operations and work culture of Groupe BPCE worldwide.

Natixis in Portugal is part of the Global Financial Services division, where it applies technology for the development of financial expertise in its two global business lines ‚Äì Corporate & Investment Banking and Asset & Wealth Management ‚Äì and, transversally, for the entities of Groupe BPCE.

The Centre of Expertise, based in Porto, currently has more than 2,400 employees from over 30 nationalities, organised in three main departments: Information Technology, Banking Support Activities and Compliance. These teams work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting and creating value for all the business lines and platforms of the group. The project in Porto is one of the biggest investments in Human Resources ever made by Groupe BPCE worldwide.

A disruptive mindset and a culture of proximity and agility identify Natixis in Portugal Team and reflect the company's mission to transform traditional banking at a global scale: a perfect match in the Portuguese dynamics and entrepreneurial ecosystem.

In 2024, Top Employers Institute has awarded Natixis in Portugal the Top Employer Portugal accreditation for the second time. This certification recognizes excellence in people practices, following the example of our head office, in France, who was certified Top Employer France for the eight year in a row.

Job Description

Team presentation and main goal:

The data engineer is a computer developer whose mission is to implement the collection and availability of data within the company. They are also responsible for industrializing and putting into production processes on the data (for example: providing dashboards, integrating statistical models) in collaboration with business teams and the teams that analyze them.

Main Tasks And Goals

Production (50%)


Ensure production monitoring and maintenance - Feed the CRM and other recurring programs.
Ensure documentation of processes.
Automate manual processes if necessary.
Develop technical solutions that meet business needs.


Management (25%)


Implement, monitor, and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) for marketing campaigns.
Participate in the preparation and analysis of marketing campaign reports.


Business Requests (20%)


Analyze and understand expressed business needs.
Prioritize requests based on their impact and the company‚Äôs priorities.
Respond to requests within the specified deadlines, proposing suitable solutions.
Rigorously document processes and analyses performed.
Implement automation solutions to optimize efficiency and task recurrence.


Appendices (5%)


Conduct in-depth ad hoc analyses:
Perform thorough analyses on Additional Business activities.
Actively participate in the migration of SAS systems to more modern technologies, in collaboration with the relevant teams.


Qualifications


Holder of a higher education degree (Master's level minimum) in statistics, computer science, data science, finance, or a related field.
Significant experience of at least three (3) years as a Data Analyst / Data Engineer, ideally acquired in the banking sector.
Expert in data engineering: organize, automate, and optimize data production processes.
Proven experience in managing complex data flows.
Expert proficiency in SQL language.
Advanced proficiency in Alteryx (Server and Desktop).
Knowledge and ability to understand existing SAS scripts.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite.
In-depth knowledge of the banking sector.
Proficient in Power BI for data visualization.
Experience in project management, demonstrating the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and meet deadlines.
Fluent in English and French (minimum B2).


Soft Skills


Communicative.
Analytical and synthesis mindset.
Critical sense and ability to identify errors and inconsistencies.
Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate effectively with different types of stakeholders, especially in presenting results and recommendations.


We will only consider English Cv's.

Additional Information

At Natixis, we are committed to fostering a working environment where each and every one of our people is treated with dignity and respect and where every voice is heard. Our differences make us collectively stronger and are a source of fulfilment, innovation and performance.

In the framework of its Diversity, Equity & Inclusion policy, Natixis in Portugal has implemented a Blind CV Screening process, with the purpose of reducing hiring bias. A blind CV excludes any personal details which refer to the applicant‚Äôs gender, age or ethnicity. When applying for our positions, please submit a blind CV, that is, with no picture, name, gender, age, nationality, ethnicity and address. Your personal statement, work experience, courses and certifications, education, skills and contact information is what matters to us.

#MuchMoreThanJustAJob

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. Start your day having breakfast with the Team and grab fresh fruit on the way to your seat, in one of Porto‚Äôs most typical neighborhoods. This Purple Day is going to be a busy one: daily meeting ensuring all team members are on the same page regarding work status, priorities and blockers, language class and, just after, a Talent Management meeting with your manager, discussing your career path.

Lunch break. Today, your Team is onboarding newcomers, but also welcoming French colleagues: the perfect excuse to walk downtown and bond over a francesinha. When returning, inhale nature and peace of mind in Natixis Urban Garden (look at the crops; ready to harvest!).

Back inside. Brainstorming session on a new, exciting project in our disruptive and immersive Manaus Village. The afternoon went flying (tasks, meetings, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: celebrating cultural diversity with a Diwali, the Indian festival of lights.

Tomorrow, you attend a conference led by influential speakers in your industry and, the day after, you will work from home, benefitting from some focus time to complete that report and soft skills course on LinkedIn Learning. Once you are done with your work for the day, strike the right note playing with Natixis band or be part of a board games session. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to catch some waves or sail the Douro river during golden hour.
Show more

Title: Finance Data Analyst ‚Äì All genders ‚Äì Fluent in English - Oporto ‚Äì Open Ended Contract ‚Äì Hybrid
Description:
WHO ARE WE ?

BNP PARIBAS CARDIF, the Insurer for a Changing World.

We are the world leader in the creditor insurance market with strong positions in savings and protection insurance in more than 30 countries all around the world.

European Service Center - Cardif Services, European Platform of Services with a diversity of processes aiming to bring excellence to our Internal Clients, being part of BNP Paribas Cardif, is an organization dedicated to providing other BNP Paribas Cardif entities with a diversity of processes and services connected to insurance activity. We aim to bring excellence to our internal clients, ensuring highest levels of efficiency and reliability. With over 480 employees and 6 working languages, we are a multicultural and a diverse team, operating in Porto and Lisbon, Portugal.

We are currently looking for a Finance Data Analyst (All genders) based in Oporto

BE PART OF OUR DYNAMIC FAR DATA TEAM

‚ÄúDonn√©es FAR‚Äù (stands for Finance, Actuary, and Risk Data) Department is in charge of providing data to 3 main departments of the company : Finance, Actuary and Risk. You responsibilities will be to collect, check, and provide data from our business to our internal clients (Finance, Actuary ‚Ä¶) using automated tools.

YOUR FUTURE MISSION IN THE FAR DATA TEAM


Participate in data quality audit work on a defined scope:
Participate in the administration of the necessary repositories on its perimeter
Participate in the development of the reference documentation associated with the data
Participate in the governance of data quality


Qualifications - External

AS OUR NEW FINANCE DATA ANALYST, YOU MUST HAVE:


Degree in Data Analysis, Finance or Actuarial
Professional background about 3/5 years in data analysis for finance/accounting functions.
Fluent in English (C1 level is mandatory)
Fluency in French (B1-B2 level would be greatly appreciated)
Excel VBA
SAS
Python
Datavizualisation Tools (PowerBi, Qlik‚Ä¶)


What Do We Offer

Besides our attractive salary, you will benefit :


Meals allowance
Transportation allowance
Child allowance
Private Health Insurance including spouse and descendants, Life Insurance, Travel Insurance
Hybrid working mode ‚Äì a balance between office days to reinforce commitment, creativity and human links, and homeworking days for flexibility of the employees
Continuous development and career growth opportunities on a local and global level
And much more‚Ä¶


The work environment is important!


Benefit from our modern amenities, including zen and creative rooms amongst others, many discounts from our group platform, free language courses, doctor on-site & remote and diverse company events,
Work in a multicultural environment with multiple nationalities,
Be part of a people care company with a strong & continuous growth investing in its employees through training and career opportunities.


Our commitments to you


Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas Cardif is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas Cardif we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas Cardif, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment.

If your profile and motivations matches our needs and you feel motivated to join our company, do not hesitate in sending us you application.

We will be delighted to consider you for this position.

Please note that only applications submitted with CV, Cover letter & Certificate of Studies will be considered and move forward in the application process.

Title: Data Analysis HR Trainee (f/m/div)
Description:
Are you passionate about HR technology and digitalization? Do you want to kick-start your career with a team of Digital HR experts, in a dynamic and multicultural work environment, and support our Human Resources Digitalization? Look no further than our HR Digital team in Porto! You'll gain precious experience and be part of an exciting journey towards becoming a digital expert.

Job Description

As an HR Data Analysis Trainee, you will support the HR Digital team, located across various regions. You will play a crucial role in HR digitalization, influencing global HR processes and communicating with multiple stakeholders to implement our digital strategy for HR on a global scale.

In your new role, you will:


Develop new self-service data solutions, such as Certified Data Sources, Dashboards, or List Reports
Support data solutions as they go into sustain, namely by troubleshooting and bug-fixing, enhancing and maintaining features throughout the life-cycle, as well as enabling and supporting end-users
Managing relationships and relevant communication flows with stakeholders
Trend-scout and consult on data-related matters
Support HR and Business in taking better, faster, fact-based decisions, driving HR transformation even further


Your Profile

You have a proactive, structured, and autonomous working style. You have an excellent team spirit and a creative mindset. You possess great communication skills and are an artist when it comes to stakeholder management. You can think and act strategically and like to work on new concepts, where you can apply your technical knowledge, as well as your understanding of HR processes.

You are best equipped for this role if you have:


A degree in Data Science, Information Technology, Economics, Business Administration, Human Resources, or a similar field of study
Concrete knowledge and understanding of reporting solutions & data analysis process, acquired by your educational background and/or through hands-on experience (e.g., curricular internship)
Know how on Business Intelligence software ‚Äì both on data flows and visualization ends - preferably Tableau
Knowledge of HR processes is a plus
Fluency in English (mandatory). Knowledge of German is a plus


Please apply with your CV in English.

Contact:

Maria Julia Mello

#WeAreIn for driving decarbonization and digitalization.

As a global leader in semiconductor solutions in power systems and IoT, Infineon enables game-changing solutions for green and efficient energy, clean and safe mobility, as well as smart and secure IoT. Together, we drive innovation and customer success, while caring for our people and empowering them to reach ambitious goals. Be a part of making life easier, safer and greener.

Are you in?


Welcome to Infineon Technologies Business Solutions in Porto! - Infineon Technologies Business Solutions is a vibrant global hub, driven by diverse talents and an operational culture of excellence, in a privileged geographic location. The team of more than 25 nationalities works together in a dynamic, diverse and inclusive environment. We lead innovation and digital transformation, shaping the future of Infineon Technologies. At the heart of everything we do, people matter most. Our ultimate goal is to craft a unique experience for both our customers and employees.


At our site you will find a range of diverse teams that have built a reputation for delivering high-quality services for all Infineon in Finance, Procurement, Human Resources, IT, Audit, Legal, Compliance, Business Continuity and Sustainability, Cyber Security, Communication, Corporate Supply Chain Logistics and Sales & Marketing. Porto is a powerhouse of ideas and solutions, a key player in the global company‚Äôs puzzle, delivering specialized services and innovative solutions.

Together, Infineon Technologies Business Solutions will continue to shape the future, driving innovation and excellence for years to come.

We are on a journey to create the best Infineon for everyone.

This means we embrace diversity and inclusion and welcome everyone for who they are. At Infineon, we offer a working environment characterized by trust, openness, respect and tolerance and are committed to give all applicants and employees equal opportunities. We base our recruiting decisions on the applicant¬¥s experience and skills. Learn more about our various contact channels.

We look forward to receiving your resume, even if you do not entirely meet all the requirements of the job posting.

Please let your recruiter know if they need to pay special attention to something in order to enable your participation in the interview process.

Click here for more information about Diversity & Inclusion at Infineon.
Show more

Together, Infineon Technologies Business Solutions will continue to shape the future, driving innovation and excellence for years to come.

We are on a journey to create the best Infineon for everyone.

This means we embrace diversity and inclusion and welcome everyone for who they are. At Infineon, we offer a working environment characterized by trust, openness, respect and tolerance and are committed to give all applicants and employees equal opportunities. We base our recruiting decisions on the applicant¬¥s experience and skills. Learn more about our various contact channels.

We look forward to receiving your resume, even if you do not entirely meet all the requirements of the job posting.

Please let your recruiter know if they need to pay special attention to something in order to enable your participation in the interview process.

Click here for more information about Diversity & Inclusion at Infineon.

Title: Risk Data Analyst - Fincrime & Fraud Monitoring
Description:
Hello! We're Teya.

Teya is a payment and software service provider, headquartered in London serving small, local businesses across Europe. Founded in 2019, we build easy to use, integrated tools that enable our members to accept payments and boost business performance.

At Teya we believe small, local businesses are the lifeblood of our communities.

We‚Äôre here because we don‚Äôt believe there‚Äôs a level playing field that gives small businesses with a fighting chance against the giants of the high street.

We‚Äôre here because we see banks and legacy service providers making things harder for them. We don‚Äôt think the best technology or the best service should be reserved for those with the biggest headquarters.

We‚Äôre here to fight for a future where small, local businesses can thrive, and to commit the same dedication they offer all of us.

Become a part of our story.

We‚Äôre looking for exceptional talent to join our mission. We offer a chance to create impact in a high-energy and connected culture, while benefiting from continuous learning opportunities, a supportive community which is proud to serve our mission, and comprehensive benefits.

Your Mission

The Customer Risk Monitoring team is responsible for implementing and maintaining the analytical intelligence that protects Teya and its customers from financial risks, including fraud, money laundering, and terrorism financing. Our goal is to minimise financial losses and risk exposure while supporting and maintaining our customers' trust and ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements.

We work closely with the Operations team to investigate suspicious activities and collaborate cross-functionally with Compliance, Risk, Platform Engineering and product leaders to build and continuously improve the intelligence powering our detection and monitoring systems.

Your Role Will Include


Develop and refine the intelligence used to detect financial crime, balancing efficacy with operational efficiency to reduce false positives, investigation time, and customer friction
Deliver actionable insights that directly improve detection rates, uncover new risk patterns, and inform prevention strategies
Act as a bridge between data and the business, collaborating closely with Operations, Compliance, Engineering, and Product teams to shape and prioritise analytical initiatives
Identify opportunities to improve and automate monitoring, escalate emerging threats, and continuously evolve our understanding of risk
Build and maintain clear and impactful dashboards, reports, and documentation to monitor key metrics, surface relevant trends, and drive data-informed decisions
Partner with data engineering to design and maintain scalable, reliable data models and ETLs that underpin both operational and strategic use cases
Help define and analyse fraud and AML KPIs, helping the business plan and course-correct with confidence
Promote a culture of data-driven decision-making across the organisation


Your Story

We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst with a strong analytical foundation and a passion for tackling complex, ambiguous problems in the financial risk domain.

Must-haves


2+ years of professional experience as a data analyst, preferably in fraud, AML, or financial risk monitoring
Solid understanding of statistical concepts and experience applying methods such as forecasting, time series analysis, A/B testing, or regression analysis
Experience in producing insights that led to measurable improvements, ideally in relevant domains such as fraud, AML detection, or operations
Advanced proficiency in SQL and experience working with large, complex, and sometimes messy datasets
Experience designing, building, and maintaining ETL pipelines or data models, ideally using tools like dbt
Proficiency in Python for data analysis, including data manipulation, visualisation, and basic modelling
Strong data storytelling and communication skills: you can translate complex data into clear, actionable recommendations for both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Experience working collaboratively with cross-functional partners, including Operations, Compliance, Engineering and Product
Self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, high-ambiguity environment and takes ownership of their work from start to finish


Nice-to-haves


Experience in acquiring services or the payments industry
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics)
Direct experience with problems such as AML scenario tuning, fraud rule optimisation, or detection intelligence design
Familiarity with regulatory or compliance-driven analytics environments
Fincrime certifications such as CAMS, ICA, or equivalent


The Perks


We trust you, so we offer flexible working hours, as long it suits both you and your team;
Health Insurance;
Meal Allowance;
25 days of Annual leave (+ Bank holidays);
Public Transportation Card;
Frequent team events & activities in the office and outside;
Office snacks every day;
Friendly, comfortable and informal office environment.


Teya is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

We are committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone regardless of race, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, religion, or background can thrive and do their best work. We believe that a diverse team leads to better ideas, stronger outcomes, and a more supportive workplace for all.

If you require any reasonable adjustments at any stage of the recruitment process whether for interviews, assessments, or other parts of the application‚Äîwe encourage you to let us know. We are committed to ensuring that every candidate has a fair and accessible experience with us.

Title: Personal Data Protection Analyst
Description:
ü§îWho are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




üöÄ Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

‚û° Quantitative Finance

‚û° Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

‚û° Operations and Finance

‚û° Transformation and Organization

‚û° Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of ‚Ç¨74.6 million.




üîéWe are looking for a Personal Data Protection Analyst.




MAIN TASKS:

Ensure project validation processes comply with Privacy by Design principles, and supporting Project Managers on their data protection activities.
Manage incoming external and internal requests in the outlook inbox CIB GDPR DESK, including Data Subject Rights Requests.
Publish periodic report and manage a dedicated SharePoint space.
Contribute to disseminate a culture of personal data protection in the company.
Develop and share best practices with the data protection network.










YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:

Technical Skills:

Full proficiency of MSOffice suite.
Proficiency of project management tools and methodologies




Languages:

English ‚Äì Fluent (mandatory).







üìçHybrid Model in Porto or Lisbon.







üöÄIf you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Join our Team as a Senior Data Analyst

We are looking for our new Senior Data Analyst in the Statistics and Analytics support team. This position is the first one based in our Porto Euronext office for this team, marking an exciting opportunity to establish a local presence and contribute directly to the team's growth and success.

Euronext is the leading pan-European exchange, connecting local economies to global markets. With a strong presence across Europe, Euronext offers a diverse range of services including trading, clearing, and listing. By leveraging cutting-edge technology, Euronext ensures efficient and secure trading experiences for our clients, providing them with a dynamic platform for trading equities, derivatives, commodities, and more.

Data plays a central role in our operations, driving informed decision-making to support our business lines and enhance the quality of our services. Join us and be part of a team that is shaping the future of financial markets through innovation and data-driven insights.

About the role:

With the other Data Analysts of the team, you will work on deriving custom insights from Euronext vast pool of historical market data and other data sources to support data driven decision of the business and sales teams, as well as operations and communication teams. You will work on automating the distribution of some of the reports to ease monitoring. You will contribute to the evolution of the technics and tools in place to answer the expectations for data self-service of our stakeholders. You will be a key contributor to the monthly billing calculation process and the related fee change activities. As part of the business team owning the market historical data database, you will also contribute as a data expert to the definition of the evolution requirements of this database in relation with other business teams, operation, and IT teams, and validate they proper implementation with the quality experts of the team to ensure incremental continuity of analytics capacity. Finally, you will have a local HR coordination role in Porto for future new joiners in the team there.

Key Responsibilities:

Work in close collaboration with our internal clients and other team members to deliver valuable insights from the available market data in the form of statistics, analysis, or more advanced studies.

Build a close relation with these internal clients and adopt a proactive posture by understanding their business challenges and proposing them data analytic services.

Contribute to answer external stakeholders' data requests.

Manage part of the billing process in collaboration with other team members and with the owning product teams.

Build and maintain automatic reporting systems that is controlled by the team and proactively sends data to our internal clients as well as external.

Build and maintain SSRS reports and PowerBI dashboards to enforce data self-service for recurring data requests and to help activity monitoring.

Active contribution to the continuous improvement of data analytics and reporting within the team

Local HR coordination of Datalab and analytics colleagues

This job is for you if you

are into financial data

are client oriented and have great communication capacity

are curious and have problem solving mindset

are rigorous, and put attention to details

have strong team spirit and collaboration skills

like to be proactive and propose ideas

have a continuous improvement mindset

are positive and enthusiastic

are very well organized and have a great ability to prioritize complex workload under pressure

are resilient and agile

have an innovation mindset keeping an eye on new practices and technologies (AI)

have a high capacity to assess and plan own activity

have high coordination capacity

Technically, you should know very well how to use:

SQL

Python / Pandas

Dataiku

PowerBI

We expect that you already have:

7 to 10 years of experience in data analysis in direct contact with business clients to inform their business decisions

Experience in financial data analysis

Experience in building self-service data tools

Excellent spoken and written level of English

Working with us means:

A vibrant international and diverse team where you'll collaborate with a network of 2,200+ talents across Europe, USA and Asia.

A collaborative and inclusive work environment that fosters professional growth with flexible career paths, learning and development opportunities

An agile, innovative and dynamic company where you can make an impact

Wellbeing programme, equal opportunities, work environment open to diversity in all its forms.

Apply by submitting a CV in English.


We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, gender, age, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or any other legally protected factor. We value the unique talents of all our people, who come from diverse backgrounds with different personal experiences and points of view and we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect.

Show more

  • are positive and enthusiastic

  • are very well organized and have a great ability to prioritize complex workload under pressure

  • are resilient and agile

  • have an innovation mindset keeping an eye on new practices and technologies (AI)

  • have a high capacity to assess and plan own activity

  • have high coordination capacity

Technically, you should know very well how to use:

  • SQL

  • Python / Pandas

  • Dataiku

  • PowerBI

We expect that you already have:

  • 7 to 10 years of experience in data analysis in direct contact with business clients to inform their business decisions

  • Experience in financial data analysis

  • Experience in building self-service data tools

  • Excellent spoken and written level of English

Working with us means:

  • A vibrant international and diverse team where you'll collaborate with a network of 2,200+ talents across Europe, USA and Asia.

  • A collaborative and inclusive work environment that fosters professional growth with flexible career paths, learning and development opportunities

  • An agile, innovative and dynamic company where you can make an impact

  • Wellbeing programme, equal opportunities, work environment open to diversity in all its forms.

Apply by submitting a CV in English.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, gender, age, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or any other legally protected factor. We value the unique talents of all our people, who come from diverse backgrounds with different personal experiences and points of view and we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect.

Title: Personal data protection analyst
HTML:
Transformation, adaptability and innovation are part of our DNA.

We're passionate about technology and we want to be part of your story.

Do we share the same passion? You've come to the right place, Smart.



At Smart consulting we are seeking a Personal Data Protection Analyst to take the lead on daily GDPR business-as-usual activities within the 1st Line of Defense (1LoD). The role involves supporting clients in achieving their compliance objectives with Privacy by Design principles and other data protection requirements, while closely interacting with the Central Data Office, the 1LoD SPOC network, and the 2LoD DPC/DPO network.


üéØ Key Responsibilities

  • Ensure project validation processes comply with Privacy by Design principles and support Project Managers on data protection activities;
  • Manage incoming external and internal requests through the GDPR service desk inbox, including Data Subject Rights Requests;
  • Publish periodic GDPR desk reports and manage a dedicated SharePoint space;
  • Contribute to spreading a strong culture of personal data protection across the organization;
  • Develop and share best practices with the broader data protection network.


‚úÖ Required Qualifications & Competencies

  • Minimum of 4 years of professional experience, including significant experience in Data Privacy / GDPR;
  • Solid academic or professional background in EU GDPR (mandatory);
  • Knowledge of other global privacy laws and regulations is considered a plus.


üíª Technical Skills

  • Full proficiency in the MS Office suite;
  • Familiarity with project management tools and methodologies.


üåç Language Skills

  • Fluent in English (B2‚ÄìC1 level).


ü§ù Soft Skills

  • Excellent writing, communication, and interpersonal skills;
  • Strong attention to detail with a high level of rigor and organization;
  • Ability to synthesize and simplify complex concepts for senior audiences;
  • Proactive mindset with the ability to leverage transversal networks;
  • Flexibility and adaptability in a constantly changing environment.


What will you find at SMART?


A dynamic, hard-working and co-operative team;

Career plan and defined objectives;

Initial and ongoing training ;

Follow-up meetings and performance appraisals;

Business bonuses;

Personal and family benefits;

Numerous events, partnerships and internal dynamic

Title: OESL IT Data Analytics & BI Lead
Description:
Company Description

About OESL

Original Equipment Solutions (OESL) is emerging as a stand-alone global leader in the automotive sector, with over 17,000 employees and ‚Ç¨2 billion in annual sales. Operating in 15 countries across 35 locations, including technology centers, OESL will build on Continental‚Äôs rich legacy to deliver high-quality parts to major OEMs and commercial vehicle customers worldwide.

About OESL IT

OESL IT is at the forefront of our transformation, being built from the ground up to be agile, forward-thinking, and strategic. As we shape the future of OESL, our IT team will play a pivotal role as a strategic advisory partner, driving digital capabilities and enabling business success across the organization.

Why Join OESL IT?


Greater Impact: Take part in shaping the future of a newly formed, dynamic IT organization, with the opportunity to bring ideas to life and reap significant professional rewards.
Growth and Innovation: Work in a fast-moving, cloud-based infrastructure and application environment that encourages innovation and offers opportunities for continuous growth and expanding your skill set.
Creative Space: Experience the entrepreneurial spirit of a start-up culture within a global organization, enjoying both the creative freedom and the responsibility needed to thrive in modern working environments.
Tight-Knit Team: Join a highly collaborative team where individuals have the power to shape their work, make meaningful contributions, and drive collective success.


Job Description

We are seeking a dynamic Team Lead to guide a distributed team of data analysts in delivering impactful business intelligence solutions. You will champion modern leadership practices, fostering collaboration, autonomy, and continuous development across multiple locations. In this role, you‚Äôll oversee the creation of data models and analytical reports that support a variety of business functions. You‚Äôll work closely with our business stakeholders, translating complex data into actionable insights. The ideal candidate combines technical expertise with a people-first mindset and thrives in a fast-paced, global environment. Join us to shape the future of data-driven decision-making.

Qualifications

Leadership:


Proven experience in leading and mentoring data analysis teams, fostering a collaborative and high-performance work environment.
Strong ability to prioritize tasks, delegate responsibilities effectively, and ensure timely delivery of high-quality analytical reports and data models.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations for both technical and non-technical audiences.


Additionally, you bring experience in the following areas:


Data Driven Applications: Experience with data analysis, report creation and business intelligence
Data Governance & Security: Familiarity with central regulations (e.g. GDPR) and common data governance approaches.
Cost Optimization: Ability to manage platform related budgets and optimize resource use effectively.
Agile and DevOps: Knowledge of collaborative workflows and modern deployment practices.
Project Management: Experience in leading projects for data driven applications from design to implementation and steering of external suppliers.


Additional Information

What we offer?


Compensation package - 14th salaries plus performance bonus
Lunch Allowance - in line with local regulation
Flexibility - Flexible schedule, hybrid work.
Home-Office - Employees received 1,00‚Ç¨ net for each Home-Office day, paid monthly.
Work Abroad - Possibility to work abroad within the EU for 20+20 days per year (two different countries).
Vacation days - 22 days per year + 3 extra days the following year (considering absenteeism). Seniority days added starting from 3 years in the company.
Referral Bonus - A bonus of 500‚Ç¨ or 750‚Ç¨ (depending on the seniority of the candidate) is paid for each referral.


Ready to drive with Continental? Take the first step and fill in the online application.

Title: Model Validation Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Natixis in Portugal is a Centre of Expertise with the mission to transform traditional banking by developing solutions for Groupe BPCE‚Äôs businesses, operations and work culture worldwide, driven by an innovation mindset, in a financial tech ecosystem.

Natixis in Portugal is part of the Global Financial Services division, where it applies technology for the development of financial expertise in its two global business lines ‚Äì Corporate & Investment Banking and Asset & Wealth Management ‚Äì and, transversally, for Groupe BPCE entities.

The Centre of Expertise, based in Porto, currently has more than 2700 employees from 40 nationalities, organised in three main departments: Information Technology, Banking Support Activities and Compliance. These teams work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting and creating value for all the business lines and platforms of the group. Natixis in Portugal is the International Competence Centre (with an export orientation) which employs the largest number of people in the Porto district. The project in Porto is one of the biggest investments in Human Resources ever made by Groupe BPCE worldwide.

A disruptive mindset and a culture of proximity and agility identify Natixis Team and reflect the company's mission to transform traditional banking at a global scale: a perfect match in the Portuguese dynamics and entrepreneurial ecosystem.

In 2025, Top Employers Institute has awarded Natixis in Portugal the Top Employer Portugal accreditation for the third time. This certification recognizes excellence in people practices, following the example of its head office, in France, who was certified Top Employer France for the nineth year in a row.

Job Description

Experienced Quantitative Analyst to join the CUSO Model Validation team within Model Risk Management (MRM). The MRM Group within the Risk Department (Model Risk & Risk Governance) is responsible for Model Validation, Model Risk Assessment, and Model Risk Management for Natixis‚Äô Group.

He/she/they will be responsible for conducting independent validation of various types of models used across the company to assess and quantify model risk.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities


The Model Risk Validator will be coordinating and conducting model validation processes and monitoring in adherence with internal policies, procedures, and regulatory guidelines.
This role will work cross-functionally within the organization including collaboration with business lines as well as key integral support units.
The validation work encompasses evaluating the models based on various aspects including model data, parameters, design and methodology, implementation, and model documentation.
The Model Risk Validator will be responsible to organize the overall validation process for each topic and to present the outcome of the validations to Committees and to track the remediation that might arise from this work.


Qualifications


Masters or PhD in economics, statistics, finance, physics, mathematics, or other quantitative fields.
Minimum 2/3 years of experience in model validation, model development, quantitative research, or quantitative audit.
Fluency in English (mandatory)
Experience with developing or validating models - Pricing models and Risk models (Stress Testing models, IMM/EEPE and IMA models).
Effective written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to interact and work closely with business stakeholders at all levels of seniority.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Ability to effectively handle a fast-paced environment and successfully meet established deadline requirements.
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office
Advanced Programming skills (C/C+, C#, Python, SQL, VBA, R, MATLAB‚Ä¶)


We will only consider English Cv's.

Additional Information

#MuchMoreThanJustAJob

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. After grabbing a cup of coffee and fresh fruit, pick up your laptop and choose your spot for the day. It's going to be a busy one: French class before lunch and, just after, quick medical appointment at Natixis doctor's office.

Lunch break. Outside in the big terrace (look at your crops at the Urban Garden; ready to harvest!) or, if you feel like stretching your legs, walk downtown to grab lunch.

Back inside. Quick sprint review (working together anywhere means virtual happy birthday to that colleague in Paris that just turned 35). The afternoon went flying (tasks, reports, calls, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: just one PlayStation game or the final match for that ping-pong tournament.

Tomorrow, you complete that certified technical training and the day after, you will work from home, taking advantage to finally do that online course on Udemy. Once you are done with your tasks for the day, you can visit the office for a board games session or show up at the rehearsal of one of Natixis bands. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to surf some waves or join them in a football match.

Title: SQL Developer
Description:
üöÄ Are you the NEXT SQL/Grafana Developer? üöÄ




HYBRID: 2X WEEK ONSITE - Porto




What will you do?




Design Grafana dashboards corresponding to specifications, including potentially complex SQL requests, targeting the database (ClickHouse) loaded with OEG/MDG messages. Some SQL requests have time-series specificities (windowing‚Ä¶). Give insights on inserted data to enable optimized requests.
The delivery of the Grafana dashboards should be repeatable in the various environments automatically.
‚Ä¢Establish with testers common QA plan allowing clear, accurate, regular reporting through KPI‚Äôs related to the testing activities (design, execution, automation, regression). Deliver Unit Tests.

Context:

Model driven development, using code generation through Java, XSL or Python for the database schema
The delivery of software is made as Docker or RPM depending on the production environment, configuration is delivered through Ansible or AWS parameters, with CloudFormation typically for AWS.




Deliverables:




Grafana dashboards, with complex / time-series oriented SQL request
SQL code for new functionalities and tests, following coding standards, state of the art practices
Clear and accurate documentation relative to implemented code
Actively contribute to continuous code improvement
Automated test suites, built around tests frameworks (Unit Test part)
Deliveries reports
Context: Java, Python, Git, Jenkins (Groovy), JIRA, tests automated using Gherkin, AWS
Ability to deliver Python and/or Java code accompanying the dashboards is a plus, for example to enable ‚Äúscreenshots‚Äù of the Grafana dashboard in emails.







What we offer you:

A dynamic and professional team;
The opportunity to participate in local or international projects;
Personalized support;
A training plan tailored to your needs;
Guidance for career progression and development;
The opportunity to be part of a rapidly growing team.




You must be a resident in Portugal and fluent in English!




Send your CV to your@nextengineering.pt with the reference PLI or contact me via DM.

Title: Senior Technical and Reporting Analyst
Description:
Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins laboratories work with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic, and labelling is accurate.



Eurofins is dedicated to delivering testing services that contribute to the health and safety of society and the planet, and to its corporate responsibility to protect the environment and ensure diversity, equity, and inclusion across the entire network of Eurofins companies.





Job Description



Your main responsibilities will be:



Be part of digital transformation of ESG and Operations KPI Reporting. Design, build and configure workflows and solutions within the Microsoft Universe (focus on SharePoint, Power Platform (Dataverse, Power Automate, Power BI, Power Apps), Azure (Entra ID, DevOps, Data Lake)),
Build appropriate and useful reporting deliverables,
Existing tool improvements and creation of new reporting solutions,
Database (MS Dataverse, SQL & MS Access) setup, administration, maintenance and troubleshooting to improve reporting processes & data validation,
Further automation of the new and existing processes,
Participate, manage and own various projects to create new reporting solutions, tools & improvements,
Effective cooperation and communication with broad range of internal stakeholders.


Qualifications



What are we expecting:



Experience with the setup, administration and maintenance of Microsoft Cloud Solutions. Focus on SharePoint Online, Power Platform (Dataverse, Power Automate, Power BI, Power Apps) and Azure (Entra ID, DevOps, Data Lake, etc.)
Previous experience in a similar role, including project management, data analysis, data science, tool creation in corporate environment.
Familiarity with Agile methodologies.
Database content analysis ability.
Advanced English.
Good overall computer skills (especially MS Office, including Excel and Access).
Good knowledge of SQL, knowledge of VBA and Python would be an asset (any general purpose object oriented programing languages would be a significant plus).
Strong analytical and logical thinking, good communication skills.

What we offer:



Very attractive, multicultural and friendly project environment in fast growing international company.
Possibility to grow and make the next step in your professional career and self-development.
Benefits - private health insurance, annual bonus, hybrid work model, flexible working hours.
Positive work atmosphere.


Additional Information



We support your development! Do you feel you don‚Äôt match 100% of the requirements? Don‚Äôt hesitate to apply anyway! Eurofins companies are committed to supporting your career development.



We‚ÄØembrace‚ÄØdiversity!‚ÄØThe Eurofins network of companies believes in strength and innovation through diversity, being an‚ÄØEqual Opportunity Employer. We prohibit discrimination against employees or applications based on gender identity and/or expression, race, nationality, age, religion, sexual orientation, disability, and everything else that makes employees of Eurofins companies unique.



Sustainability matters to us!‚ÄØ‚ÄØWe are well on our way to achieving our objective of carbon neutrality by 2025, through a combination of emission reduction and compensation initiatives. We encourage our laboratory leaders to make sustainable changes at their local level, and in addition to their initiatives we count on our dedicated carbon reduction team to help us to achieve this goal!



Find out more in our career page:‚ÄØhttps://careers.eurofins.com/



Company description:‚ÄØEurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins laboratories work with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic and labelling is accurate.



The Eurofins network of companies believes that it is a global leader in food, environment, pharmaceutical and cosmetic product testing and in discovery pharmacology, forensics, advanced material sciences and agroscience contract research services. It is also one of the market leaders in certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, and in the support of clinical studies, as well as in biopharma contract development and manufacturing. It also has a rapidly developing presence in highly specialised and molecular clinical diagnostic testing and in-vitro diagnostic products.



In over 35 years, Eurofins has grown from one laboratory in Nantes, France to ca. 62,000 staff across a decentralised and entrepreneurial network of more than 900 laboratories in 62 countries. Eurofins companies offer a portfolio of over 200,000 analytical methods to evaluate the safety, identity, composition, authenticity, origin, traceability and purity of biological substances and products.



In 2023, Eurofins generated total revenues of EUR 6,515 million, and has been among the best performing stocks in Europe over the past 20 years.

Title: Data Engineer (Hybrid @Porto)
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Engineer

Seniority: 6+

Type of position: Hybrid (2x/week at Porto Office)




The amazing you, will have:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field;
6+ years of experience as a Data Engineer;
Expertise on end-to-end Data Pipeline Development, ETL processes and Alteryx;
Knowledge in Data Mesh concepts (Starburst, Trino);
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala;
Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases;
Experience with Big Data technologies such as Databricks, Hadoop, Apache Spark, Kafka;
Availability for a hybrid regime at Porto (Portugal);
Fluency in English is mandatory.




To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you¬¥ll have (plus):

French AND/OR Portuguese fluency.







Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!




Who are we?




Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Part time: Online Data Analyst - Portuguese Speaker
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.




A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.




Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!




Qualification path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in Portuguese language
Being a resident in Portugal for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Portugal
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

Show more

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

Title: Data Engineer (M/F/D)
HTML:
About us

Dorel Juvenile is the world's leading juvenile products company. Our products are available in more than 100 countries. We help families live carefree lives by providing them with juvenile products that rank highest in consumer reviews. That's what sets our products apart; durable, helpful, and caring.


Your Mission

We are seeking a versatile Data Engineer to join our Data & Analytics team. This role is critical in supporting our migration to a new data stack (Talend + Snowflake + Power BI). The ideal profile combines strong ETL, SQL and BI skills with a forward-looking mindset toward DataOps and Data Governance.

You will play a key role in ensuring data integrity, performance, and availability ‚Äî and help us shape the future for becoming a more data-driven organization.


Your Main Tasks

  • Design, build, and maintain data pipelines and ETL/ELT processes in Talend and Snowflake;
  • Develop and optimize data models and SQL queries to support business-critical reporting;
  • Deliver and maintain Power BI datasets, reports, and dashboards, ensuring accuracy and reliability;
  • Partner with business teams to translate requirements into robust data solutions;
  • Following world-wide known best practices, ensure data quality, integrity, and performance across the data lifecycle;
  • Contribute to the implementation of DataOps practices;
  • Support the adoption of data cataloging, lineage, and governance practices;
  • Collaborate closely with functional analysts, development and infrastructure teams, and business stakeholders in an Agile/Scrum environment.


Your Profile

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field (or equivalent experience);
  • 2-3 years of proven experience;
  • Experience with SQL (query optimization, modeling) and Power BI (data modeling, DAX, deployment);
  • Strong understanding of data warehouse design (Inmon/Kimball methodologies);
  • Hands-on experience with ETL/ELT tools (Talend preferred);
  • Familiarity with Snowflake or other modern cloud data warehouses;
  • Basic knowledge of Agile methodologies (Scrum);
  • Strong problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills to collaborate effectively with technical and business stakeholders;
  • Self-driven with the ability to work independently and as part of a team;
  • Fluent English is mandatory.


Nice to Have:

  • Familiarity with data cataloging & lineage tools (e.g., Amundsen, OpenMetadata, Alation, Purview);
  • Experience with project management tools (e.g., Monday.com, Jira).



Why Join Us?

  • Opportunity to work on a high-impact data warehouse migration project;
  • Contribute to the modernization of our Data & Analytics landscape;
  • Play a key role in building DataOps maturity (lineage, cataloging, governance);
  • Collaborate with a motivated team and business stakeholders on mission-critical projects;
  • Frequently deliver value to business teams (Agile deliveries), as a way of supporting their decision-making processes on critical business decisions.


Are you ready to grow with us?

The people behind our products and brands make Dorel Juvenile an even stronger company. We are extending our leading market position and believe team spirit, personal drive, and accountability can make a real difference in achieving sustainable growth. This is essential for our future. We invite you to grow with us!

Do you want to be part of the growth of the next generation? Dorel needs your contribution! Send your resume in English.

Only the candidates with the pretended profile will be contacted in two weeks‚Äô time.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations.

This project is part of the business investment banking and financial services area, and currently has its technological hub in Porto and is working on the development of innovative solutions and support for all operations related to the business.

We are looking for a Data Engineer to work in this project in Porto (Hybrid).

Requirements


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role (3+ years).
Proficient in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Extract, transform, and load (ETL) data using SQL, Stambia (or other ETL tools) to ensure data quality and integrity.
Experience with Oracle Exadata database is a big plus.
Experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Proficiency in Power BI for data visualization and reporting is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a commitment to rigor and participation in team rituals.
Excellent communication skills in French (C1 level required) and English (B2 level required).
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment, with a strong inclination towards technical and functional aspects of data management.


Responsibilities


Analyze and interpret complex data sets to provide actionable insights and support business objectives.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and provide analytical support.
Extract, transform, and load (ETL) data using SQL, Stambia, and Oracle Exadata (or other ETL tools) to ensure data quality and integrity.
Assist in the design and implementation of data models and structures to support reporting and analysis.
Participate in continuous improvement initiatives for data processes and analytics methodologies, including the coordination of actions for ongoing operational tasks (RUN).
Handle functional incidents and contribute to technical developments and system enhancements.
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in both French and English.


What can you expect from us?


Health insurance;
A personalized training plan, with a budget to spend on the training and technical books you find necessary;
Constant feedback so you can grow professionally;
Remote onboarding process;
Team events every semester so you can live new adventures;
Culture of proximity and transparency. Your ideas and needs are heard and valued by us!


Apply

If the above sounds like the kind of job opportunity you would want to get involved with, then please do not hesitate to apply here. You can also explore our content about the job market here.
