Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company and their main mission is to delivery value through the knowledge. We enable companies to meet the chalenges of digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility and agility. We are more than 500 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid.




DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:

DECSKILL TALENT, through which we provide our clients with an extension to their IT teams;




DECSKILL BOOST, through which we provide our client with software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to their needs, at the desired speed;




DECSKILL CONNECT, through which we provide our client with consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of information technology infrastructures.




Our practice results in the creation of value for our customers, either by delivering qualified and value-added services, or through highly qualified and motivated professionals, as well as technology solutions that allow us to operate and transform the business of our customers.




We are searching for a looking for Data Engineer!




Responsibilities:

Leverage large volumes of data from internal sources.
Develop, maintain, and support data pipelines.
Understand and be the point of contact for the business and assess its needs.
Ensure architecture meets business requirements.
Recommend ways to efficiently provide quality data and added value.
Communicate technical information to non-technical stakeholders, including data analysts, product managers, and business leaders.
Prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously, meeting deadlines and delivering high-quality results.




Requirements:

Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields.
3+ years of experience in data engineering, with a strong background in data architecture.
Availability to work in the hybrid model or in person in the Lisbon or Porto office.
Professional experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI.
Professional experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas).
Proficiency in SQL.
Ability to analysze, synthetize and simplify.
Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus.
Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus.
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams,
Strong organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize multiple projects and meet deadlines
Good knowledge of English.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúCA/ Data Engineer‚Äù.




Thank You! üòä




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Advanced Analytics Team Lead (Fashion)
Description:
Who We Are

We are Metyis, a forward-thinking, global company that develops and delivers solutions around Big Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing and Design and provides Advisory services. We have offices in 15 locations with a talent pool of 1000+ employees and more than 50 nationalities, dedicated to creating long-lasting impact and growth for our business partners and clients.

Together with HUGO BOSS, our esteemed business partner, we have embarked on a joint venture and created the HUGO BOSS Digital Campus, dedicated to increasing the data analytics, eCommerce and technology capabilities of the company and boosting digital sales. The HUGO BOSS Digital Campus employees will help create a state-of-the-art data architecture infrastructure, advanced business analytics, and the development and enhancement of HUGO BOSS‚Äô eCommerce platform and services.

This collaborative environment will provide the capabilities required for HUGO BOSS to maximise data usage and support its growth trajectory towards becoming the leading premium tech-driven fashion platform worldwide.

What We Offer


Interact with senior stakeholders at our clients on regular basis to drive their business towards impactful change.
Become the go-to person for end-to-end data handling, management, and analytics processes.‚ÄØ
Lead your team in creating the pipeline for Data management, data visualization, and analytics products, including automated services, and APIs.
Working with Data Scientists to take data throughout its lifecycle - acquisition, exploration, data cleaning, integration, analysis, interpretation, and visualization.‚ÄØ
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.



What You Will Do


Interact with senior stakeholders at our clients on regular basis to drive their business towards impactful change.
Become the go-to person for end-to-end data handling, management, and analytics processes.‚ÄØ
Lead your team in creating the pipeline for Data management, data visualization, and analytics products, including automated services, and APIs.
Working with Data Scientists to take data throughout its lifecycle - acquisition, exploration, data cleaning, integration, analysis, interpretation, and visualization.‚ÄØ
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.



What You Will Bring


5+ years of experience in data science or advanced analytics, with at least 2 years in a leadership or managerial role.
Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Proven track record of delivering impactful data science solutions in a retail, wholesale, or omnichannel environment.
Strong technical foundation in Python, PySpark, and ML libraries (e.g. scikit-learn, XGBoost, LightGBM), with hands-on experience in cloud platforms like Azure or AWS.
Experience with MLOps tools such as MLflow and Git, and familiarity with data pipeline orchestration in Databricks or similar environments.
Deep understanding of statistical methods and experimental design (e.g. A/B testing, hypothesis testing).
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to translate complex technical concepts into business value.
Fluency in English (written and spoken).



Nice to Have:


Experience in the fashion industry.
Background in international, consultancy, or start-up environments.
Familiarity with agile methodologies and cross-functional team collaboration.



In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Senior Data Engineer

Type of position: Hybrid (2x/week) in Porto




The amazing you, will have:




Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field;
5+ years of experience as Data Engineer;
Experience with working on real-time data and streaming applications (Mandatory)
Experience with data engineering and using programming languages, including Java, Scala, or Python (Mandatory)
Experience with distributed data and computing tools, including Kafka, Nifi, Spark, Hadoop, Hive, or Flink (Mandatory)
Pipeline Creation with Stream Processing tools;
Availability for a hybrid regime at Porto (Portugal);
Fluency in English is a (Mandatory, at least B2)




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!




Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Data Engineer to join an innovative data-driven team. This role offers the opportunity to design and implement modern data solutions, working with large-scale systems and cutting-edge AWS technologies.




What you will be doing

Designing and developing pipelines using Python, PySpark, and SQL
Using GitLab as the version control system
Managing storage of raw and processed data in AWS S3
Implementing and orchestrating workflows with Apache Airflow (MWAA)
Leveraging Apache Iceberg (or similar) for data lake management
Creating and maintaining data catalogues with AWS Glue Catalogue
Running interactive queries using AWS Athena
Applying data modelling techniques to support analytics and reporting requirements




What we are looking for

Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field (preferred)
5+ years of experience in Data Engineering
Strong expertise in Python, PySpark, SQL, and the AWS data ecosystem
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Experience with GitHub (or GitLab) for version control
Nice-to-have: Terraform and CI/CD pipeline experience

Title: Business & Market Analyst
Description:
As a Business and Market Analyst at K√∂rber Business Area Supply Chain, you will play a key role in providing data-driven insights and business intelligence. Your responsibilities will include developing and maintaining performance metrics, analysing market trends, and providing actionable recommendations to support leadership in achieving strategic goals and driving business growth.



You will conduct research and analysis of market trends, competitor strategies, customer behavior, and industry developments.
You will identify strategic growth and efficiency opportunities through data-driven analysis.
You will gather and synthesize data from multiple sources, including market research, competitor intelligence, and internal datasets, to identify patterns and trends.
You will develop clear and compelling reports, presentations, and dashboards to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
You will provide actionable insights that directly support business decisions in product development, marketing strategies, and long-term planning.
You will continuously monitor industry news, market conditions, and competitor activities to anticipate opportunities and threats.
You will collaborate with cross-functional teams in marketing, sales, product development, and beyond to ensure alignment with market intelligence insights.
You will use data visualization tools to translate complex information into understandable and impactful formats.
You will maintain and update databases to ensure relevant and accurate market intelligence is always accessible.
You have a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, or a related field.
You have 5‚Äì10 years of professional experience in market research, business analysis, or a related field.
You have extensive experience with data analysis tools, methodologies, and visualization software.
You have strong numerical and analytical skills, with the ability to work confidently with figures, statistics, and mathematical concepts.
You have a proven ability to interpret complex data and translate it into meaningful insights and recommendations.
You have excellent written and verbal communication skills, presenting complex ideas clearly and persuasively.
You have a solid understanding of business principles, market dynamics, and competitive landscapes.
You have experience working in an industrial, project-based environment (preferred).
You are comfortable working across international, cross-functional teams.
You are familiar with warehouse automation and the parcel industry (a strong advantage).
You are fluent in English; German is a plus.



At the heart of every solution, every success, is a team of dedicated professionals willing to help each other while bringing creativity and energy to every project. K√∂rber Supply Chain is the embodiment of this. Home to hundreds of the best minds in the industry, spanning technology for warehousing, logistics, transportation, and more, you‚Äôll work with some of the biggest brands in the world and empower smaller players to disrupt the market‚Äîmaybe even change the world. Turn your passion into a fulfilling career with K√∂rber Supply Chain!



Daily fresh fruit, bread and yogurt
Employee Assistance Program
Mobile work
Flexible time schedule
Personal Hazards Insurance
Active protocols with external partners



For questions please contact us via jobs@koerber.com. We work with selected partners and therefore ask recruitment consultancies to refrain from contacting us by mail or telephone. Please apply exclusively via the ‚ÄúApply now‚Äù button.

We value diversity and therefore welcome all applicants - regardless of gender, nationality, ethnic or social origin, religion/belief, disability, age, sexual orientation and identity, and any other protected status.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
A Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!




Our mission is to be a meaningful part of our people's careers. As we grow, so does our determination to offer the best experience to our employees and clients ‚Äî and that‚Äôs exactly what drives us. We are a Portuguese technology consulting company with offices in Lisbon, Porto and √ìbidos, and representations in Brazil and Tunisia. We have over 12 years of market expertise, and today we are a universe of around 400 people working on-site, remotely or in hybrid mode in projects across 20+ countries.




We believe that great people make successful companies, and that‚Äôs why we stand for the appreciation, recognition and growth of our professionals.




We don‚Äôt want to be just another line on your CV ‚Äî we want you to live a Lifetime Experience with us. We invest in training and certifications that confirm your real progression, in promoting a healthy work-life balance, and in offering benefits that impact your personal life and career.




#welcometoyourfuture







What we‚Äôre looking for:




Experience with AWS services, particularly Step Functions and Glue Jobs
Solid knowledge of ETL tools and frameworks, with background in Talend and Spark (migration project experience is a plus)
Strong interest in application redesign and data pipeline optimization
Professional-level English (mandatory)







Being Affinity




‚Ä¢ #Affinity ‚Äì Creating close and empathetic relationships with colleagues, clients and candidates (and not just with technologies, languages and platforms). Team spirit and good vibes;

‚Ä¢ #Ambition ‚Äì Wanting to do more and better. A drive to exceed expectations and evolve personally and professionally;

‚Ä¢ #Action ‚Äì Energy to make things happen. Showing proactiveness and initiative;

‚Ä¢ #Assertiveness ‚Äì Transparent and honest communication, always with constructive feedback.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Transformation, adaptability and innovation are part of our DNA.

We're passionate about technology and we want to be part of your story.

Do we share the same passion? You've come to the right place, Smart.




As a Personal Data Protection Analyst, you will play a key role in ensuring that daily GDPR business-as-usual activities are executed within the 1st Line of Defense (1LoD). You will support CIB clients in achieving compliance with Privacy by Design principles and other data protection requirements, working closely with the CIB Central Data Office, the SPOC network (1LoD), and the DPC/DPO network (2LoD).

This role requires both strong technical expertise in data privacy and GDPR as well as excellent communication and organizational skills, as you will interact with diverse stakeholders across the organization.




Key Responsibilities

Ensure CIB project validation processes comply with Privacy by Design principles, supporting Project Managers in data protection activities.
Manage internal and external requests in the CIB GDPR DESK inbox, including Data Subject Rights Requests.
Prepare and publish the CIB GDPR DESK periodic report and maintain a dedicated SharePoint space.
Contribute to the dissemination of a culture of personal data protection within CIB.
Develop and share best practices with the data protection network.




Required Competencies

Minimum 5 years of experience in data privacy, including significant hands-on work with EU GDPR.
Academic background or certification related to EU GDPR (mandatory).
Knowledge of other global privacy laws and regulations is a strong plus.




Technical Skills

Full proficiency with the MS Office Suite.
Proficiency with project management tools and methodologies.




Language Skills

Fluent English (C1‚ÄìC2), both written and spoken.




Soft Skills

Excellent writing, communication, and interpersonal skills.
Strong attention to detail, with a high sense of rigor and organization.
Ability to synthesize and simplify complex concepts for senior stakeholders.
Proactive mindset, able to leverage transversal networks.
High adaptability and ability to work in a changing environment.




What will you find at SMART?




A dynamic, hard-working and co-operative team;

Career plan and defined objectives;

Initial and ongoing training ;

Follow-up meetings and performance appraisals;

Business bonuses;

Personal and family benefits;

Numerous events, partnerships and internal dynamics;

Description:

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation and Professional Pride. Do you identify with these values?

Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity," Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

By developing projects in the most diverse industries ‚Äì Banking, Telecommunications, Health, Retail, Energy, Insurance or Aviation - we analyze data, transforming it into knowledge for our clients, allowing them to adopt the best decision-making for their respective organizations and businesses.




We seek a Data Analyst willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team.

Hybrid working mode with base in Porto.




Main Tasks:

‚Ä¢ Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.

‚Ä¢ Creative descriptive, predictive, and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholder‚Äôs decision making.

‚Ä¢ Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining.




Technical Skills:

‚Ä¢ Data knowledge / Data processing / Data quality / IT Development

‚Ä¢ Database Management (SQL)

‚Ä¢ Methodologies (Agile)

‚Ä¢ Office Pack (MS Excel)

‚Ä¢ Power BI / Tableau




Language Skills:

‚Ä¢ English - Expert

‚Ä¢ French - Expert




Soft Skills:

‚Ä¢ IT - Business/IT relationship

‚Ä¢ Analytical Ability

‚Ä¢ Data Intelligence, Research and Quant Analytics

‚Ä¢ Ability to understand, explain and support change

‚Ä¢ Ability to collaborate/Teamwork

‚Ä¢ Attention to detail/rigor




If you believe in this match as much as we do, send your CV to leonor.carvalho@closer.pt and reach the closest side of life.




Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics.

Title: Data Analyst ‚Äì Alteryx
Description:
Welcome to Felps Lisboa




üëã A community of passionate experts who combine their skills to take your company to higher levels of excellence. üöÄ




üîí Our expertise: The Felps Group is an alliance of ‚ÄòPure Players‚Äô made up of four distinct squads: Telecoms, IT, Cybersecurity and Change Management. Each squad is led by a Captain who is a specialist in that particular area. The captains coach the consultants throughout their careers in the Felps Group, guiding them in their choice of missions and the stages of their training. Our aim is to facilitate the growth and development of our consultants, enabling them to take their careers to the next level.




üåê Our approach: In our model, consultants are the central focus, which is why we dedicate all our attention to them. The team, led by the Captain and Associate Director, provides expert support to ensure the consultants receive the highest level of guidance. Drawing on our extensive experience, we are able to deliver personalized, comprehensive, and impactful assistance tailored to their needs.




üëâüèº Felps Group believes in the power of diversity and inclusion. We are committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all employees feel respected, supported and encouraged to contribute to the company.

As a member of our team, you will be part of a culture that celebrates diversity in all its forms, be it age, gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, skills, socio-economic background or any other personal characteristic. We pride ourselves on our commitment to equal opportunities and justice.

We encourage applications from all qualified candidates, including people with disabilities who are accredited by DGERT/IEFP. We are committed to providing an inclusive work environment and accommodation to support the integration of all our employees. If you have any specific accessibility requirements during the recruitment process, please let us know and we will do our best to support you.




We are looking for a skilled Data Analyst specialized in Alteryx, experienced in handling date/time datasets (PDATEN), and capable of transforming complex data into actionable insights to support strategic decision-making.

Ensure compliance with data governance and security standards.

Fluency in English is mandatory; French is highly valued.

Transform data into actionable insights and join our Felps Lisboa team today!

Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description:
Why Choose TD SYNNEX:

TD SYNNEX is a Fortune 100 company with over $58 billion in revenue (NYSE: SNX), recognized as one of the world‚Äôs leading technology distributors and solutions aggregators. With a diverse team of 24,000 employees operating across more than 100 countries, we support over 150,000 customers in maximizing the value of their technology investments, driving business results, and unlocking growth opportunities. TD SYNNEX is a certified Great Place to Work, celebrated for our dynamic culture and comprehensive benefits. Our diverse workforce is our greatest strength, fostering success and inclusivity.

About the role:

We‚Äôre looking for a highly analytical and business-oriented Business Intelligence Analyst to join our Datech Division. You‚Äôll play a key role in identifying market opportunities and translating them into actionable insights that drive sales performance across Europe. This role works closely with Business Managers and Sales teams to develop campaigns, set targets, and measure impact.

Datech is a specialized business unit within TD SYNNEX, focused on delivering design software solutions for industries such as architecture, engineering, construction, manufacturing, and media. It acts as a global distributor and solution aggregator, partnering with leading vendors like Autodesk, Trimble or Unity to support digital transformation through value-added services, technical enablement, and strategic business development

Key Responsibilities:


Analyze market potential and penetration to support strategic decision-making.
Integrate internal and external data to assess customer lifecycle and value.
Identify opportunities to retain, develop, and acquire high-value customers.
Design intuitive reporting methodologies and perform ad-hoc market analysis.
Collaborate with Sales and Product Marketing to align efforts with revenue goals.
Support campaign execution through customer segmentation and targeting.
Measure and report on campaign effectiveness and sales impact.
Maintain and update customer profiling and contact data.
Work with vendor partners to validate campaign offerings and customer lists.
Ensure consistent use of data sources, methodologies, and modeling assumptions.


What we're kindly looking for:


3+ years of experience in data mining, BI analysis, or reporting.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree required; IT industry knowledge is a plus.
Strong analytical mindset with attention to detail and business acumen.
Experience with tools like Tableau or Power BI is desirable.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities.
Comfortable collaborating across departments and with external partners.
Results-driven and proactive in identifying growth opportunities.
Fluent in English; additional European languages are a plus.
Able to negotiate skillfully, promote/sell ideas persuasively, and close transactions with mutually beneficial results.


What We Offer you:


Comprehensive private health and life insurance to keep you covered.
Hybrid work model.
Tailored salary perks.
Access to a comprehensive learning platform to support your professional growth.
A multicultural and diverse environment with global career opportunities.
Certified Great Place to Work with a strong focus on work-life balance.


Please note that benefits may vary depending on the position and the country.

Key Skills

What‚Äôs In It For You?


Elective Benefits: Our programs are tailored to your country to best accommodate your lifestyle.
Grow Your Career: Accelerate your path to success (and keep up with the future) with formal programs on leadership and professional development, and many more on-demand courses.
Elevate Your Personal Well-Being: Boost your financial, physical, and mental well-being through seminars, events, and our global Life Empowerment Assistance Program.
Diversity, Equity & Inclusion: It‚Äôs not just a phrase to us; valuing every voice is how we succeed. Join us in celebrating our global diversity through inclusive education, meaningful peer-to-peer conversations, and equitable growth and development opportunities.
Make the Most of our Global Organization: Network with other new co-workers within your first 30 days through our onboarding program.
Connect with Your Community: Participate in internal, peer-led inclusive communities and activities, including business resource groups, local volunteering events, and more environmental and social initiatives.


Don‚Äôt meet every single requirement? Apply anyway.

At TD SYNNEX, we‚Äôre proud to be recognized as a great place to work and a leader in the promotion and practice of diversity, equity and inclusion. If you‚Äôre excited about working for our company and believe you‚Äôre a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply. You may be exactly the person we‚Äôre looking for!


Show more

  • Make the Most of our Global Organization: Network with other new co-workers within your first 30 days through our onboarding program.
  • Connect with Your Community: Participate in internal, peer-led inclusive communities and activities, including business resource groups, local volunteering events, and more environmental and social initiatives.

Don‚Äôt meet every single requirement? Apply anyway.

At TD SYNNEX, we‚Äôre proud to be recognized as a great place to work and a leader in the promotion and practice of diversity, equity and inclusion. If you‚Äôre excited about working for our company and believe you‚Äôre a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply. You may be exactly the person we‚Äôre looking for!

Title: Risk Data Analyst - Fincrime & Fraud Monitoring
Description:
Hello! We're Teya.

Teya is a payment and software service provider, headquartered in London serving small, local businesses across Europe. Founded in 2019, we build easy to use, integrated tools that enable our members to accept payments and boost business performance.

At Teya we believe small, local businesses are the lifeblood of our communities.

We‚Äôre here because we don‚Äôt believe there‚Äôs a level playing field that gives small businesses with a fighting chance against the giants of the high street.

We‚Äôre here because we see banks and legacy service providers making things harder for them. We don‚Äôt think the best technology or the best service should be reserved for those with the biggest headquarters.

We‚Äôre here to fight for a future where small, local businesses can thrive, and to commit the same dedication they offer all of us.

Become a part of our story.

We‚Äôre looking for exceptional talent to join our mission. We offer a chance to create impact in a high-energy and connected culture, while benefiting from continuous learning opportunities, a supportive community which is proud to serve our mission, and comprehensive benefits.

Your Mission

The Customer Risk Monitoring team is responsible for implementing and maintaining the analytical intelligence that protects Teya and its customers from financial risks, including fraud, money laundering, and terrorism financing. Our goal is to minimise financial losses and risk exposure while supporting and maintaining our customers' trust and ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements.

We work closely with the Operations team to investigate suspicious activities and collaborate cross-functionally with Compliance, Risk, Platform Engineering and product leaders to build and continuously improve the intelligence powering our detection and monitoring systems.

Your Role Will Include


Develop and refine the intelligence used to detect financial crime, balancing efficacy with operational efficiency to reduce false positives, investigation time, and customer friction
Deliver actionable insights that directly improve detection rates, uncover new risk patterns, and inform prevention strategies
Act as a bridge between data and the business, collaborating closely with Operations, Compliance, Engineering, and Product teams to shape and prioritise analytical initiatives
Identify opportunities to improve and automate monitoring, escalate emerging threats, and continuously evolve our understanding of risk
Build and maintain clear and impactful dashboards, reports, and documentation to monitor key metrics, surface relevant trends, and drive data-informed decisions
Partner with data engineering to design and maintain scalable, reliable data models and ETLs that underpin both operational and strategic use cases
Help define and analyse fraud and AML KPIs, helping the business plan and course-correct with confidence
Promote a culture of data-driven decision-making across the organisation


Your Story

We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst with a strong analytical foundation and a passion for tackling complex, ambiguous problems in the financial risk domain.

Must-haves


2+ years of professional experience as a data analyst, preferably in fraud, AML, or financial risk monitoring
Solid understanding of statistical concepts and experience applying methods such as forecasting, time series analysis, A/B testing, or regression analysis
Experience in producing insights that led to measurable improvements, ideally in relevant domains such as fraud, AML detection, or operations
Advanced proficiency in SQL and experience working with large, complex, and sometimes messy datasets
Experience designing, building, and maintaining ETL pipelines or data models, ideally using tools like dbt
Proficiency in Python for data analysis, including data manipulation, visualisation, and basic modelling
Strong data storytelling and communication skills: you can translate complex data into clear, actionable recommendations for both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Experience working collaboratively with cross-functional partners, including Operations, Compliance, Engineering and Product
Self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, high-ambiguity environment and takes ownership of their work from start to finish


Nice-to-haves


Experience in acquiring services or the payments industry
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics)
Direct experience with problems such as AML scenario tuning, fraud rule optimisation, or detection intelligence design
Familiarity with regulatory or compliance-driven analytics environments
Fincrime certifications such as CAMS, ICA, or equivalent


The Perks


We trust you, so we offer flexible working hours, as long it suits both you and your team;
Health Insurance;
Meal Allowance;
25 days of Annual leave (+ Bank holidays);
Public Transportation Card;
Frequent team events & activities in the office and outside;
Office snacks every day;
Friendly, comfortable and informal office environment.


Teya is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

We are committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone regardless of race, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, religion, or background can thrive and do their best work. We believe that a diverse team leads to better ideas, stronger outcomes, and a more supportive workplace for all.

If you require any reasonable adjustments at any stage of the recruitment process whether for interviews, assessments, or other parts of the application‚Äîwe encourage you to let us know. We are committed to ensuring that every candidate has a fair and accessible experience with us.
